Summary: We have been at this hotel twice. It is an excellent value. Great breakfast, friendly staff, comfortable bed and decent price.  Across the street from the outlets. Highly recommend. That’s it. TripAdvisor is making me type more.

Summary: This was my second time staying at this hotel for my Disneyland trip. It was even better the second time around. The hotel had been renovated since I last stayed. The room was spacious, and I had a room at the end of the hall, so it was very quiet. It was comfortable and clean. The front desk was able to hold my luggage for the day since I arrived well ahead of normal check in hours. All staff I encountered was courteous and helpful. Breakfast was included and had a good variety. The Disneyland shuttle was on time and easy to access. I’ll be checking here first for my next trip out to Anaheim!

Summary: This is really no more than the middle to bottom of 2.5 star hotels that serve breakfast.included and do not charge for parking.  The good:  very clean property and hospitable staff check in was very smooth.  Great young man named Christian M. should be congratulated. location right off highway 5 and only about 1.5 miles to Disneyland  The okay to bad.  Breakfast bar was okay and leaves a lot to be desired.   In this crowded space, similar hotels have waffle machines, a choice of juices, decaf and regular coffee, breakfast meats and cheeses, small boxes of cereals, etc.  Ayo had the same powdered eggs each morning, pancakes, and breakfast sausage, only OJ, only reg coffee, and what appeared to be discount unripened sliced fruit with washed out colors.   One day they did have

Summary: We just arrived at Alo Hotel with a reservation set up through a 3rd party website.  When we arrived we were told that the 3rd party had cancelled our reservation on Thursday and we did not have a reservation.  As we tried to hide our panic, Angelina, at the front desk was SO friendly and helpful! She really worked with us in getting us into a room at a cost close to what we had paid through the website.  We were set up in a beautiful King room.  The room is large and decorated modernly and is so clean! If we ever make it back to Anaheim we will absolutely stay here again!

I hope to welcome you back soon.  Sincerely,  Sandra Zuno General Manager

Summary: Loved Alo, they where very friendly,  prompt. The rooms where clean, with comfortable beds and well laid out. Breakfast was great. We unfourtunatley didnt get to try the resturant on site but Im sure it is great since everything else was. Will definetly stay here again.

Summary: We have stayed here many times and have enjoyed the very clean rooms, conscientious and warm staff, delicious full breakfast and easy parking in covered garage. We often travel with our elderly dog, and the ALO makes it very accommodating to include him in the experience. Thank you ALO!
Manager Response: none

Summary: The rooms were clean.  The staff was extremely courteous and went out of their way to make our stay comfortable. We could see the Disneyland fireworks from our window.  They had cookies out at night and the food was pretty good.

Summary: Very close from freeway and easy access. They have shuttle to Disneyland and parking is free! Clean room.  I was very happy to stay there. Late checkin is 2am. I was visiting Disneyland that day. From there it was just 6 min ! From freeway you can find easy ( you can see hotel). We got complement late checkout. We can checkout by 2pm. It was nice! I wish I have time to use their pool! Maybe next time!

Summary Heading: Clean and Quiet, with a friendly staff
Summary: This hotel is convenient to the Disneyland Resort. The staff is very friendly and helpful.  Our room was clean and quiet.  The bed was comfortable.  The free breakfast is much better than most hotels offer.

Summary: i love staying here because it’s super clean! No odors! This time i stayed on the 5th floor, usually im on first or second, seems the higher floors the better it smells.  If youre super organized kinda OCD like me this hotel is a great choice!!!

Summary: *The included breakfast is good but the fact that 100-200 styrofoam plates, bowls & cups are thrown away each day, plus plastic cutlery is shameful.  *Good location. Easy to catch city bus to explore the area. *They only had pool towels outside 1 day out of the 6 we used the pool.   *The doors are so loud to the rooms that forget about sleeping in past 6:00 am. Guests were so loud in the hallways it was difficult to get a good night sleep.  * Beds were comfortable but the shower barely had any pressure and hit water was hit & miss. * Reported that the hot tub jets were broken and it was fixed very quickly.   We would most likely not return due to the noisy room doors and the fact that they still use styrofoam dishes!

Summary: The hotel was great. The front desk staff was great during check in and even later in the evening when asking for another blanket. The room was nice and quiet and spacious. Do not have any complaints about the stay. Breakfast was in the restaurant attached and they had plenty of options every morning. We went to Disney during our stay and the hotel has a shuttle service for a small round trip fee. Would not hesitate to stay here again.

Summary: Well first off we were able to check in early, check in was smooth and fast. Our room was very clean and updated. We were on the top floor on the west side so we were able to watch the Disneyland fireworks every night. Breakfast was very good, and well stocked every morning. The staff was always very friendly and helpful. I loved that they had refreshments in the lobby, it was nice to get a cup of ice water, after a long hot day at Disneyland. The pool is on the smaller side, but its clean and taken care of. The hotel is only  10 minute walk to the outlets, and only a 10 minute bus ride to Disneyland. I would definitely stay here again, and suggest it to someone else.

Summary: The hotel itself was fairly nice, probably worthy of a 3 outta 5 rating here on Trip Advisor based on all other factors besides the uninformed staff and the grief they caused us. When we booked the hotel, we called the hotel DIRECTLY (not the booking service) and we asked them if their 2 queen room had room for a roll-away or our airbed (we are 2 adults and 3 kids). We were told that yes, the room will accommodate 5 people. When we arrived, the desk clerk checked us in and when we got to the room we discovered that there is no room for the airbed that we brought. The room (#600) looked nothing like the spacious rooms shown on their web page. We figured that maybe since it was a corner room, a regular room would have more space. We went back down and spoke to the clerk who told
Manager Response: Dear bobfreyhomes,  Thank you kindly for taking the time to share your feedback. Though I regret to see that your experience was anything less than exceptional, I certainly do appreciate the insight provided as it will allow us to make improvements wherever necessary. Sadly, our records indicate that your reservation was booked through a third party. You may have spoken on the phone with Getaway Today directly, but unfortunately, you never reached our hotel nor spoke to an Ayres team member directly. Oftentimes, third parties do not disclose who they are and let customer believe they have reached the hotel directly just so that they can secure a reservation. Please accept my sincere apologies on behalf of Getaway Today for their lack of transparency. Rest assured that our team members are well aware that the max occupancy of all of our guestrooms is not to exceed four because anything more than four guests per room poses a safety hazard. Nevertheless, we will ensure our team is well informed and knowledgeable of information such as breakfast times. In the future, we kindly ask that you reach us directly at 800-764-4614 or by email at reservations@ayreshotels.com for the personalized service our guests have come to love. Thank you again for your kind insight.  Sincerely,  Sandra Zuno General Manager

Summary Heading: Great Hotel. Great Staff. Great Location
Summary: My wife and I stayed here during our visit to Orange County. Very helpful staff and customer service was great as well. Rooms are very clean and smelt great. Beds were comfy and you wake up well rested. breakfast is basic but okay. The hotel is very close to Disney World and provides shuttles to Disney as well (Most hotels around here do anyway). This hotel or its sister next-door hotel - Ayres, are excellent and I would recommend them to anyone visiting Orange County. The Christ Cathedral is just a walking distance and is an architectural master-piece.

Summary: We booked this hotel for our Disneyland vacation and we were very happy with our 6 night stay. Great covered parking,  complimentary hot breakfast, our room King room was clean, comfy and spacious and the staff was very friendly. It's a cross the hospital so there are sirens through our stay but didn't both us one bit. Great location, Starbucks is right across the way too! We would book again. It's only a few minutes to Disneyland by car. Forgot to take pics of the front but here's a few pics of the parking and property. Ayres hotel is right beside Alo and FYI it's pet friendly too!

Summary: Nice welcome ,easy check in ,all staff very polite ,big room with great big bed very comfy .had the bonus of seeing Disney fireworks nearly every night. Breakfast was free throughout our stay and very good .tea ,coffee,water,milk,juice to drink ,scrambled eggs ,sausage ,bacon ,pancakes ,cereals and fresh fruit as much as you wanted .plenty of free parking ,free WiFi. Take the ART bus to Disney cheaper than parking and less hassle (although they drive like ex NASCAR drivers )all part of the fun .shame there was no gift shop or vending machine but that is a small thing .You will need to drive to eat ,only a Mexican restaurant and a Wendy's close by .all in all a great stay

Summary: I tried a new hotel.  I decided to give it shot.   I got a pretty good price but I had a few issues.    The staff were welcoming. It was easy to check in.   I walked in and there was a musty smell.  I thought I'd give it a break but it got worse.   I tried the wifi and the speed was pretty slow I could not check Facebook or use my tablet for streaming. The hotel has been renovated.  So bed is nice.  Bathroom is nice. But room just is old.   I will not stay again since I needed to be at the convention center.  I will pay the extra $20 a day to stay closer  But there are more options nearby that have better amenities   Pros : Bed is comfy  Bathroom is spacious.  All new fixtures  Plenty of plugins for phone etc  Breakfast is free  Close to attractions  Food nearby   Cons: Wifi is
Manager Response: Dear Visente A,  Thank you kindly for your candid review and rating. Your honest feedback is greatly appreciated as it allows us to make improvements wherever necessary. Summary: Alo is somewhere in between corporate and boutique. We stayed here for a wedding held down the street. Rooms are very comfortable. Executive rooms are a great value and quite large.   Restaurant is Mexican fusion and is exceptional and comfortable. My group watched a Dodger playoff game in the bar. I’m sure we were crazy loud but we were also fun and (I hope respectful and appropriate). I only bring it up because the staff seemed to be down for our fun as long as it didn’t ruin things for others.   If you care about a fitness center this is not for you. I’m in training so I needed to work out and the fitness closet is barely serviceable. This day and age in a hotel this nice, and with this much competition, Alo has to step it up.   Also on the negative if you’re staying multiple
Manager Response: Dear Nickwarner,  Thank you kindly for your candid review. Your compliments regarding our unbeatable value and spacious accommodations are greatly appreciated. Summary Heading: TripAdvisor was spot on - great choice, ticking all our boxes!
Summary: I needed a great value hotel near Disneyland for my family. Partial to the chains where I have status, I was annoyed that these hotels either charged for parking or had mediocre breakfast options (some of which were an extra charge). I took a leap of faith and went with the Alo because it was among the top two Disneyland hotels on TripAdvisor. Good call! Here is why:  1) Free parking! 2) Free hot breakfast. Not necessarily gourmet, but all the basics and my kids were happy. Coffee was fine.  3) Staff were great. Beds were comfy. Requests were accommodated with a smile. Given the reasonable prices, I was expecting some sort of catch, but there was none.. All the staff seemed to be interested in a great guest experience.  Highly recommended!

Summary: We were trying to find a pet friendly hotel because our daughter went into labor. We were so impressed with this hotel, the rooms were clean and it did not smell like dogs were ever in the room.  We have been to other pet friendly hotels and they were bad. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Summary: Great hotel for the price we paid. Continental buffet breakfast daily and the ART bus pick was in front of the hotel itself. This hotel is also around 10 mins walk to Orange outlets. Don’t forget to try Lucille’s bbq near this place and if you want cheap chinese food there is a hong kong joint at the end of the street in front of Lucille’s. Thank you for the lovely staff and free upgrade, we will definitely see you again in the future.

Summary: This is an outstanding hotel if you are wanting to go to an event at Anaheim stadium ore and shopping in and around hotel an added feature it is located right off the 15 freeway. Service was great everything clean as an added bonus hotel is attached to a restaurant.

Summary: Overall this hotel was wonderful.  Clean rooms, great staff and a really nice free breakfast. Also only 10 mins from Disneyland. Only negative thing to say is that it looks like they went thru a  refurbishment lately and it kinda looks like they were rushing. Minor things we noticed in the room was the carpet that wasn’t cut flush with the wall, the   Ceiling And walls had gougues in them and the shower head that had been caulked was coming undone. Other then those very minor things it was a great stay and we’d stay again if we’re every back in CA.

Summary Heading: Came for baseball at Angels Stadium
Summary: We came to watch the A’s play the Angels.  The hotel was convenient, close to I5.  We took Uber to the stadium.  Hotel was comfortable, clean.  Updates made it feel more modern.  Breakfast was included.  The nightly rate was reasonable.  I originally booked only one night on Expedia.  We decided to come a day earlier than planned.  I called the hotel and they were able to accommodate the additional night under a separate reservation for the same room type.  (Expedia wanted me to book a different room type for the extra night.)  All of the staff members were friendly.  It was a good experience and we would stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: After planning a trip to Disneyland for two days with my family, we ended up choosing ALO Hotel. It was honestly a really good hotel. Really like the location of it , had free breakfast (typical hotel breakfast), and had free parking (a parking garage. It was about 7 to 10 minutes away from Disneyland land on an uber which ended up being around $14 round trip each day. Which wassnt bad at all. The hotel also had a shuttle every hour that came to and from Disneyland right to the hotel lobby which was pretty cool. Also had a mall that was like a 15 minute walk which was convenient. Now the hotel was good tthe bed was always done, towels were replaced. Didnt smell weird, decently large (The double queen room) so i was really happy with that. So it was your normal 4 star hotel up to
Manager Response: none

Summary: The ALO is very clean and comfortable. All staff we interacted with were friendly, responsive, and dedicated to making sure we had a great stay. We had some specific requests for our room, which they easily accommodated. The included breakfast was excellent. Beds were extremely comfortable and the mini fridge in the room was handy. Great value for the price. Location is good. It's too far from Disneyland to walk, but the ART transit is available. It's right next to a Starbucks, which was awesome for getting coffee before Disneyland. We would definitely stay here agin!
Manager Response: Dear Chelseaf907,  Thank you kindly for your candid review and rating. I am pleased to see that you enjoyed your stay at ALO Hotel. Your compliments regarding our comfortable accommodations, attentive team members, and premium amenities are greatly appreciated. Thank you again for the insight you have shared, I look forward to welcoming you back.  Sincerely,  Sandra Zuno General Manager

Summary: My shower wouldn’t drain and when I asked them if there was something maintenance could fix they said that there was no maintenance. I’m sure that a working shower is included in the price that I paid to stay here..
Manager Response: Dear Red O,  Thank you so much for your review. Please accept my most sincere apologies for falling short of our highest commitment, providing an exceptional guest experience. Rest assured that this isolated incident will serve as a training opportunity and will allow us to make improvements wherever necessary. I hope you consider staying with us in the future and allow us the opportunity to provide you with the exceptional stay that you deserve.  Sincerely,  Sandra Zuno General Manager

Summary: We only stayed one night but we loved this hotel.  From the tiling in the shower to the fluffy blankets on our bed.  The decor was great, modern, and comfortable.  Free breakfast and free parking were wonderful additions to our stay.  This combination is very hard to find so close to Disneyland.  We drove to Disneyland and just paid the parking fee.  Most hotels in the area charge more per day in their parking lots than what Disney charges so we actually saved money by staying here.  The staff was very professional and had everything ready for us when we checked in.  They even offered us a complimentary late check out time of 2 pm!  This will be my hotel of choice every time we visit Disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear mirabellaseattle,  Thank you for taking the time to write a thorough review of your recent stay at ALO Hotel. I am pleased to see that you enjoyed your stay as well as the premium amenities we offer. Thank you for your compliments regarding our decor, comfortable accommodations, and our attentive team members. Your insight is greatly appreciated and I hope to welcome you back soon.  Sincerely,  Sandra Zuno General Manager

Summary: I can’t say enough about ALO, I love this hotel! The staff are so friendly and helpful and they always make me feel welcomed! I live an hour and a half away, but when I want some me time I come here. Can’t wait to come back!
Manager Response: Dear Kelly C,  Thank you kindly for the great review and for your loyalty to our hotel. Your compliments regarding our attentive team members are greatly appreciated. We certainly appreciate your wonderful feedback and cannot wait to welcome you back!  Sincerely,  Sandra Zuno General Manager

Summary: Definitely recommend this hotel.  Great service, the front desk was especially accomadating.  The breakfast was good too.  We had cereal, bread, juice, coffee, pancakes.  We walked the the Angel stadium from here.
Manager Response: Dear krg999,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review letting others know about your experience at ALO Hotel. I am happy that you enjoyed your stay as well as the exceptional service we strive to provide our guests. Thank you for the recommendations of our hotel as well as the great compliments you have shared. I hope to welcome you back soon.  Sincerely,  Sandra Zuno General Manager

Summary: My family and I went to Orange County for my bday weekend and decided to stay at ALO Hotel, overall the experience was great, the only negative thing I have to say is that the lights went out our first morning around 6:30am and didn’t return back until 7:50am, I literally had to shower in the dark but other than that the experience was break, front desk have great customer service and free breakfast is great also! Thank you ALO Hotel!!
Manager Response: Dear angomez101,  Thank you so much for your candid review. I am pleased to see that you enjoyed your stay at ALO Hotel. The feedback you have provided is greatly appreciated and will be used to make improvements wherever necessary. Thank you for your compliments regarding the exceptional service we strive to provide and premium amenities we offer. I look forward to your next visit.  Sincerely,  Sandra Zuno General Manager

Summary: This hotel has been totally remodeled and is clean and modern. The staff was friendly and helpful. The bed was very comfortable. There was coffee and lemon water available anytime in the lobby and cookies most of the time. The only way we knew it was on older hotel was because the bathrooms and elevators were small. There was free internet, parking and breakfast! And no resort fee! The breakfast was adequate but not spectacular. The eggs were overcooked one day, but there were other options. The wifi kicked me out when I left the property which was a bit frustrating. Seven minutes from the Toy Story parking lot. Overall, we were very pleased. Got a very reasonable price on hotwire.
Manager Response: Dear FrancesC1434,  Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review. I am delighted to see that you enjoyed our new look, attentive service, and comfortable accommodations. The feedback you have provided is greatly appreciated. I hope to welcome you back in the future.  Sincerely,  Sandra Zuno General Manager

Summary: Stayed for one night with my wife and 11 month old son and we had such a pleasant stay! The young lady and the gentleman at the front desk are friendly and awesome. Quick check in and the room was very, very clean. The pool area is nice and clean, the cleaning ladies were cool peoples, and they have free parking! It was close to the block of orange which offers a lot of options for shopping and dining as well as entertainment. It's literally a 3 minute drive to Angel Stadium and a 7 minute drive to Disneyland. My only complaints are that half of the channels on our TV did not work but it might not be like that for the rooms. Definitely would stay here again. Thanks ALO hotel!
Manager Response: Dear realmovesbrand,  Thank you so much for sharing your feedback! I am glad that you enjoyed your time at ALO Hotel. I also appreciate the concerns you have raised and can assure you that we will look into the issue. Thank you again for your review, I look forward to welcoming you back. Summary: The second stop in our baseball stadium tour of California was Anaheim.  We chose the ALO Hotel as it is very close to Angels Stadium, to John Wayne Airport and not next door to Disneyland. The hotel is very clean.  Staff was very friendly and was able to answer all our questions about local eateries and shopping.  Our room was quiet and we did not feel crammed into a room and a bed.   The ALO has a very good breakfast buffet.  Everything was hot and well stocked, you could also sit in the restaurant as the breakfast room was pretty small. The restaurant/bar attached to the hotel was very convenient and served good food.  The hotel does have a pool and spa but we were too busy to use them.  They did look well taken care of and there were plenty of pools towels available. Check

Summary: Everything was great.  Location, parking, breakfast, rooms were clean.  Staff was very helpful and friendly.  Loved it.  Easy to find. Also had a parking structure so there was plenty of parking.  Lobby was nice.Plenty of seating for breakfast.

Summary: The check-in was quick and friendly. The free parking and inclusion of breakfast in the rate were also appreciated. The room was clean, a late check-out was confirmed at check-in and considering we were only there for 2 nights, we were content. Plus we had free Wi-fi and it was about 10 minutes away from Disney.   Unfortunately, the fridge made a ringing sound throughout our stay once we plugged it in. Facing the freeway, we were subjected to sirens and loud vehicles randomly throughout the night. There was barely any water pressure in the shower and the breakfast wasn't something to wake up for. Partly because it was served in a room that was relatively dingy when compared to the rest of the hotel.   Although the coffee was available around the clock, it could do with an

I hope to welcome you back in the future.  Sincerely,  Sandra Zuno General Manager

Summary: Super clean room and well maintained like new. The outlook is aged, but the inside is excellent. Staff are courteous and professional. There is warm buffet breakfast. Best Buy and Wendy's is near by, shopping center in walking distance. UCI medical center is cross the street. It has easy access. You can hear Disney fireworks.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very clean updated and modern. Just stayed one night to go see the Angels game. Very close to the game and Disney.  Beds were comfortable and breakfast was decent.  No decaf coffee though. Would definitely stay again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Still My Hotel of Choice When Visiting Disneyland
Summary: This hotel has it all.  Clean, modern rooms with a mini-fridge.  Friendly staff.  Great location within 5-10 minute walk of the Outlets at Orange with many restaurants, shops, and an AMC 30.  Short (10 minute) hourly non-stop ART shuttle service to and from Disneyland (route #14).  On-site restaurant (Anepalco) that seems popular with locals (although I admit I've never had a meal there).  Adjacent Wendy's and Starbucks.  Reasonable room rates.  Free parking (on-site multi-level parkade).  Free Wi-Fi.  Free breakfast buffet (although not being a morning person I am never up early enough to make use of it).  Not to mention my favorite room feature -- the shelving units in each room are so convenient!  The only thing I can possibly complain about is the cable TV service doesn't
Manager Response: Dear Brent E,  Thank you kindly for taking the time to write a review. I am pleased to see that you enjoyed your stay and greatly appreciate the feedback you have provided. Thank you for the kind compliments regarding our amenities, accommodations, and value. I sincerely hope we remain your top choice when visiting Orange County!  Sincerely,  Sandra Zuno General Manager

Summary: Great hotel.. Easy drive to DL parking, Block shops and food spots.. Very good complimentary breakfast, and free parking and WiFi.. Disney passholders get a discount Rooms are very nice, liked the remodel very spacious and well equiped as well.. Friendly staff

Summary: A very convenient location while visiting a patient at UC Irvine Hospital: The walk is .3 mile to the hospital. ALO staff members were pleasant. When I extended my stay after I had checked out, I had to change rooms. Both queen rooms had comfortable mattresses and were clean, relatively large, and quiet from hallway noise. The second room faced the noisy freeway -- I recommend asking for a room away from the freeway. I tried breakfast the first morning, but there weren't healthful options (mostly sweetened and no-fat foods), so I went for protein boxes the other mornings at the Starbucks, almost next door.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Everyone was very attentive, great service, breakfast was great and the rooms where very comfortable, location is good, food and shopping nearby, the shuttles to the parks are very convenient. Great place to stay.

Summary Heading: Great Price, Awesome Staff, Clean Accommodations (With Just a Few Small Personal Negatives)
Summary: When we went to the hotel to see if it was possible to check in early (we arrived at the hotel around noon) they were more than accommodating and were able to get us checked in and into a nice clean room in a matter of less than 10 minutes!  The employees were always quick and helpful while also being very friendly every time we encountered any of them (cleaning staff, front desk, food service, etc) during our 1 ½ week stay.  The breakfast here in the mornings were ok…nothing to write home about, but it did the job and it was included with the price of the room so I can’t really complain too much (though if they had had bacon more often than sausage that would have been nice, lol).  The room we were in was well appointed and clean, my only real complaints there were that the
Manager Response: Dear danielleeu9,  Thank you kindly for your candid review. The feedback and honesty you have provided is greatly appreciated. Summary: 3rd time there for helping son move back into School...convenient location.   Our experience was the same...reasonable priced, very friendly staff, clean room, comfortable bed and the free parking/breakfast is a bonus, even took in a few hours at the pool!   Small workout space with basic machines, enough to break a sweat/clear your head, plus... you can see the Disney fireworks (weather depending) from your room on the upper floors around 9:00-ish!  There was an AC issue in the hallway but did not effect our room.  Will go back for sure.

Thank you kindly for your review, I look forward to welcoming you back for the 4th time!  Sincerely,  Sandra Zuno General Manager

Summary: Hotel is in a great location, rooms are very clean, bed is very comfortable and staf is very friendly. Free breakfast and parking. Quiet as well. During our stay the area was under a heat wave but the air conditioning in the room was perfect. They also offer a state rate for state employees!!!

Summary: ALO provided us with a great and comfortable stay. Our room was clean as well as the bathrooms, room is also spacious. Quiet hotel despite many families staying there due to Disneyland. Area was quiet as well.. free parking and free breakfast.

Summary Heading: Not having a good time here.
Summary: The room is OK not really clean. Lots of ants are running along side of the room's corners. The hallway was hot without air conditioning running. The elevators so small, old, hot, and slow moving with noises.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Poor excuse for a remodeled hotel
Summary: We usually stay at the Ayres next door, which is a lovely property.   We mistakenly booked this hotel instead, and were we disappointed.  The rooms were small.  The elevator was so small, it was unable to fit the luggage cart and more than 1 person.  I am unsure if any of us had ever been in such a cramped and dated elevator.  I chose to take the stairs during the duration of our stay for fear the elevator might break down.  The pool was small and uninviting.  We were informed the hotel had been completely remodeled.  Unfortunately, it should have been started from the ground up.  There is only so much you can do with a dated shell.  This was not Ayres quality, both in comfort and in lack of staff accommodation.
Manager Response: Dear Coldwell,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review and rate our hotel. Though I regret to see that your experience was less than exceptional, I truly appreciate the honesty of your review. It saddens me to see that our renovations were not to your liking, nevertheless, I thank you for staying with us and for your review. I hope your future accommodations are comfortable and satisfying.  Sincerely,  Sandra Zuno General Manager

Summary: Awesome hotel. The services are pretty standard but the staff is what makes this hotel better than others. Disney transportation is not free but I don’t think many if any hotels in the area include transportation. They don’t transport to universal but Uber is pretty cheap and easy to get around in the LA area.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We generally stay at the Ayres hotels in Anaheim and tried this one out for the lower price. We had to cross the street to get to pool since there was construction. Worth it since it’s a saltwater pool! The breakfast is good but not as customized as the other Ayres hotels. If you want a clean and modern hotel with free coffee in lobby and convenient location to many shops, then this hotel is for you!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Excellent customer service in a stressful situation
Summary: We travelled to SoCal from Redding, CA for a baseball tournament just as the Carr Fire took off in Redding. Our coach was called back to help with evacuations and all of our families were worried as we were hearing about friends & families houses burning while our boys were trying to get their heads in the games, without a coach.  To get away from the craziness for a night as my husband had to step in as coach and chaperone for a room of boys, I booked a room at the ALO for me and my daughter. Angelina was wonderful at check in and looked through all the available rooms to find one we’d like. She did an excellent job and was so kind and efficient in answering all my questions. Our room is very clean and has a desk, bench, LG TV, 2 comfortable queen beds, a coffee maker,
Manager Response: none

Summary: The ALO hotel is in a perfect location for eating, shopping, and entertainment. Everyone at the hotel was so friendly and accommodating. The rooms were big and clean. The breakfast was delicious and way better than a continental breakfast.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Amazing value, can’t recommend more highly
Summary: - clean, comfortable, spacious rooms with all the amenities. beds are comfortable and the rooms feel high quality. Felt like a high end hotel.  - easy booking, friendly front desk staff - great location  - the restaurant is fabulous, Anepalco is amazing and the free breakfast was really good.  - such a great find for the price!
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is a decently “refreshed” hotel From some other chain. But there are some outdated items that remain. The AC is controlled from the window unit itself and there was not a way in my Room to leave the fan on without the unit either being in cooling or heating mode. The bath is tiny and it’s lighting Is awful- so bring your makeup mirror. The elevators are tiny saunas. The pool Is nice enough. The breakfast has scrambled eggs and a protein, plus the usual continental items. The coffee is dreary and there is only “fake” cream. Everyone is very nice and everything is very clean. But inflated Anaheim prices and the number of awful old Motels here make this place seem a lot better than it really is in the wider world of hotels.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at the ALO for a quick Disney trip. During our stay, we we were not at the hotel enough time to take full advantage of most of the amenities. The room was pretty basic so not much to rave about there. However, we found the breakfast to be a step above others with eggs, sausage, and pancakes and the front desk team to be very friendly and helpful. We used the (ART) shuttle for Disney which pretty much pulls up to the front door of the hotel. An added bonus is that there are no stops between you the hotel and the Magic Kingdom coming or going. Just a short, 10-minute hop and you are either at the park or, at the  end of the night, back at the hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I reserved a room 3 months or more in advance as a king room and when we arrived they could only give me two queen beds. 😐 I understand it says could happen but there should be a benefit to me for booking my room so far in advance not treat me like I walked in off the street and asked for a room. Air conditioning didn’t work never got under 80. Other than that staff was friendly and room were nice. And super amazing shuttle serivice to and from Disney!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I was in urgent need of a 'same night' hotel room and ALO was one of only a few available. I wasn't expecting much but was happily surprised. Cute, clean, very pleasantly decorated - the the beds are super comfortable.

Summary: We used this as our base for Disney and various other area activities.  Good location, free parking, free breakfast and helpful staff.  Breakfast was quite extensive, and a good way to start.  Free cookies in the afternoon, if you can get to them before they disappear :)  Easy access to Disneyland (ART), and a good pool for cooling down.  Also nice to have laundry on site.

Summary: Love the location and the amenities of this hotel. When I visit my family in OC, I need some space that is accessible to lots of things and is reasonable in price. ALO is perfect for all those needs and I will always default to this hotel for when I visit OC!

Summary: The best value of this hotel is its location across the street from the UCI Hospital. If you're doing any surgery there, you can walk to all appointments. Also, three blocks to the south is an outlet mall with 15+ restaurants.
Manager Response: Dear Sirjames600,  Thank you for your candid review. I am happy to see that you enjoyed your stay at ALO Hotel. Your compliment regarding the value we provide is greatly appreciated. Thank you for your feedback, I hope to welcome you back soon.  Sincerely,  Sandra Zuno General Manager

Summary Heading: One of the best in Anaheim
Summary: This was our second time at this hotel and it did not disappoint. Very close to theme parks (both Disneyland and Great Wolf Lodge). The receptionists are usually always so nice (We experienced only one grumpy receptionist, but it was late and maybe he had a bad day, so we gave him the benefit of the doubt). We love the complimentary refreshments in the lobby, and the cookies we've had were super yummy! Our rooms are always very clean, including the showers, which are hard to come by at any hotel. Check-in and check-out are always fast and easy. Breakfast is pretty standard, but who doesn't love free food?! I love ALO and I plan to stay here again. I'd love to try out Ayres as well, but ALO is a more affordable option for us :)
Manager Response: none

Summary: We are using ALO as a home base this week seeing family. Then San Diego and come back to see more family. Staying here twice in a week. Very nice room, queen facing the night fireworks show at Disney.  Breakfast is acceptable. Buffet.  Scrambled eggs and potatoes. Sausage one day. Pancake. Fruit and yogurt.  Nothing to order.  There is a shuttle for all the airports and Disney, all pay.  There is a fitness center, not seen yet but I will look before we go today. Very clean, quiet carpeted halls. Dual elevators.  I think this will be our fourth stay here. A super choice for our stay In Anaheim.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Room was dirty and smelly with poor ventilation. The staff were impolite and did not listen to you. Very narrow minded, not cultural sensitive.. really horrible and aggressive. I will not recommend anyone to stay there
Manager Response: none

Summary: Really awesome hotel.  The staff was super friendly and helpful.  I ended up very early for check and they were able to get me into a room right away.  Any questions I had were answered right away.  The rooms are pretty big with lots of storage.  The beds were comfortable and clean.  The hotel is close to restaurants and fast food.  We used the ART bus system to go to the Disneyland parks and the stop is right in front of the hotel which is super convenient.  The staff always said hi when we were coming in for the day and they were always upbeat.  The hotel is nice but the staff being so helpful and polite really sell this hotel for me.  I come to Disneyland twice a year and I will definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hotel was clean. Staff were friendly. Plenty of space to park. Breakfast was great. I would stay at this hotel again. The hotel is located next to Starbucks and Wendy’s. The location of the hotel is great.

Summary: The room was fine- doors are super thin- walls are thin- noise from street due to old poor quality windows- dirty small bathroom! It was loud- slamming doors in hallway- heard other rooms TV noise- kids screaming in other rooms- and people walking down hall! It was convenient for getting to Disneyland with the shuttle service, free bteakfast so we could get out the door quickly, and nice staff! I would NOT stay here again! I got a great price and that is why we chose this hotel- pay more and stay at another Ayres- it’s not worth the savings to stay here.

Summary: We love staying at the ALO Hotel.  First this is an Ayres property and we find them to always be clean and the staff friendly.  The ALO Hotel has free parking and breakfast.  It is easy to hop on the ART to get to Disneyland.  It stops right outside the hotel.  We also found it was pretty cheap to take a Lyft also.  The staff if really friendly, and I mean everyone.  From the person that checks you in, to the gentleman that is cleaning outside, to the cleaning team and the breakfast attendants.  Everyone is nice.  We really appreciate that.  The room is always clean, and pretty spacious.  The beds were comfortable.  This is our new go to place when we visit Disneyland.  We really enjoyed our stay. Oh and ask for a room on the side facing Best Buy.  We were able to see the

Summary: Just checking out and we loved this hotel. Had a beautiful spacious room that was spotless. A great king size bed and we had a great view of the fireworks at Disney every night. The best thing about this lovely hotel are the staff always smiling and nothing was every to much for them. Thanks so much for making our honeymoon extra special at the Alo.

Summary: I have stayed at quite a few hotels in Southern California and this is by far the best I am so glad I found it a few years ago.   I will not stay anywhere else when I travel to SoCal   It’s a block to orange outlets and a couple miles to Disney.     Close enough to la and San Diego to visit for a day and still make it back to quiet.

Summary Heading: Near to the Family; lots of kids
Summary: We stayed here to be close to family for graduation.   Pros: Very clean, great staff, amazing Mexican restaurant attached, (best chiliquiles) near shopping (the Block)   Cons: breakfast hours are way Too LIMITED! Ends at 9, or 9:30 weekends.   Small bathroom hard to get ready with 2 people. Shower is ok.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great small hotel convenient to lots
Summary: We Used the ALO for a place for our out of town guests to staying while attending our wedding.   Very helpful front desk attendants made it easy for the out of town people to feel at ease.   The staff  was great and made it easy for us to worry about our wedding instead of our guests.   Thank you
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Decent, comfortable lodging, across the street from UC Irvine Medical Center
Summary: I came here for an interview across the street. It is an extremely convenient location for this purpose. The rooms are comfortable, if slightly old. There is a slightly outdated feel, but everything is clean and in working order. Breakfast is not bad, with everything you would expect from a hotel of this caliber. Guest services is very polite and quick with your requests. I would definitely stay again!
Manager Response: none

Summary: All was exceptional.  Great hotel, great price.  Room was exceptionally clean and quiet, though on busy street.  Front desk and housekeeping staff were friendly and able to answer any questions.  Nice to have a hot breakfast available rather than the typical "continental" style breakfast.  This will be our new go-to hotel when in the area.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great hotel for a great price
Summary: I felt very safe in this hotel traveling solo.  Staff could not have been friendlier or more efficient.  My room was clean on arrival and refreshed daily although I never saw a single member of the housekeeping staff.  The hot buffet breakfast was a great way to start the day.  Some renovation going on so some areas looked a little rough but construction noise was never a problem.  The room was well appointed but the bathroom was tiny.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Had a one night stay, so not a lot of time to judge. The staff was extremely courteous and agreeable; helped with early check in and late check out, as well as the usual questions. The hotel is very attractive and clean, it and my room were a little small, but for just one, it was all I needed. Re-tiling going on in some areas, so a little rough there, which is the only reason I gave less than 5 points. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.
Manager Response: none

Summary: A perfect location for attending Chapman University commencement on May 20th (we saw several residents who were obviously going to Disneyland -- a nearby attraction that would be a good draw, too).  The room was neat.  And we lucked out with a decent view, as well.  The hotel was undergoing some renovation (new tile on each floor level), so part of it had the unfinished look that goes with renovation.  We did report a frantic barking dog in a room across the hall from us one midday, but the staff immediately took care of that problem.  The lobby is small and not very comfortable, and the breakfast was certainly adequate, but spending time in the lobby or having a gourmet breakfast weren't our goals.  For us, the important things were:  quiet, helpful staff, location, and price.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was the hotel chosen by my school, meaning, this is the one they have is a discount with. This hotel was beautiful! I love the new color combinations, new carpet, the restaurant attached was delicious, the complimentary breakfast was delicious, and the staff were all polite and accommodating. I would definitely stay at this hotel again! It was also good for my family (husband and 6 year old son). Only pictures I took were of a dish I ate at the restaurant next door.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Nicely located for Orange County. Very Freindly Staff, acknowledge customers with smiles and greetings each time you walk in.Professionally dressed. Clean and spacious room. Breakfast was delicious. Will be staying there again in the near future. ALO is a great Hotel to stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Clean, quiet hotel close to Disneyland. Nicely appointed, family friendly hotel. Beds were firm but comfortable. Free breakfast was nice. Plenty of free parking on site. Close to the Outlets and local restaurants.

Summary Heading: Great hotel for a great price
Summary: Stayed here for a night for a wedding, but will definitely come back if I ever need a hotel for Disneyland.  Great little hotel with excellent staff and rooms. The Mexican restaurant was also a nice perk, very cute with great food.  The breakfast offered in the morning was also a great deal, not your usual boring breakfast with toast and coffee.  Definitely recommend!

Summary Heading: Excellent Location, Wonderful Staff, Best Value
Summary: ALO has been our hotel of choice for multiple visits to the University of CA Medical Center which is located directly across the street. The hotel staff has been ultra accommodating and the quality of service has been consistent each visit. There are many options for dining and retail at the Outlet Mall within walking distance. ALO has a morning complimentary breakfast and free onsite parking. We recommend ALO to anyone going to Disney or UCI Medical Center or other venues in the area.

Summary: This hotel is centrally located to everything touristy in Anaheim. It's within walking distance of Angel Stadium, short drive to Disneyland, walking distance to the Outlet Mall. The electrical outlets didn't generate enough power to charge my completely dead phone and headphones. Luckily I had a portable charger that I was able to use to give those devices enough juice to be at like 10%. At that point I was able to plug them in and charge them using an outlet. Summary Heading: My Hotel of Choice When Visiting Disneyland Resort
Summary: ALO Hotel continues to be my hotel of choice when visiting Disneyland Resort.  Hourly non-stop ART shuttle service to nearby Disneyland Resort.  Very recently upgraded guest rooms.  Convenient shelving and closet area provides plenty of storage.  Adjacent to Wendy's, Best Buy, and Starbucks.  An approximate 10 minute walk to the Outlets at Orange with AMC 30 and plenty of shopping and dining choices.  A great place to stay in the Anaheim/Orange area!  My one and only complaint (and only reason for not giving ALO Hotel a perfect score) is the Time Warner cable service isn't great.  No on-screen guide and a limited selection of channels.  My hope is DirecTV service will be added soon (as in the adjacent Ayres Hotel Orange) with an on-screen guide and a better selection of channels.

Summary: The whole bridal party booked this hotel based on the strong recommendation of our wedding venue. Manager Response: none

Manager Response: none

Summary: I was there for a conference. I really loved the hotel. It was clean and looked fairly new :) it was also pretty quiet. The staff was polite and knowledgeable of the area. Breakfast was very good. Would chose it again if i go there.

Summary: Best place to stay if you are going to Disneyland with family. Really nice clean quiet place. Staff was awesome though I feel front desk should have little knowledge about local attractions and restaurants and things to do kind of stuff, but all around best trip Thank You.

Summary: Arrived to a clean room and nice staff, nice restaurant in walking distance (and fast food too).  We would definitely stay here again.  Check out time is noon, which is very nice and our only recommendation is that complimentary breakfast be available until 10:00 a.m.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Wonderful hotel in a central location for any Angels games
Summary: Easily one of the best 'bang for your buck' hotels I've ever been to. Great rooms with great beds, nothing too fancy as far as the shower or television, but all I needed was to sleep comfortably and safely. I also enjoyed the Tesla destination chargers being in a well lit, easy to access/exit garage too. The breakfast was phenomenal and FREE! I mean damn, they had actual hot eggs (not that weird water based set of eggs but actual cracked and cooked eggs) with delicious sausages, pancakes, fruit, cereal, oatmeal, coffee, juice, and water. It was wonderful and I appreciated it so much.   I will definitely stay here again. I got this room for such a great deal and it made getting to the Angels vs. Athletics game an absolute breeze.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My trip to this area was to visit my Sister in the UC Irvine Hospital located across the street from the ALO Hotel.  I had two conversations with the Front Desk Clerk prior to my arrival and could not have found a more helpful and caring ALO representative.  This experience continued from check-in to check-out.  The decor of the lobby is inviting.  Whether you want a cup of coffee, tea or water, it's available 24 hrs. no charge.  The room was nicely decorated and I can honestly say the mattress was the best I have encountered in my travels.  The complimentary breakfast was satisfactory and I appreciated the amount of tables available for eating.  You did not feel you had to rush so another guest could sit down.  Room rates very reasonable. I would definitely stay at an ALO Hotel
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had 4 rooms here for 6 nights The staff was very friendly and willing to help They answered all our questions and went beyond what was expected  The rooms were clean and the beds are very comfortable  The breakfast area was clean and the food was good I wish they would have had something other than sausages every day  When they did have something different it was gone quick and back to sausage  I would recommend this place to anyone

Summary Heading: You Get What You Pay For
Summary: front desk staff was very nice.  there was some construction going on, so during the day it was a bit noisy.  There was a group of highschoolers in the hotel and everything that they did in the hallways can be heard from our room.  at 11pm, it sounded like one of the girls was screaming which sounded like it was right in our room.   rooms were tastefully decorated, but you can definitely tell where the contractor cut corners. the bathroom toilet was clogged when we got into the room.    Breakfast was toast, croissants, eggs, sausage or bacon, potatos, flap jack, juice, oatmeal and cereal.  It was buffet style and if you don't get there early, the seats fill up.   Pros: price, free breakfast, free parking, close to everything  cons: doors/walls too thin, blanket is like a sheet

Summary Heading: Great for a value stay not far from Disney
Summary: We stayed for 3 nights.  Family of 4 (kids 10 and 12) in a 2 Queen room. This was out second stay here, the first being about 6 years ago. The beds were comfortable, wifi was reliable and available throughout the hotel. We enjoyed the pool and hot tub each day of our stay and both were great. The included hot breakfast was a huge plus for us, as was the fact that the ART shuttle stops right at the hotel and takes you to Disney. Staff was helpful and friendly. The room was comfortable and provided good value for the price we paid (~$130USD/night). There is a restaurant onsite and a small plaza next door (Wendy's, Quiznos, and Starbucks) and the Outlets at Orange just a 10 minute walk away. Overall, we enjoyed the stay and would recommend this hotel to others looking for a good
Manager Response: none

The pool area, the restaurant, the meeting rooms are beautiful. Breakfast is included, it has free wifi, a gym, laundry room and overall is a great hotel a great stay. I have to add to this that coming to ALO is always a great experience because the administrators and the entire personnel make you feel at home.

When other rooms on the first floor open and close it creates a draft and my door moves...very annoying. Oh and the WiFi is horrible. Dead zone for At&t and T-Mobile.    Aside from that the staff was friendly. The location is good because of the freeway, Denny’s and short drive to restaurants. You get the feeling that you should’ve paid a little more. I was not impressed.

We checked in around 11 AM on Friday after having been up all night with my sister and they immediately got us into a room so we could sleep. And the breakfast the next morning was amazing! They had a buffet with hot food, sausages, eggs, pancakes, potatoes, plus the standard continental fare if you really wanted a danish.  The staff were all very pleasant and very willing to help you. If I need to go back, I would definitely choose ALO Hotel.

Currently, the rooms and courtyard are undergoing renovation through February, however when finished, the entire place will be stunning. The free breakfast was the usual selection, it does get busy and finding a table can be a problem. Didn't use the pool but did make use of the self service laundry facility's.

Summary: Stayed at ALO during SoCal visit.  The staff were amazing. Everyone was so nice.  Room was spacious and bed was super comfy.  Breakfast was nice and came with the room.  Breakfast is served in the adjoining restaurant and you can sit in the restaurant or even outside to eat.  The pool area is under construction so went next door to sister hotel Ayers for their pool and hot tub.  Hotel is very convenient to the 5 and a very short drive to Disneyland.  About a 40 minute drive to LAX (in traffic closer to an hour). This was my first time staying here and I was quite impressed.  Would love to stay here again if in the area.

Summary: Stayed there for 5 nights, found a great rate online, staff was fantastic.  Every person we saw in the hallway or front desk had a warm smile and genuine hello.   Only downside is that the breakfast is fairly repetitive so staying there for multiple nights left me looking outside for breakfast.

Summary: ALO Hotel continues to be one of my favorite hotels during my Disneyland visits.  Short 10-15 minute non-stop ART shuttle rides are offered to Disneyland each hour as well as non-stop return ART shuttle rides from Disneyland each hour (both for a fee).  Wendy's is right next-door as well as Starbucks and Best Buy.  The Outlets at Orange with various shops and restaurants is a 10-minute walk.  Rooms feature comfy beds, great shelving for storage, and modern bright bathrooms.  The Time Warner Cable offering is limited (missing some of my favorite channels) with no on-screen guide, so I'm hoping they upgrade to DirecTV in the near future.  Free parking and complimentary breakfast buffet is also available.
Manager Response: Dear Brent E,  Thank you again for staying with us and for your continued loyalty to our hotel. Your feedback is always appreciated as well as the kind compliments you have shared.  Sincerely,  Sandra Zuno General Manager

Summary: While conveniently located the hotel is old with small elevators that poorly maintained; their free breakfast is stale breads and coffee; their exercise room is not a priority. Felt that the operations were poorly managed while the people were friendly, it is not a place where they cater to travelers or business people.  would not recommend.

Summary: The hotel was clean and the staff was friendly.  My only complaint is the shuttle to Disneyland.  There was an extra cost which was not clear when we reserved.  Not horribly expensive but would have been nice to know it was not part of the hotel.  The schedule for pickup at the hotel was provided but the shuttle didn't seem to keep up with the schedule and you never knew when it was going to pick up at Disneyland.  The hotel is only a mile from Disneyland and the drive to was quick but the return sometimes took a half hour.  Each shuttle had a different route that we could never keep up with.
Manager Response: none

Summary: You cannot beat the rate that I found this hotel for on Hotwire.  The lobby area and the restaurant downstairs are fairly modern.  The breakfast got mostly rave reviews here but I thought it was just okay.  It is always nice to have free breakfast included so no major complaints.  The pool area is small but very clean which is always nice.  The rooms are very small and other than parts of the bathroom, seriously lack the updates you would expect looking at this hotel from the outside.  We had a king room with a pull out couch and it was extremely tight for a family of 4 for just 2 nights.  The staff was extremely nice throughout our stay and everything was clean.  Overall, nothing wowed me but nothing made me want to complain.  If you find a good rate this would be fine for the
Manager Response: Dear Gtlmosher,  Thank you kindly for the candid review. I am pleased to see that you enjoyed the value we strive to offer our valued guests. Though I wish your experience would have been far more exceptional, I truly appreciate the feedback you have provided. I hope you consider staying with us again in the future.  Sincerely,  Sandra Zuno General Manager

Summary Heading: ALO Hotel is a Peaceful Oasis
Summary: We spent 5 nights at the ALO Hotel as our house was being fumigated for termites. It was really nice! The beds were really comfortable, they were very generous with the amount of towels they gave you (unlike many hotels), the room was immaculate, and the daily all-you-can-eat breakfast buffet complete with eggs and a breakfast meat included in the price of the room made it so welcoming and pleasant, a home away from home. The staff are all very friendly and helpful. I will definitely be recommending it to everyone.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Had a great experience at this hotel from check-in to check-out. Staff was incredibly friendly and inviting. Beds were extremely comfortable and I fell asleep as soon as my head hit the pillow. The buffet breakfast in the morning was great and very tasty. My only criticism is that I didn't see many options of things to drink with breakfast. That aside I would definitely stay here again
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for Disney
Summary: We have stayed at this hotel before and it is consistently nice.  The rooms are comfortable and clean.  The staff is friendly and nice.  They have a pool for relaxing in after a day at Disney.  But the best part is the breakfast.  We have eaten french toast, sausages, scrambled eggs, fruit, yogurt and cereal.  It is a great breakfast especially before Disneyland.  Also they are on the ART route.  We would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Comfortable hotel, nice staff, good price!
Summary: This was our second stay at this hotel.   They have updated the lobby since our first stay - looks very nice.  Rooms are nice sized, beds are comfortable, very clean.  Staff are very friendly and helpful, even taking my water bottle when I was in the lobby and filled it with ice and fresh water without me even asking!  Breakfast is very good.  Great price, great location (close to Disney, The Block, Knott's, etc.).  Like that wifi and parking is included as many hotels in area charge extra for this.  Even though hotel close to freeway and hospitals, the noise was very much under control.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Can tell this property (owned by Ayres - which has a newer hotel right next door) is getting older. Still in good shape.. excellent breakfast. Fine beds, furniture, etc.   "Older"/dated aspects include  slow elevators and hallways that need some newer paint.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I booked the ALO through Priceline and was not sure what we were going to get. The hotel was great. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Easy walk to Anaheim Stadium for a baseball game and only an $8 Uber ride back for two people. Absolutely recommend the ALO for Disneyland and/or Angels games.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Have stayed here before-great hotel-gave it 4 only because the breakfast was not good like it was in the past. Otherwise great-nice staff, comfy beds, clean, & quiet!!! Also close to Disney with free parking & no resort fees-all a plus!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: The Alo Hotel is part of the Ayres Hotel brand. I personally thought it was an upgrade before I booked it. Maybe it is, but not this hotel. It seemed kind of old, the room was small, two queen size beds. The bathroom was very small, and there was no air vent to let the steam out when one showered or odors after using the restroom... I have two kids. I have stayed at an Ayres Hotel before, and we loved it. The only other issue was the breakfast. It was average and I thought there would be a chef cooking omelet's like the main Ayres Hotel. I believe the eggs in this one were powder based. Next time, I will fork the additional $100 and stay at the main Ayres Hotel which we love. The staff at the front desk were friendly and professional. Also, the windows in the room are not sound

Summary: We stayed at the ALO Hotel over Memorial Day weekend while our granddaughter had dance competitions at the Disneyland Hotel. Summary Heading: Clean Hotel, good breakfast and convenience location.

Overall, we enjoyed the stay.

When I came back to extend my stay to two nights, those two errors made it hard to find me in the system.

Summary: We lchose this hotel due to the breakfast and jacuzzi. The breakfast was not good. Cold eggs, stale bread, and really bad coffee. When we checked in we were not told that the jacuzzi was under repair. After a long day of travel we were bummed!

Summary: Stayed for 8 nights, rooms were clean and spacious. The people at the front desk were very nice and helpful. The location was excellent. This made it easy  for us to get to all of our destinations. Breakfast was good as well.

Summary: This hotel has lots of good parking, front lobby was modern and has 24hr coffee,tea,an water in the lobby area, front desk staff was very friendly and accommodating, our room [619] was rather small [ok for 2] but has lots of builtin selves to place things in, you can also see disneyland fireworks from this room,room was clean and has a mini fridge, room decor was a little old fashion, bathroom was very small but modern,queen bed was very comfortable, pool area was nice but small.The free breakfast I thought was very good. Over all great price [Hotwire] and a great location,several restaurants,shopping an movie theater within 1mile,would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Great staff but needs serious updates
Summary: Ehhhhh....pretty sure I wouldn't stay here again.  Shower is horrible and clogs.  I feel like I'm deployed again in the middle of the desert and having to stand in my own shower funk because it won't drain.  The room smelled old and musty.   Even my son, who never complains, said the room stunk.  No exhaust fan in the bathroom so it was even grosser feeling after 4 showers were taken.  The breakfast is ok and the staff was extremely nice and professional.  Free parking and wi-if, great location and staff.....just really in need of a serious refresh.
Manager Response: Dear GueAndra V,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review of our hotel. Though I regret to read about your experience, I really appreciate the insight provided. I hope your future accommodations are comfortable and satisfying.  Sincerely,  Sandra Zuno General Manager

Summary: Location was good but the hotel needs updating.  Breakfast was included but was just OK.  The staff was good and friendly.  Parking was very good.  Close to shopping, dining and attractions.  Not a bad hotel, just not up to date.
Manager Response: Dear Mark H,  Thank you so much for your candid feedback. We certainly appreciate your compliments regarding our attentive team members and optimal location. Summary: I book for two nights,, i got the king bed which i found to be very confortable, excelent service and the breakfast was also quite good, i definiivelly return for my future trips to the nearest theme parks ;)

Summary: Wasn't anything amazing rooms are small but it works! Beds are comfy and thr place is clean, definitely needs more breakfast options. Location is eh but overall wasn't bad and you get your money's worth

Summary: Room was clean, staff was SOOO friendly and helpful and it felt safe and nice area. The staff answered all my questions and did it with a smile and without getting irritated with me. Again the rooms were super cleaned and super comfy!

Summary: Fabulous!  Professional staff.  Highly recommended.  Clean and well located.  Easy on and easy off art 5.  Convenient to shaping, Anaheim Angels baseball and Disneyland parks.  Will stay here again in the future.
Manager Response: none

Summary: First time staying here. Rooms were pretty clean but outdated. Free breakfast was dismal! Never stayed to eat in the 3 days we were there. Had to hunt for ice- machines were only on 2 floors. No information in the room regarding where they were. Freshly baked cookies were offered at night, but they only seemed to put out a few at a time. In the 3 nights, we only had cookies available once. Humorous story, but maybe a training issue....asked for a recommendation for a late dinner. Looking for salad and soup. He recommended Wendy's, that shares the parking lot!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for a family trip to Disneyland and California Adventure.  It's a little more of a distance to the parks than some other hotels, but we had such a great experience it was worth it.  Plus there's a shuttle that will take you to and from Disneyland for a nominal fee. The room was great - spacious, clean, quiet and inviting.  The front desk staff was extremely friendly and accommodating and went out of their way to help us. The free breakfast and dining area was top-notch, offering eggs, sausage and bacon, fresh fruit, yogurt, toast, muffins, croissants and coffee cake. I would definitely stay here again - it was an excellent value for the price!
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel is centrally located to easily accomidate travel from Orange Country, Long Beach and LAX airports.  The hotel has timely, easy to use and ecomomical ground transportation to and from the park.  The staff is above and beyond for requests and customer service.  The rooms are clean and comfortable.  No parties in the hall during our staff.  We will definitely return.
Manager Response: none

Summary: we stayed here after our wedding May 19 2017 and we loved our family that drove in also stayed here they loved it. the breakfast was great.. would recommend to any one. everyone is very nice and very helpful..

Summary: The hotel was in a good location, the service was good, the beds were comfortable. All in all I would recommend this hotel for a stay in the Disneyland area. The staff was very friendly and willing to help you with anything you needed. Well done Alo Hotel.

Summary: this is my forth time visiting the Orange County. The hotel is in very nice location, near to high ways, shopping areas, and most attractive places. The breakfast was very good. However, the room is too old and smelly!!

Summary: Hotels, motels, and inns are expensive the closer you are to the park. If you want convenience, budget, and a good stay, you may want to stay further away from the park but have the convenience of shuttles going in and out of the hotel. This hotel has a shuttle that come in and out every 20 minutes, and if you need a shuttle from the hotel to the airport you can do super shuttle. My husband took advantage of the breakfast. They had eggs, sausages, yogurt, etc, your basic hot and cold breakfast. The room was cozy, clean, and comfortable. I would love to come back here on another trip and bring the whole family.

Summary: Clean, friendly and offers shuttles to Disney.  The bus driver is amazing and beyond helpful to everyone who crosses his path.  The ALO offers a free breakfast which offers fresh fruit.  At night they had sugar cookies in the lobby.

Summary: The hotel is on a main boulevard providing easy access to Disneyland, Knotts and the Arts Center. It's your standard clean, modern mid-level hotel. Summary: Great location! Just minutes away from the freeway exit and walking distance from the Outlet mall and restaurants plus 21+ Adult activities bars for those non-Disneyland enthusiast. Summary Heading: Old but clean and decent enough
Summary: I stayed here with my wife for a weekend as we visited friends in the area. It is close to all of the attractions in Anaheim and is a pretty good place to stay if you are visiting this pocket of the Los Angeles area.  This hotel scored well in the basics you will require for a comfortable stay... fast check in, very clean room, comfortable bed and quiet hallways. My wife and I slept great.  The included breakfast was bland but got the job done.   This hotel is not hip at all. It has quality furnishings but they are very old, likely dating back to a casegoods (heavy furniture, etc) replacement maybe 15 years ago. The hotel needs updating but is a good alternative to the more expensive name brands in the area.   If you don't plan on spending much time at your hotel and just want a

Summary: Staff was amazing! Everything was great! Last minute stay for one night to watch the Angles baseball game. Within walking distance from the stadium made it perfect. Will definitely be staying here for all our last minute get aways. Food was great also!

Summary: My family and I stayed here for a week, Our room overooked the pool. Room was very spacious and clean.  The staff is amazing.  Very friendly . Greeted us every morning and evening.  We would definately stay here again.

Summary Heading: Reviews were good, my experience was not
Summary: After I had just checked in to our hotel, I unpacked and went straight to the bathroom to clean. I was trying to take a shower but the tub diverter broke off. I immediately called the front desk to report it. They couldn't even offer to move me to a different room, instead they said someone will come work on it first thing in the morning. It didn't even matter to me in the morning because I checked out at 9AM and even then, there was still no maintenance.  In addition,  after the water in the tub drained, there was dirt left and it made me really uneasy to think that it wasn't properly cleaned. The sink in the bathroom also had a leak when I turned it on, spraying onto the mirror. After a long day at the nearby amusement parks, I was hoping for a comforting hotel to relax in.

Summary: Great location Very clean  Amazing staff  Stayed for two nights, Close to freeways and shopping  Great breakfast bar with eggs,pancakes, fruit, juice and coffee The beds and pillows were amazingly comfortable  Will definitely book here again.

Summary: Great location and breakfast. The rooms are nice and clean and the proximity to Angel stadium and Disneyland are great. I would definitely stay here again. The staff are very nice and friendly. Thanks!

Summary Heading: BEST Customer service / reception desk & experience in general.
Summary: We stayed here for 2 days and have stayed here many times before. ALWAYS love the ALO. This time front desk was phenomenal. I left my wallet with lots of $$ on a table, housekeeping came in, not a dollar was missing. THIS is the hotel experience that makes Ayres uniquely stand out. Thank you! The rooms and breakfast were excellent. Full breakfast. Clean rooms.

Summary: With Disney being expensive, I was searching for an affordable hotel that offered amenities that would help make the vacation less financially stressful. They have nice spacious comfortable rooms and the breakfast was perfect to get us going in the morning.   I did notice that the hotel was doing some remodeling but none of it interfered with our stay or caused any distraction.  They have a covered parking structure and very nice staff. Just a side note: the elevators are small so if you have a larger group or lots of luggage it may take you two trips upstairs.   I would definitely stay again.

The stay included free parking, a hot breakfast consisting of pancakes, potatoes, scrambled eggs and a meat product, which varied daily.  We tried to drive to Disneyland and park but it was such an expensive parking option with long waits just to get in, we drove back to the hotel and hopped on the shuttle.  There are multi-day options for shuttle passes offered at the front desk. Otherwise, you have to have exact change when you hop

My husband was not able to stay the entire month i was there and I told the staff why I was there and they started to treat me like family and were SO accommodating and friendly.  I have to return to California on a fairly regular basis for follow up appointments and new surgeries and I make sure to stay at the ALO every time. I make sure to recommend it to everyone I know as well!

Summary Heading: Great hotel option if traveling to Disneyland
Summary: My family has stayed here twice now when visiting Disneyland. Here are the reasons why: 1. Rooms are clean 2. Hotel is quieter, less crowded feel than those next to Disneyland 3. Shuttle (ART) picks you up right in front of hotel and you get dropped off by Disney entrance. This has been great when traveling with kids and a disabled person. 4. Free breakfast included! It's not a continental sugar loaded breakfast- you get eggs, potatoes, sausage, pancakes or French toast, bagels with cream cheese, coffee, juice, cereal bar and fruit. You will save lots of $ eating a hearty breakfast before traveling to Disney. 5. Workers are friendly and helpful and Manager Sandra is amazing!   You can't go wrong staying at this hotel!

It was also convenient to get into the hotel which they have a back door access that you have to use with your room key instead of walking or lugging your stuff all the way to the front of the lobby which was a plus.   Now, on to the room. After checking in, we got in their elevator which we thought was really weird at first because of how small and old

Summary: We picked this hotel because it is close to Disneyland.  There was a shuttle from the hotel to Disney which was great for the 7 of us. This hotel is clean and comfortable with a nice breakfast assortment.  I would recommend this to anyone.  Great price for the amenities.

Summary Heading: Close to everything! Nice and clean!
Summary: Rooms were great. Had all the amenities and was close to all the attractions of southern California. The friendliest staff I have ever had, (and I travel a lot)! Louis was super helpful when we checked in. I forgot was out of travel toothpaste and was unable to bring my large one. Cory at the front desk did not hesitate or make me feel dumb. He provided some and wanted to help ay way he could. The next day Mike at the breakfast bar was more than friendly with conversation and help. The hotel was wonderful but sometimes it is the staff that can make or break your experience and these guys were amongst the friendliest.

Summary: Cost X Benefit very good. Confortable, quiet, clean and fair breakfast. Conveniently located close to the Outlets of Orange (walking distance). For a low cost you can get a shuttle at the hotel to the front gate of Disneyland. Great value.

Summary: Most comfortable hotel beds, well appointed rooms, updated bathrooms, clean, clean, clean. Excellent service and responsive maintenance, friendly staff. All the amenities. We say hello again to ALO twice yearly over the last four years.

Summary: From check-in to check-out this hotel was an excellent choice. Rooms are clean and big, especially the king room with a couch. The front desk staff was amazing, polite, and super friendly. I was staying here for both a Disney vacation and participated in the Star Wars runDisney event. The staff was great about making sure the shuttle times were posted in the lobby and even had print outs of the shuttle times and info for each day of the marathon weekend. Also, it was nice that the shuttle picked up and dropped off right outside of the lobby. ALO Hotel is also next to I-5 and about a 5-10min drive to the parks if you choose to drive yourself.   The breakfast is yummy and a great way to start day. I also loved stopping by the lobby in the evenings for a cookie and coffee/tea.

Summary: The hotel was clean wherever I looked and that is a rarety I encounter in my 20 years of business travels. Breakfast buffet was nicely stocked, variety of items and sufficient seating. One night I left on my car lights and I received a phone call shortly from the hotel to inform me - the hotel staff was very friendly and accommodating. The cookies at night at the lobby and free tea and coffee all day an appreciated touch
