When it comes to satisfying all my requirements, such as cleanliness, staff friendliness, and great location, this is definitely the spot (also located near freeway). Most people wonder about the bathrooms, carpets, and room beds/linens and I have to say it wasn't bad at all. Continental breakfast was average, but it did the job! Minus a little outdated bathroom (old tile floors and some lights not working). Everything was great! By the way, ALO hotel is also partnered with Ayres hotel. So when the pool went out of service our second night, the staff told us we could get a key to swim at the adjacent hotel (Ayres)! Thank goodness!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hubby and I were looking for a hotel to rest our heads after a fun filled day at Disneyland. We chose this hotel for convenience and price and weren't expecting 5 star. The lobby is lovely with the smell of fresh baked cookies and the front desk staff were helpful and professional. When we got to our room we felt like we had stepped back in time to the 80's. Somebody forgot to take Grandma's ceiling fan with them when they left...The walls were paper thin so hearing your neighbor snoring was not a plus. The room was very dated and small with barely enough room to turn around in the bathroom. Lots of exterior noise...traffic and sirens. Parking was not ideal and didn't feel that safe. I hate to give a bad review, but it just seems like this place could be so much better if they
Manager Response: Dear gmashelley,  Thank you so much for the input you have provided. Though I regret to see that your experience was anything less than exceptional, I do appreciate the feedback you have provided. Thank you kindly for your insight. Rest assured that renovations are currently in the works. We kindly invite you to return to our hotel in the future to see how we have improved!  Sincerely,  Sandra Zuno General Manager

Summary Heading: THE GOOD REVIEWS WERE RIGHT ON TARGET
Summary: Checked in to the Alo, still with a real bad taste in my mind with staying at the Hotel Menage a Starwood Property, just a couple weeks ago. This place was very nice.  A true boutique hotel in the middle of everything in Orange.  Rooms were great.  Everything was neat, upgraded and this is a true representation of a 4 star hotel.  Withing walking distance to the outlet malls and a couple miles away from Old Town and all the good restaurants down there, this is a great place for business and everything else.  Centrally located to everything in OC.  I would definitely go back there again.  Great Job Alo Hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hotel is very nice. Room was clean and comfortable with plenty of space. Staff very friendly. Breakfast buffet in morning great - fresh food with eggs, bacon, pancakes, fruit, etc. Location right across the street from UC-Irvine hospitals, super convenient. Only issue was hallway noise could be heard somewhat loudly from inside room. Would stay again, though.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I really enjoyed staying here, house keeping was very consistent and when we came back the rooms were always kept clean! Breakfast was something different everyday, everyone was super kind! Room was very nice as well! I would definitely go back!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Luis at the front desk was very nice and  accommodating. The free continental breakfast was not very good but the restaurant next door is amazing. It was very pricey but some of the best food I ever had. Pool is small but inviting.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed from October 15th-October 21st 2016 in room 315 for our Disney vacation.  The staff is so kind and always said "hello" when passing by.  The breakfast was decent and better than what you get at most hotels.  They had scrambled eggs, potatoes, fruit, and cereal every morning, they would switch between bacon (yummy) and sausage on the other days as well as either pancakes or french toast.  I didn't care for the pancakes but the french toast was amazingly good.  They also had toast or bagels.  My only wish was that breakfast would go a little bit later on the week days, they close it down at 9:00AM and after spending the day at the Disney Parks it would be a little nicer to sleep in later without having to worry about missing breakfast.    The hotel is a bit "tired" like
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is our second time at this hotel and its just as good  as the first time. Great friendly staff good location and great place to stay when visiting the theme parks.Bus right at the door. Also right near the outlet shops. Good breakfast and good large rooms great hotel. Would come back again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A quick stop before going to the Great Wolf Lodge.
Summary: I will start by saying that they have fantastic cookies and coffee wait in the lobby.  This is hotel is extremely clean. The room was nice.  The beds were good, and my wife liked the pillows.  The hotel has a nice little pool that closes at 10pm.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Perfect experience, affordable pricing, friendly employees
Summary: We stayed here from recommendations from the nearby medical center as well as reviews from Trip Advisor. The staff couldn't have been friendlier or more accommodating. We were greeted by all the staff members who passed by us. The hotel is undergoing some remodeling, but we never heard any construction going on the days we were there. Rooms were nice and had a large windows so you could see the city lights which was nice. Your not just looking at 4  walls. Free breakfast was a real plus. Much to choose from and it changed daily. Fresh fruit, hot entrees, breads and goodies to to name a few. They also serve fresh baked cookies at night which was a treat and quite yummy. I would stay there again without any hesitation. Great location for medical needs for out of towers as well as
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Well maintained clean hotel centrally located
Summary: A week's stay here made trips to beaches and other attractions convenient. Yes, it is a long drive into the city if you plan lots of activity downtown LA, but easy access to the freeway system and timing your travel to avoid the morning and evening rush hours lessens that draw back. Very clean well appointed rooms and as others have mentioned a full breakfast offering 6:30 - 9:00 daily and until 9:30 on the weekend. Very accommodating staff. Coffee and water available all day and delicious cookies in the evening. We had a group of 16 with rooms located close together. Even though it is near the freeway and a hospital it was quiet.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was a nice hotel to stay at on our trip to Disneyland. It was clean, quiet, trendy, and close to Disney. They served a nice full breakfast and they had a shuttle (which is not free) to the park. I was overall happy with the service and amenities offered. I would stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Starting the day with a great breakfast at the ALO hotel helps get you through those long Disney lines. I would have loved to see more fruit but there was a good selection of breakfast items and there is 24/7 coffee, tea and ice lemon water in the lobby. The availability of the ART shuttle stop in front of the hotel was one reason we chose this hotel. Although it was no reflection on the hotel we found the "every 20 minutes" schedule to be a total fantasy. We waited an hour to get a bus back to the hotel at the end of the day. Other options would have been no more money and much much faster.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We recently stayed at the Ayres ALO when visiting Disneyland.  We are big fans of Ayres properties, so we had high expectations when staying here and we were not disappointed!  The property was clean and nicely furnished.  The room was a good size and very clean.  The beds were so comfortable, which is what you need after spending a day at Disney.  The breakfasts in the morning were yummy.  On one day there was scrambled eggs, french toast and bacon.  The next day was pancakes, potatoes and sausage.  It is a great way to start the day.  Also they had free parking. Staying here was a great value for our money.  We loved it and will stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Low Cost Family Friendly Hotel with Quality Amenities included
Summary: We stayed at Ayres Alo for our trip to the Mickey Halloween Party. The hotel is a 5 minute drive to Disneyland, the overnight cost was significantly lower (about $60 less) than lower star hotels by the park. The parking and breakfast were included (which anyone who does overnights in Anahiem / Disneyland knows free parking is a big perk).  The hotel was very family friend, we had a king bed suite with a pull out sofa bed, perfect for our 2 sons.  All amenities are there, so you aren't skimping on your stay in order to save on the cost. The hotel is right off the freeway which is another added convenience.  We would definitely stay again!
Manager Response: Dear Roni M,  Thank you so much for the great feedback you have provided our team with. I am thrilled to read that you enjoyed our comfortable accommodations, premium amenities, as well as our optimal location. Your warm compliments are greatly appreciated and we truly hope you choose to stay with us again in the future.  Sincerely,  Sandra Zuno General Manager

Summary: This hotel was beyond what I expected.  I was hoping for an affordable hotel close to Disneyland that wasn't completely sketchy. ALO was a nice place to come back to after a full day at Disney.  The staff are friendly and greet you every time.  They are more than willing to help you with whatever you made need.  The room was also comfortable and clean.
Manager Response: Dear 224tanyaa,  It is such a pleasure to see that we exceeded your expectations. We truly do take it upon ourselves to redefine hospitality. Thank you so much for your compliments regarding the value of our accommodations as well as the attentive service that our wonderful team has provided. We hope to see you again soon.  Sincerely,  Sandra Zuno General Manager

Summary: Excellent condition, service was above normal with friendly service overall. Would definitely stay again if needed.service was above normal with friendly service from hotel staff overall. Would definitely stay again if needed. Location was a plus as well.
Manager Response: Dear n3lsonor3llana,  Thank you kindly for taking the time to write a review of our hotel based on your recent experience. It is great to see that you enjoyed your time with us. Thank you kindly for your warm compliments regarding our attentive service and our great team. We look forward to welcoming you back!  Sincerely,  Sandra Zuno General Manager

Summary: My husband was in UCI for a biopsy on his lung so I was emotionally uptight.  My stay at ALO was handled by caring staff and they made sure that I was taken care of, which is important, because I am his caregiver.  The room was lovely and clean and the amenities were nice.  The breakfast was awesome.
Manager Response: Dear TrikyB,  We make it our mission to go above and beyond for our valued guests and nothing pleases me more than to know we did just that for your stay. It was an honor serving you and we look forward to doing so again in the future.  Sincerely,  Sandra Zuno General Manager

Summary Heading: Excellent Location. Super Service. Great Breakfast
Summary: This Hotel is currently under minor renovations (did not impact our visit at all). It is surprisingly quiet considering how close to the highway it is. We stayed here while visiting our daughter at Chapman. Excellent location. Clean lobby with coffee, water, and cookies out for guests. The breakfast is better than most places. The staff was friendly and accommodating. The room was okay. Nothing fabulous but it was spacious. Nice pillows. I think the rooms need updated. I will stay here again but I'm going to try the Ayres Hotel next door first.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: This is my go to hotel when visiting my daughter at college in Orange, CA
Summary: We usually stay at the ALO when we are in Southern California visiting our daughter at college.  This hotel is very quiet, very clean, nicely appointed rooms, super friendly and helpful staff.  The rooms are spacious, immaculately clean, nice showers, super comfortable beds.  Breakfast is included in the price of the room.  They offer special rates, AAA discounts, etc.  I highly recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Dear SBell1113,  Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review and for your loyalty to our hotel. I am contented to see that we are you go-to hotel; it truly is an honor to serve you. Your kind compliments are greatly appreciated. We look forward to your next visit!  Sincerely,  Sandra Zuno General Manager

Summary: This hotel has character, is close to many restaurants, and close to Disneyland! The beds were comfortable and clean. Upon arriving there was coffee, tea, water and chocolate chip cookies.. They also provided you with water bottles and some chocolate pieces!
Manager Response: Dear adr631,  Thank you so much for the great feedback you have provided. I am so happy that you enjoyed our accommodations and that our optimal location met your needs. Your warm compliments are greatly appreciated and I truly hope you choose to stay with us in the future.  Sincerely,  Sandra Zuno General Manager

Summary Heading: Preferred the Ayres Hotel next door
Summary: This is the second time staying in this location which is very convenient for Chapman University where we were visiting. The first time we stayed at the Ayres hotel, which is right next door. However, Ayres was fully booked so we booked at the ALO Hotel for this stay. I gave Ayres 4 stars and give this hotel, ALO, 3 stars because the rooms are older and dingier, the bed was soft, and the bathroom was more cramped. We didn't have the complimentary breakfast so can't rate that. It was slightly cheaper than the Ayres Hotel.
Manager Response: Dear msjane63,  Thank you kindly for reviewing our hotel. Our sister hotel next door is a fairly new hotel that opened late 2014. Fortunately, our hotel has a number of renovations in the works. I would like to invite you back to our hotel once renovations are complete. Thank you for your candid feedback. Summary Heading: I really enjoyed my time at this hotel I would definitely stay here again
Summary: I really enjoyed the customer service and how knowledgeable they were and helpful I would stay at this hotel again the only I would say could've been better was the breakfast every morning it was the same
Manager Response: none

Summary: We come here for business often, and this time we got a complimentary upgrade to a very spacious king suite! The hotel remembered that I had asked to make sure there was a microwave in the room, and it did. Clean, quiet, and we see the fireworks from Disneyland. Nice access from the parking structure, and a nice little courtyard. Complimentary breakfast is alright, but it turns into a REALLY nice Spanish cuisine in the evenings! We always have at least one dinner on each trip, and it's right in the hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great rates and great rooms, so clean and comfortable !
Summary: I got a room with two queen size beds and was extremely happy with the cleaning people and the front desk.  Having a great free breakfast everyday is sooooo worth the stay here.  It was pretty good food, I was satisfied and there are a lot of breakfast choices for everyone.  The beds and pillows were comfortable.  The showers had great showerheads.  Everything was perfect !  Thanks ALO Hotel !

Summary: Nice size rooms clean . I don't know his name but your male customer service rep was very nice . Spoke every time he saw us .. Thank you for that ., some of the women spoke every now and then but overall love the hotel. Your waiting room area was beautiful. The pool was nice size and the jacuzzi was nice. Checking in was very easy no problem also checking out was very easy .i would definitely recommend this hotel I would also say again myself. Made my birthday very nice
Manager Response: none

Summary: We came here for some R & R and we were not disappointed. The front desk was so friendly and pleasant. The breakfast was delicious and free. You can't beat that!! If you are looking for a comfortable and enjoyable hotel, this is the place to stay!
Manager Response: none

Summary: When I entered the hotel a very friendly staff greeted me.  The lobby is beautiful and very modern. I asked for an early arrival, as they were gutting the bathroom at my condo, and I had to get out early.  The hotel was very accommodating and helpful; when I arrived my room was ready. Jaye, Mariel, and Luis at the front desk were all fantastic.  They presented themselves well, and they were extremely helpful. The whole front desk staff deserves applause.   I had to bring my 2 cats with me, because of the construction at my condo. The good news is they take pets!!  The room did not smell of pets, but was nicely decorated and very clean. They are also in the process of remodeling to make the hotel more modern. Fortunately my room was on the first floor overlooking a green
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Come for the breaktast; stay for the outstanding customer service
Summary: My family has stayed here three times in the last four years; it is quiet, clean and the breakfast is fantastic. We had some problems with the ART shuttle from Disneyland this stay, and several members of the staff were helpful in calling dispatch to find out why the shuttle was running an hour late and determining when it would arrive. I doubt I'll take the ART next time, but I will absolutely be back to the ALO -- it's a terrific place to stay!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I was charged for smoking in the room. This charge was applied without anyone informing me even though they had my cell phone number, email address and I stored my bags there all day after I checked out. Because the amount they charged is the same as the incidental hold I didn't think anything of it until the funds were captured 4 days later by then I have no way to argue with them. For the record I am a smoker but I DID NOT smoke in the room!
Manager Response: Dear jtg336,  We kindly welcome any and all guest feedback. Please know that we find absolutely no satisfaction in charging deceitful fees. Becuase a smoking fee is, in fact, a substantial charge, we only post the fee if there is irrefutable evidence that smoking has occurred within a guestroom. You are more than welcomed to contact us directly if you still feel you have been charged unfairly. Thank you for your feedback.  Sincerely,  Sandra Zuno General Manager

Summary: Having previously stayed at Ayres Anaheim and the Ayres Hotel next door the ALO was not quite up to the same standard.(others were fully booked for our dates)  Rooms now in need of upgrading including the bathroom.  Bed was comfortable and room generally clean, although this was hit & miss depending on who was cleaning on any given day.  Breakfast was the biggest let down. There were no fresh cooked eggs as when we stayed at the other 2 hotels. There were some strange hot options including just  pancakes and potatoes on one day. The location was good as we were visiting family. There was some work going on while we were there but this did not cause us any great problem.
Manager Response: Dear swandaw,  Thank you so much for reviewing our hotel. Your candid feedback is greatly appreciated. Please accept our sincere apologies for the lack of consistency when compared to our sister hotel. I hope that this experience does not deter you from returning to our hotel as it would be an honor to serve you again and provide the service you deserve.  Sincerely,  Sandra Zuno General Manager

Summary: I am so happy that my partner and I booked our stay here. We sincerely have no complaints. The room is a bit outdated, but it's comfortable and most importantly, it was CLEAN! The mattress was incredible and we slept like babies! The daily complimentary buffet breakfast was amazing and it's awesome when hotel's include this in their price. The customer service was phenomenal and we were allowed to check in early, without a problem. The cleaning crew were so pleasant and always greeted us in the hallway. I can't forget to mention that the parking was free!  And the hotel is less than 3 miles from Disneyland. We will definitely be staying here again when we are in Anaheim! We didn't get to eat at Aneplaco, the French-Mexican fusion restaurant :/ but we will next time.Thanks for
Manager Response: none

Summary: Location is key to our trip.  We walked from the Angels baseball game back to the hotel and took us 15 to 20 minutes.  It was also a 20 minute drive to Disneyland.  Hotel was also next to the freeway and the hospital.   Staff was very friendly and helpful.  We stayed for 3 nights.  Hotel had coffee, tea, lemon water provided everyday at the hotel lobby and complimentary breakfast every morning.  Breakfast consists of scrambled eggs, pancakes, bagels, toast, muffins, cereal, fruits and yogurts, coffee and orange juice And was buffet style.  We had a very good stay with this hotel, the only problem was th card that would get demagnetized.  Other than that, very satisfied.

Summary: Staffs are very friendly and the breakfast  was great. The price of Shuttle Bus is reasonable. Location is great. Starbucks  and other fast food restaurants are close to the hotel. It is also close to Highway and outlet stores.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hotel was good. Friendly And helpful staff. Not too far From Disney but not close to walk there but a shuttle can take you to And from for a small fee. I liked that It had free parking And free breakfast. Good hotel worth what I paid for It.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I visit this hotel often for work and the staff are always helpful and courteous. The hotel even offers a nice "Real" breakfast to get your day started off in the morning. The rooms are standard, nothing fancy but always clean. The beds are a bit soft for my preference but I love the location so I'm happy to stay here when I come.

Summary: Great experience! Our family traveled to California for a vacay.  We did our research and guess what?! We lived staying here.  Very clean rooms cozy atmosphere and awesome breakfast!! I highly recommend.   I could see the Disney fireworks from our 3rd floor window.  It was so fun.  Easy to get to and easy to get to Disneyland.  5 min away and on the way there is a Little Caesars Pizza and a Baskin Robbins!   Need I say more?  There is also a Wendy's right next door.  Priced well and the staff was so kind.
Manager Response: none

Summary: i can't say enough good things about our stay, the staff at the hotel were all great! even though they were in the process of renovating the hallways, you would not know it the hotel was very attractive, clean, quiet and quite comfortable the free breakfast was very good with a different hot selection each morning the food at the restaurant in the hotel was very good

Summary: In the past two years, I have had need to stay in Orange County.  I have stayed at many Ayres hotels, and all are very nice properties, great rooms and wonderful staff.  But for me, ALO tops them all.  Every person who works there, from the cleaning staff, the kitchen staff, and especially the front desk staff, is friendly and goes out of their way to accommodate our every need.  They are wonderful people.  I highly recommend the ALO.

Summary: Nice corner room, decent breakfast buffet (NO BACON :(   but otherwise good)  Close to everything we wanted to do, Knott's Berry Farm, Disneyland, easy freeway access to I-5  Von's close by, and Wendy's (bacon fix) across the street...hospital kitty corner  Nice bed, lots of hot water, close captioning on the tv (necessity)

Summary Heading: The Hotel and The People that run it
Summary: The rooms are great, excellent comfortable beds and pillows, plenty of pillows, super clean, great view from all rooms, great clean bathrooms, hair dryer included, tv set, small refrigerator and coffee and coffee maker in every room, free wifi in all places inside the hotel, breakfast is included,  it has a gym, beautiful pool, its restaurant Anepalco, and did I mention the people?   The people are great, corteous, very helpful and interested in meeting guest's needs. Excellent for family travel, business travel. It has a great location with shuttle to Disney, it is located near The Block Outlets if shopping is on your plans, the universities, restaurants,major streets and highways.  My family and I enjoyed our stay . We will definitely return . Thank you!

Summary: ALO Hotel is consistently reliable and comfortable. The staff is very friendly, the breakfast options are good, and the rooms are clean and enjoyable to stay in. Every time I am in the area I try to book at ALO.

The free breakfast buffet is ok for free quick breakfast, we paid the 10 for 2 extra folks and to pay for the buffet was not worth it (they did not have meet on the buffet that day).  Overall great stay and loved the beds!  Parking didn’t seem to be a problem either.

Summary: Good value!  Knowledgeable and friendly staff.  Breakfast was included.  The hotel is centrally located near shops, restaurants and Disneyland.  We hopped on their shuttle to Disneyland for a nominal fee.    Would go back!

Summary: I travel for work a couple of times per month to the LA/OC area. After staying in many other hotels, I now choose the AOL Hotel each time I am in the OC area. The service is the best I have ever experienced. Anything you need just let the staff know and they will accommodate you. The room is clean and very nice. There is a workout room and a pool. The location is great because you can go to the Orange outlets across the street or to Disneyland (there is also a shuttle available). The breakfast in the morning is a full breakfast with eggs, waffles and bacon/sausage.  As a testimony to the fantastic service, on this last work trip I left my phone charger in the room. I called the Assistant Manager and she mailed it to me. You can't get better service than at the AOL Hotel. Thank
Manager Response: Dear Hollandd0930,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. I am pleased that ALO Hotel is now your first choice when you visit the Orange County area. Summary Heading: Great service but poor structure. Paint peeling,  tight Restroom.

Summary: Great dog friendly hotel except be aware you can hear the fireworfks from Disney very loudly at 9:30 pm. Hotel is being renovated and it needs it, I think dog rooms on first floor are last to be done. Staff is super friendly! Would definitely stay here again.

Summary: Love this hotel! Clean, employees are nice, & breakfast is good!! When anything is needed (our toilet plugged), they send someone right up! Have stayed here more than once & will be back! Wish breakfast could run just an hour or so later for us Disney fans who stay till park closing!!!! Reasonably priced too & offer Disney annual pass discounts!!

Summary: We stayed at this hotel from August 16-20. We chose it due to its proximity to Disneyland, free parking and the price. Overall it was a great experience. The hotel, while older, has made some renovations which makes it much more modern.   The rooms were very clean and the staff were knowledgeable and helpful. The breakfast was well stocked and offered a variety of foods each morning. Great for families travelling to Disney on a budget but still wanting a modern, clean hotel.

Summary Heading: My go to hotel in Orange
Summary: I visit Orange several times a year to see my child at Chapman University. This hotel is 3.5 miles from campus. The front desk staff is friendly, rooms are very spacious and clean with comfortable beds. I also see the Disney shuttle and a number of families. Other amenities include complementary wifi, parking and breakfast. Within walking distance is a Starbucks and mall with a number of restaurants. Perfect combos for me and I'll be staying at ALO on my next trip too!

Summary: I stayed during our family visit to Disneyland and Universal Studios. Great location, close to attractions and relatively short travel distance to L.A.. The staff was always friendly and ready to help in whatever we needed. The breakfast was great and included inthe daily fee. Our kids enjoyed the pool. One of the best hotels I've stayed for that price range.

Summary Heading: the right place at the right time
Summary: Our stay at the hotel was fine. The room was clean and well-kept. We didn't spend a lot of time in the hotel as we were dropping our daughter off at Chapman University and very busy on campus. It is a great location for anyone with business at Chapman. Just a few minutes down the road.  My two wishes would be for there to be better lighting in the room and more efficient heating/cooling. The room was dark even with all the lights on and the heating unit was very noisy and we couldn't keep the temperature consistent overnight.

Summary: The hotel workers were really nice! The breakfast was great , and our hotel room was always clean when we would come back. A great experience ! The location was also good, It was only 8 minutes away from Disneyland . Highly recommend it.

Summary: This is a very nice, comfortable hotel near the UCI Medical Center and 2 miles from Chapman University and downtown Orange. It has many nice features, including a shuttle to Disneyland, and the personnel at the front desk are quite accommodating. There is also a very good "Mexican" restaurant in the hotel, used for breakfast and available for more interesting meals.

Summary: Great Hotel, very helpful and friendly staff, they got us inter connecting rooms when asked. Will certainly stay there again. Lots of on site parking and close to the mall. The rooms were spacious. Breakfast was great

Summary Heading: Great Rooms, Great Prices for Disneyland Area
Summary: ALO (formerly Ayres Inn Orange) remains a great hotel.  I can't say enough about how comfortable the rooms are.  Great beds and pillows.  Bright, clean, modern bathrooms. Wendy's is right next door if you need a quick bite, and the Outlets at Orange is only a few blocks away, so an easy walk.  My major complaint is with the ART shuttle service.  The route (#14) was changed last year to add the ARTIC station, which significantly increased travel time from Disneyland back to the hotel.  This year, one hotel was dropped from the route, but the Convention Centre was added, so travel time remains a concern.  Also, the shuttle

It was nice and it's a good deal for the price but the breakfast just is from 6 to 9 am, and it doesn't contain so much options, also the breakfast should include more options as nut milks, oats, seed.  Besides the breakfast things my family and I spent such a good time and we didn't have any problem:).
Manager Response: none

Summary: The rooms were decent, it looks like they did improvements on the lobby, that looks nice. They have fresh flavored water as you enter the lobby with cookies at times. Breakfast was great  it was free from 6am-9am. The rooms could use some upgrades such as the showers. Parking is frees and there is plenty of space because they have their own parking garage.
Manager Response: Dear Jokr151,  Thank you for your insight. We greatly value your feedback and are happy to hear you enjoyed our recently renovated lobby. I would like to kindly encourage you to return to our hotel in the future as renovations for our accommodations are in the works.  Sincerely,  Christine Smith General Manager

Summary Heading: The hotel was clean and breakfast is so good.
Summary: Just the shuttle bus is not enough to pick up people from disneyland at the night, and the shuttle bus was coming late from the schedule.  The hotel should send more than 1 shuttle bus to disneyland at the night. Because so many people with kids and baby there and waiting for along time the shuttle bus in the night. I suggest ALO hotel have own bus, cause so many people stay at alo hotel was going to the disneyland. In the night, we was arrived at the hotel. Our room was still messy, the staff hotel not clean up our room. How come ??????????
Manager Response: Dear Melyana Y,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. Unfortunately, we are unable to operate our own shuttle services so we utilize the ART shuttle which is operated by the city of Anaheim. Anaheim Resort Transit sets up the schedules and the routes for all ART shuttles. Thank you again for your valuable input.  Sincerely,  Sandra Zuno General Manager

Summary Heading: ALO HOTEL, PERFECT FOR ANYONE AND EVERYONE
Summary: This is one of the best hotels, in the city of Orange, Orange County, in California, for Holiday, Business, single or with family, it is good for anyone, and everyone, every their Breakfast to their services, everything is top notch, and the prize is also cool.
Manager Response: none

Summary: One of the best stays we've had in Anaheim. Our room at the Alo was cozy and clean. We also appreciated the efficient and kind staff. Excellent breakfast too! We will make the Alo hotel our place to stay when visiting Anaheim from now on!
Manager Response: none

Summary: My experience over the Memorial Day weekend was great due to the ALO Hotel.  I usually stay at the larger hotels when I travel, however the ALO Hotel met all of my expectations and more.  A week or two before I arrived I called to let them know I was a light sleeper and needed to be placed in the quietest part of the hotel.  When I arrived they already had my room assigned which was the perfect location for me.  I slept like a baby, and the beds were extremely comfortable.  Although the breakfast area was in the back room, it was directly attached to the main restaurant.  So once I got my food, I was able to eat in the main restaurant (very clean) which was about 2 steps away.  Everything was clean from the bed linens to the bath room.  I would definitely stay at the ALO Hotel
Manager Response: none

Summary: We selected this hotel for our visit to Orange because it was pet-friendly. (We were traveling with our small dog.) Also because of the location, a short Uber ride into downtown. (parking downtown is tough) We got into town early and went to see if we could check in early. We could not as the room was not ready yet. We left our bags and they said they would call us when the room was ready. They never did, but that's ok. We grabbed an Uber and headed to town. Once we got back and checked into our room, we were hit with the strong smell of dog pee. Like, really strong. We called the front desk to let them know as we were not going to be blamed for it. We were annoyed that we had to pay a $45 "pet cleaning fee" when they obviously didn't really do anything to clean from previous
Manager Response: none

Summary: We arrived on a Saturday for a two-night stay.  We were looking for a pet-friendly hotel.  The guy who greeted us was very helpful and offered to store our luggage, as it was too early to check in.  He did say he would text or call us when our room was ready, but he never did.  We got back to the hotel around 4pm Saturday, and the girl at check-in was very matter-of-fact...all business.  She made no attempt to engage us by asking typical questions like "what brings you to Orange?" or the like.  She made us feel like we were being "transacted and processed" rather than greeted warmly and welcomed.  No "let us know how we can help you" or "breakfast is from so-and-so time".    We go to our room and were immediately overwhelmed by the smell of dog urine.  We called right away and
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel is Ok, location good. The breakfast needs to improve. Staff from the desk are very nice, from the restaurant need to work a lot. Tables were dirty, used plates left and sometimes you don´t see a single soul. Honestly, the previous reviews and the price are very, very overrated.
Manager Response: Dear TEMIDO,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review to let others know about your recent stay at our hotel. The feedback you have provided is greatly appreciated. Rest assured that your concerns will be addressed and used to make improvements wherever necessary.  Sincerely,  Sandra Zuno General Manager

Summary: I've stayed here three times now, and will continue to come back whenever I stay in Orange County. The hotel is in a great location, very close to Disneyland, the Gardenwalk, and shopping. The rooms are lovely, and the free breakfast and parking are wonderful perks.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Nothing special, clean and comfy though.  I wouldn't choose this hotel for the breakfast.  Leaves a lot to be desired compared to other hotels I've stayed that advertise free breakfast.  A two mile walk to restaurants in the area. Shuttle for Disneyland was good. The staff is somewhat accommodating.
Manager Response: Dear Rhonda M,  Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review. We appreciate the candid review you have provided. I regret to see that our complimentary full American breakfast did not meet your standards. Nevertheless, I hope that this does not deter you from returning to our hotel.  Sincerely,  Sandra Zuno General Manager

Summary: This hotel has a contemporary styled lobby.  The front desk staff are warm and welcoming upon arrival and throughout the stay they will greet you in the morning, afternoon and evening, all the while accommodating your questions and requests with pleasure.  The hallways and rooms are reminiscent of smaller, European boutique type hotels with American touches. For instance, each room has a small refrigerator in the room which you are free to use for your own food and beverages--no electronically stocked fridges!  Many rooms have microwaves in them or can be requested.  I am told the hallways will soon be updated to be more in line with the contemporary look and feel of the lobby.  The big seller here is the staff who make the stay a memorable one.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel needs work.  Could start with a good airing out.  The breakfast room has some bare wooden banquet tables. Not appetizing.  The rooms that face the street are fairly noisy all night.  Overall not the best choice.
Manager Response: Dear Richard B,  Thank you so much for your candid review. Your feedback and input regarding our accommodations are appreciated as it will be of tremendous value when plans for renovations begin to unfold. Thank you again and we hope you consider staying with us in the future.  Sincerely,  Sandra Zuno General Manager

Summary: This is a small and unpretentious, but very welcoming and comfortable venue for visiting Chapman University and the area.  Our room was exceptionally clean and was well appointed.  The most memorable aspect of our stay however, was the extremely friendly and accommodating staff, from the front desk to housekeeping to the breakfast room staff.  Speaking of breakfast -- nothing fancy but it was hot and good both mornings we were there, and fresh coffee in the lobby is always a welcome plus for me.  We also enjoyed the pool patio and our 5-year-old grandson loved the heated pool.  Minor draw-back: the guest-room doors are apparently thin and sound ravels readily from the hallways, but it was never much of an issue.  Because my son who just graduated plans to work in Orange for the
Manager Response: none

Summary: We came to Orange to attend the graduation ceremony at Chapman University.  We probably should have booked earlier, as many hotels were booked for the weekend.  We searched TripAdvisor and ended up book the ALO.  Our flight arrived very early and we got the the hotel well before check in.  The gracious and friendly desk staff allowed us an early check in, which allowed us to relax and change clothes before the ceremony.   The staff was very helpful.  The room was clean and pleasant.  We were on the ground floor with a view of the pool.  A bit noisy from the hallway, and I am not a fan of the window heating and cooling systems (also a bit noisy).  Breakfast was very good, and there is a lovely outdoor seating area.   Would definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hotel rooms are very clean and well decorated.  Good quality bed and furnishings.  They provide a decent breakfast, and are close to the UC Irvine Medical Center.  Staff we pleasant, and competent.  Close to many attractions also.   Good free wifi.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great wedding weekend minus the restaurant
Summary: The hotel was beautiful and the customer service was also so great and accommodating! We had our wedding at a church close by and the family and friends from the wedding all stayed at this hotel during that weekend. Everyone enjoyed it and had such a nice time. However, the hotel restaurant almost ruined our rehearsal dinner and I do not recommend this restaurant for anything except for the complimentary hotel breakfast. The restaurant had the worst customer service and made an already stressed out day before our wedding even more stressful. Otherwise, this hotel was perfect for our wedding.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The room was spacious beds were very comfortable  breakfast was really good not walking distance to Disneyland  bathroom was nice and clean the closet space they give you for your clothes is actually pretty cool
Manager Response: Dear nespinoza0413,  Thank you so much for the feedback you have provided. Your warm compliments regarding our accommodations and complimentary breakfast are greatly appreciated. Thank you again for your insight and we look forward to serving you again in the future.  Sincerely,  Sandra Zuno General Manager

Summary: I spent a week here recently, and I will definitely return. The rooms were very clean and comfortable, and the staff was courteous and helpful. I have stayed all over S. Ca. For business, and find this to be a great value!  Thank you.
Manager Response: Dear S8409NMmattm,  Thank you so much for your candid review. I am contented to hear that you had an enjoyable stay. Thank you so much for your kind compliments regarding the cleanliness of our hotel and our exceptional team members. We look forward to welcoming you back soon!  Sincerely,  Sandra Zuno General Manager

Summary: This was a good option in the Anaheim/Orange area. The room was clean and comfortable. The staff was very friendly. Free parking was great. I did not connect to their wifi, but it is complimentary. The free breakfast was in a back room off the restaurant, nothing glamorous, folding tables and chairs, but eggs, pancakes, sausage, fruit, yogurt and a selection of cereal. So definitely enough to get you started in the morning. I think the location would be great for visiting Disney. With family in the Anaheim area, I will definite stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I don't like taking time for reviews, but felt I needed to here. This hotel, its location, price, cleanliness and service make it a 5 star hotel without hesitation for me. My wife and I were impressed on all levels. The breakfast was an outstanding added benefit. I'd like to mention "Luis" at the front desk. He provided outstanding service upon check in and check out. All the staff were great, Luis is the only one I made a point to remember for this review, as I'm notorious for not remembering names. Do not hesitate to book this hotel!
Manager Response: Dear Clanceman,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review and provide some feedback regarding your recent stay. I am delighted to hear that you enjoyed the value that our hotel has to offer. Your kind compliments are greatly appreciated and I am ecstatic to see that Luis made your stay a memorable one. We hope to welcome you back soon.  Sincerely,  Sandra Zuno General Manager

Summary: Arrived at this hotel after flying from Hawaii and was looking forward to a good night's rest. about two hours into a sound sleep, the phone rang twice. I bolted upright in bed, dazed from a heavy slumber, not knowing where I was, and the ringing stopped. I went back to sleep and about an hour later, it rang once, then stopped. The intermittent ringing occurred two other times. Theygave me a 10% reduction in my bill and I felt I should've received more but it was non-negotiable. This was an older hotel, the toilet flush sounded like an airplane, walls were thin and only best part was the comfortable king-sized bed. I selected this hotel because of the proximity to Disneyland (fair), the complimentary breakfast (good) and that they had a highly rated Mexican fusion restaurant
Manager Response: Dear Valerie M,  Thank you kindly for your candid review. We greatly appreciate the feedback you have provided and sincerely apologize for any and all the inconveniences you experience during your stay. Thank so much for bringing these issues to our attention and please rest assured that these will be addressed to avoid further inconveniences. Once again, thank you for your honesty and insightful feedback as it will allow us to make improvements wherever necessary. I would like to kindly encourage you to return to our hotel so that we are able to offer you the service you deserve.  Sincerely,  Sandra Zuno General Manager

Summary: The room was a little "stale" smelling, the customer service was great, they replaced the toilet completely when it broke.  The room could use some updating however.  The room was cleaned well and the staff did a nice job doing so but it seemed a little dusty and like it could use some new carpet or something to get rid of some of the old smell.
Manager Response: Dear Mark L,  Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review to let others on TripAdvisor know about your experience at our hotel. Your valuable insight is greatly appreciated and I would like to invite you to consider staying with us in the future as plans for room renovations are in the works. Thank you again for your feedback and we hope to serve you again in the future.  Sincerely,  Sandra Zuno General Manager

Summary: The location is perfect for Anaheim nearby attractions. The disney shuttle is $5 a day. Free parking. Continental breakfast is OK. Wifi works. There is a second Ayres-Hotel to the right, when this is full. Clean rooms. Would go there again. :)
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: We come back here again and again
Summary: Can not say enough good things about the service here, and that's the main reason we stay here every time we go down to Chapman University (which is a LOT). This last trip, we were stuck with an early morning flight. Figured we'd have to ditch our luggage in a closet or something since check in time isn't until 3. But our man at the front desk, the always on-top-of-it Cory, found us a room at that hour and let us check in. Saved us a lot of stress, since we had to be at a double header by 11 and knew we wouldn't be back to the room until well after dinner. So nice to have him go that extra bit just to help us out. No quoting bureaucratic policy about check in times or anything, just did what he could to help. I love ALO Orange.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband and I along with our two teenage girls stayed here for 10 nights at the beginning of April.  We were highly impressed with the very helpful and friendly staff at the front desk.  The hotel itself is also very clean and has a great "feel".  The lobby always has hot coffee (which I needed all the time with so many Disney days) along with fresh hot cookies in the evening for the girls, and the hubs lol.   The breakfast is basically the same everyday, only switches between bacon and sausage along with pancakes or French toast.  I am celiac tho (basically highly allergic to gluten) so the morning staff went and made sure what I could have without being sick so that was awesome.  The "bread" table was in a whole separate section so it was great not having crumbs to worry
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our stay at the ALO was very pleasant.   The hotel was clean and quiet. Ample parking. We stayed 6 nights. We arrived early, our room wasn't ready but the staff called us as soon as it was (about 11 am) They were very helpful and accommodating.   The room was simple;  beds, night stands,  tv stand with drawers & writing desk. Mid-size refrigerator and single serve coffee pot.   Bathroom was nice .  Had a full sized tub.  For us this was a big plus. My son prefers a bath over a shower.  Breakfast was buffet style.  Eggs, pancakes, cereals, oatmeal, breads, bagels and morning type refreshments.  Saturday morning was busy but the staff kept up with the demands.  I would definitely stay again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Pro's:  -Staff friendly and helpful -Breakfast is slightly better than average  -Starbucks is less than a minute walk away -Rooms of a good standard if a little dated -Bed very comfy -Very clean -Wifi very good (easily streamed netflix)  Con's:  - Seems to be popular with schools as we had 3 different schools staying there who woke us up several times (the rooms are not very soundproof from the hallway) - Its not in a great area and definitely not ideal for Disney (harbour road in anaheim is much nicer) - Rooms poorly insulated from hallways
Manager Response: none

Summary: Have stayed at the ALO several times since moving out of the area. I have never been disappointed. The rooms are clean, and have everything I need...coffee maker, iron, refrig, hair dryer, good A/C...not to mention free wifi and free parking and to top it off... a substantial breakfast buffet!  The staff is very friendly, hard-working, caring!  They even remembered my name!  It is in a prime location...a stone's throw from the Angel's baseball stadium, across the street from UC Irvine Medical Center (visiting medical professionals stay at the ALO)...short walk to a good outlet mall, great restaurants...what else?  A Disneyland van swings buy and picks up families and drops them off at the park!  Seriously, a very very good value.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is close to the freeways and to Disney Land. Rooms are well appointed. Bathrooms are a little small but serves the purpose. The free breakfast was very good, not your normal carb breakfast. Free parking and internet as well. I would stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: lobby very contemporary, rooms seem retro.  comfortable and clean though, toilet jet flushes very loud especially middle of night, ceiling light/fan nice touch, breakfast good awkward eating areas, overall very good
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Ok hotel for a quick stay
Summary: I would not tank this any higher than 3 or 3.5. Definitely not as high as the current average. Breakfast was okay, in a make shift room, seemed odd.  Bathroom could use a facelift.  Close to Angels stadium.
Manager Response: Dear John T,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your recent stay. I regret to see that our hotel did not exceed your expectations. Your valuable feedback is greatly appreciated as it will allow us to make improvements wherever necessary. We hope to see you again soon!  Sincerely,  Sandra Zuno General Manager

Summary Heading: Great spot to visit Disneyland and Anaheim
Summary: An older hotel but well maintained. Pool area small but well kept. Located along the ART route 14 and only 15 minutes each way. Can buy ART tickets from the front desk.  Awesome front desk staff - very helpful.   Ask for an upper floor facing Disneyland / can see the fireworks :)
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here 2 nights. The rooms where clean and spacious . Lots of parking and its included in price . Close to outlets of orange . I did see a shuttle to Disneyland. Would recommend for a family to stay .
Manager Response: none

Summary: Everything was nice about this hotel from the lobby to the polite staff. I only stayed one night, but I can honestly say it wasn't that bad. My kid actually locked the bathroom door and right away staff came up to unlock it.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were recently in the Anaheim area on business and needed a last minute room. What a pleasant surprise? Very reasonably priced considering this was Spring Break and almost every hotel was sold out or too expensive.  Staff were very friendly and efficient. Rooms were spotless, well appointed, and very comfortable. We will definitely stay again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel and wonderful staff
Summary: My wife and I initially we're only going to stay one night. But we liked it so much that we stayed three nights. We can see the Disney fireworks out our window each night. We can see lots of palm trees from our window too. The free breakfast is great, with eggs and bacon and hashbrowns and yogurt and cereal and fresh fruit. And the staff couldn't be nicer. Excellent hotel and a great location.
Manager Response: Dear 385bob,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel! I am thrilled that you enjoyed your first night so much that you booked an additional two! Your kind compliments regarding our accommodations, breakfast, and team members are greatly appreciated. We hope to see you again very soon.  Sincerely,  Sandra Zuno General Manager

Summary Heading: Good choice for a Disney trip
Summary: I stayed here Monday-Friday and chose this hotel because it allowed pets and was fairly close to Disneyland. I wouldn't say it was a pet-friendly hotel though, because they do add a $45 taxable fee. I have an older, small, well-trained dog and don't understand the extra fee. Other than that I enjoyed my stay and would recommend this hotel as it was clean, safe and the customer service was superb.   Pros: * Friendly, helpful staff * Allow pets * Comfortable bed/pillows * Good amount of closet space/cubby storage in closet * Free parking, wifi, hot breakfast * The restaurant on site is great  Cons: * No microwave in the room. You have to go to the vending area on the 2nd floor. There is plenty of space to put one in the room, so I highly suggest they do. * No full length mirror.
Manager Response: Dear nataliej925,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your most recent stay. I am happy to see that you enjoyed your stay and took advantage of our optimal location. We greatly appreciate the insight you have provided and the suggestions you have made. Thank you so much for your time and we hope to welcome you back soon.  Sincerely,  Sandra Zuno General Manager

Summary Heading: Excellent Hotel for a stay in Anaheim
Summary: This hotel is a great hotel worthy of it's 3 and 1/2 star rating.  Breakfast is good and having free parking with free breakfast and internet plus no resort fee is very nice.  The hotel has a shuttle to Disneyland and is located very close to Anaheim stadium.  A great shopping mall is located down the street.  It is a quiet hotel that is clean and well kept up.  The only issue is that they do have one room queen beds so make sure if you need a king that you ask for a king.  The rooms are spacious and the queen had a nice seating area.
Manager Response: Dear Connie W,  Thank you so very much for taking the time to review your recent stay at our hotel. We are truly grateful for the kind compliments you have provided and we hope to serve you again in the future.  Sincerely,  Sandra Zuno General Manager

Summary: Very friendly and helpful employees. The room was cleanand had comfy beds. You could see the disneyland fireworks from our window. The breakfast buffet was great. We parked in the parking garage most days but it was not a far walk to get to our room and had a security guard walking the lot which was nice. The shuttle was always on time and had friendly drivers. You could bill the shuttle passes to your room it was only only a 10 minute ride to disneyland. The hot tub/pool outside was nice and quiet...great to sit in the hot tub at the end of a long day. Overall our experience with them was awesome and we would highly recommend staying with them.
Manager Response: Dear Miranda K,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your recent stay at ALO Hotel. I am contented to see that you enjoyed your stay and took advantage of our optimal location. I cannot thank you enough for the kind compliments you have shared regarding our complimentary full American breakfast, friendly team members, and our optimal location. Thank you so much for your recommendations and we look forward to serving you again.  Sincerely,  Sandra Zuno General Manager

Summary: A great place to stay.  Very convenient to many area attractions.  Walking distance, if you don't mind walking a couple of miles.  The rooms are well appointed and comfortable.  The bathrooms are rather small, but functional.  In the afternoon, chocolate chip cookies are provided in the lobby, which is a nice gesture.  Breakfast is served daily as part of the room charge, however the items served are the same each day with no variety.  The hotel staff are very friendly and accommodating.  Would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Randall C,  Thank yo so much for taking the time to write a review about your recent experience at ALO Hotel. I am delighted to read that you enjoyed your stay and the optimal location of our hotel. Thank you kindly for your compliments regarding our wonderful team and we look forward to serving you again!  Sincerely,  Sandra Zuno General Manager

Summary Heading: Excellent place for our Disney trip!
Summary: Our stay at ALO Hotel was wonderful. The hotel is clean, the staff is very friendly and the shuttle service was very convenient! Cory Irwin at the front desk was very polite and helpful.   We will be booking this hotel again next year when we come back to Disneyland!!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel staff is very accommodating and friendly. I stay at this hotel frequently for work and have not had a bad experience yet. The rooms are large, luxurious, and have a refrigerator, which is very nice.  The breakfast is full service and very good with meat, eggs, and pancakes/waffles.  There is a shuttle going to Disneyland every 15 minutes (I could not use it as I was working, but very convenient for families).  They have lemon/strawberry water, hot tea and coffee as well as cookies every evening.  This is a wonderful hotel to stay at and I would recommend this hotel to everyone.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My wife and I were there for four nights for Disnyland and March madness; service was good but a couple issues.  First, the TV channel listing didn't match the actual channels so when we were recuperating in our room after long days playing we never knew which channel number we wanted and just had to go up and down til we found it.  Second, it is right across the street from a very busy hospital and we heard helicopters, ambulances, police cars, and fire trucks all night long.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great service, breakfast is very good. Rooms spacious. Overall an excellent value and  a great location (Disneyland, UCI Medical Center, near freeways). Staff very helpful and accommodating. I highly recommend the ALO Hotel for business or pleasure stays. Greathavxing coffee/water/cookies all day!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Front desk staff member, Corey, was outstanding in his customer service from booking to check in and throughout our stay.  There was nothing he couldn't or wouldn't do to make our stay enjoyable.  We even forgot the key to our luggage lock and he got it removed...in less than 10 minutes of our request!  The FREE breakfast they provide is also very good.  Always hot and fresh and a great variety to choose from.  We will definitely stay there again!!!!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Who are all the people rating this 5 stars? Can we be honest here
Summary: We wanted to go to Disney which is close by & wanted a conveniently located hotel. We knew it was 3 star, but we figured as it was just for 2 nights it was fine - plus look at the reviews on here we thought we were winning.   When we arrived we were also very impressed. The lobby when you arrive is modern & looks amazing. And the staff that greeted us were so friendly and lovely. Great welcome! Very competent! We were happy about the free WIFI and parking. We could see the Disney shuttle pulling up outside. All was well!  But the goodness ended in the lobby. The rest of the hotel has clearly not been renovated. It is so dated. Busy carpets, grandma's drapes from the 60s and really strange bad smells.   We were in room 302. Positives - Comfy bed, it was clean, there was a fridge,
Manager Response: Dear Dana J,  Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review to let others know about your recent stay. Though I am contented to read that you enjoyed our optimal location and our recently renovated lobby, I do regret to read that the remainder of your stay left much to be desired. Though it would be wonderful to renovate the entire hotel all at once, realistically speaking, it is simply not doable. Renovations are done in parts and we kindly encourage you to consider staying with us after room renovations have taken place. I also regret to hear that our complimentary full American breakfast did not meet your standards. Nevertheless, we hope this experience does not deter you from staying with us in the future.  Sincerely,  Sandra Zuno General Manager

Summary: A Great "Value for Money" hotel...  Stayed 5 nights visiting friends around LA and OC.  Staff: Friendly and helpful Rooms: Everything you need, excellent linens and towels. 2 minor quibbles - and they are very minor - the bed was a bit soft for me, and the water pressure in the shower could have been stronger. TV and internet: Excellent! 75 or channels, all in HD, and the internet was always at least 10mb down. Decent breakfast in what becomes a very popular restaurant for lunch and dinner. Location is great. The new Ayres is right behind the ALO. I've stayed there before and hope to stay there again
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: ALO Hotel - A great place to stay
Summary: The hotel was very nice. The beds were comfortable, the service was excellent. The view was terrific. Some tips: There is not a safe in the room; when you step out of the tub, it's a step down - I almost fell a couple of times until I got used to that. The vending machines (ice too) is on the 6th and 2nd floors - not every floor. The pool had leaves in it so we didn't go in, but the hot tub was nice and relaxing. The paid shuttle to the parks was a great value. The slip listing all times the shuttle leaves - only lists hotel times - not park times.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We recently stayed here for five nights and ended up mostly enjoying our stay.  The main thing I really enjoyed about this hotel was the staff, they were super friendly and accommodating.  The location was really convenient for us, and at a great price.  The rooms were small, clean, but maybe could use some upgrading.  We didn't experience much street noise at night, but the walls were pretty thin so we heard our neighbor's TV a lot at night.  The only other problem was the hall noise at 5 AM on Friday morning.  The fitness room is very small, as I expected, but had everything I would normally use.  The breakfast was good for what it was (free and buffet style).  I would definitely return.
Manager Response: none

Summary: 1.  Room was clean, however got extremely warm and A/C would not work well enough to make the temperature satisfactory.  2. Included breakfast was horrible.  Eating area was like a warehouse off the kitchen, food and selection poor, uncovered round banquet tables.  Some food was in the main room and some in another adjacent room.  Bad setup.  I've stayed at several other hotels with included breakfast that was great, ALO doesn't seem to make much of an effort.  I will not be staying there again!  Better choices for the same money.
Manager Response: Dear Fred A,  Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review about your most recent stay at our hotel. Our team kindly encourages our guests to voice any and all concerns immediately so that they may be addressed properly. I regret to hear that our complimentary full American breakfast did not meet your standards when compared to other hotels within our collection. Your input is highly and deeply valued.  Sincerely,  Sandra Zuno General Manager

Summary: Upon arrival in the clean moderately sized lobby we were greeted with smiles.  The lobby had coffee and water for the taking.   The hotel is walking distance from UCI Medical Center, although a very large intersection separates the facilities.  The hotel isn't walking distance from Disneyland but the Anaheim Resort Transportation bus makes regular stops at ALO and all other Anaheim area hotels.  The fee is $5/day.  The hotel room is clean and modern. The bed and pillows were comfortable. There always seems to be a shortage of electrical outlets no matter which hotel with today's connected lifestyle.    The front desk staff seemed to be genuinely interested in making sure our stay was comfortable.  The different staff members we encountered over our stay all seemed to be happy at
Manager Response: Dear Kerry F,  Thank you so much for taking the time to share a review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your recent experience at ALO Hotel. I am delighted to read that you enjoyed your stay with us and the service we provided you with. Thank you so much for your kind compliments regarding our accommodations and our helpful team members. We hope to serve you again sometime soon.  Sincerely,  Sandra Zuno General Manager

Summary: We stayed 8 nights with a family of 5 including tween aged kids. This worked fine with a double queen room. It was pretty quiet even on the weekend. We were grateful for the free buffet style breakfast that varied slightly each day. We were gone most days from morning till night. The room was always tidied when we came back and we felt safe to leave our things in our room. We appreciated the storage shelves and dresser for our luggage. The mini fridge is decent sized. There is no microwave in the room but there is one available as well as an ice machine on the second floor. The staff was very friendly and always willing to help out. We did use the small pool and hot tub once but It was still a little cold for early March. We would stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear cmo303,  I am delighted to hear that your mini staycation was a success! I am glad to read that you took advantage of and enjoyed our complimentary full American breakfast. Thank you kindly for your compliments regarding our diligent team members. We hope to welcome you back soon.  Sincerely,  Sandra Zuno General Manager

Summary: This is a very nice hotel!   The staff was nice,  friendly, welcoming and extremely helpful with van schedules, show schedules airport transportation. The room was excellent, nicely decorated.  Great place, great price!!!  A wonderful stay. I will be back.
Manager Response: Dear Uncle D,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel. I am glad that you enjoyed your stay and greatly appreciate your compliments regarding our diligent team as well as the value of our hotel. We all hope to see you again very soon.  Sincerely,  Sandra Zuno General Manager

Summary: We stayed for four nights and had a great time. The staff was super friendly and helpful. The lobby looked new but the rooms looked they were older. We didn't spend much time in the room so it didn't really matter.  The breakfast was great, good variety of food and also hot breakfast.  Location was close enough to Disneyland, liked it was away from all the Disneyland traffic. Only didn't like I could hear the road traffic and ambulance at night (close by hospital). This is only because I am a light sleeper. Overall great experience and will recommend staying at this hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed in Alo Hotel for 2 nights the staff we're very nice and helpful, the breakfast was yummy, the hotel is very clean the is perfect if you are planning to visit the outlet of orange very close going to Disneyland is a little far but it wasn't too bad. I will recommend this hotel to groups and family or solo.  I will stay here again
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel was nice and clean and conveniently located. The room was nicely appointed. Watched Disneyland fireworks from the window. I would stay here again. I Übered over to the Orange Outlets, where there are lots of fun stores and restaurants.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for three nights to celebrate our 29th Anniversary at Disneyland. The staff was very welcoming and professional from the time of arrival to our departure. Our room was beautiful, clean and comfortable for the price. The breakfast was delicious with adequate variety.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The ALO is across street from UCI Hospital . Staff is very accommodating . Very friendly front desk staff especially Corey assist mgr and Sandra general mgr. I feel at home here. Decent hot breakfast buffet. I would highly recommend to anyone.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Was in town late, needed a room just to crash in! Front desk was nice, super friendly, easy to get in and into bed :)  Thanks for the hospitality! Great room, great rate!  ps. slept in past breakfast :(
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is truly wonderful for the price ! The breakfast was very good for free. Rooms were super clean and amazingly comfortable!  Pool was clean staff was very friendly. Awesome view of fire works from Disneyland!  We will definitely stay here again !
Manager Response: none

Summary: Even if you're not there for Disneyland it's a good place to stay. Rooms are comfortable with a real couch nice bed. On my last visit staff was attentive and friendly. There was some electrical issue that only affected the lights in the lobby, but the desk people took it in stride and had a good sense of humor about the new "mood lighting" from Home Depot. Breakfast was ok - though if you want good coffee go to Starbucks next door! Lots of free parking. A good value overall.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We love this hotel! We were lucky enough to win a trip from getawaytoday.com for our honeymoon and chose this hotel.  We loved it so much that we stay in it every year when we make our yearly Disneyland trip.  Unfortunately, it isn't available for us to stay when we go in May this year so we will be staying at the Springhill Suites but I would HIGHLY recommend it to anyone.  The staff has always been super helpful and is very nice. The hot breakfast was always delicious and it isn't too far of a shuttle ride to Disney.  Thanks for all your accommodations the 7+ times we've stayed, we're sad we won't be there in May.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Rooms were clean with a comfortable bed.  Although the hotel sits on a main street across the street from a medical center we did not experience any street traffic noise. The complementary  breakfast was very adequate.  We definitely would stay there again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This place was a life savor. Came in town just go take my hubby to Disney land for the first time and had loads of fun. The only problem was decorations were a little out dated and the hallway smell a little musky but besides that had no complaints. The shuttle to Disney land was awesome too. And all the staff were super nice.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My best friend and I stayed here for a quick weekend at Disneyland. It was affordable, comfortable, and, not only close to Disneyland, but near a great shopping outlet. The breakfast was also pretty great. Highly recommended!
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is awesome. Clean, organized. Awesome breakfast, walking distance from good places to eat, shopping... Staff very polite, they don't charge to receive packages from online stores as most of other hotels do. I'm definitely recommending them!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Clean and convenient hotel near the freeway.
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights.  The rooms were clean and the staff was extremely friendly. The breakfast that was offered was good and the menu changed daily. I would stay here again.   They do not allow any roll away beds due to fire hazard.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My family and I LOVE this hotel! We have annual  passes to Disneyland and try to come down once a month or every other and have stayed at many hotels/motels in the area. But once we tried Alo we could never go back to anything else, extremely worth the extra money for the delicious breakfast to the pillow like beds. It's so comfortable that we have a hard time leaving in the morning to go to the park because we are so comfy! The only think I wish this hotel had is a rewards program so we would get some rewards from all we stay here. :) a few more pro's are the excellent customer service and fresh baked cookies every night when you come back from the park. Your seriously missing out if you don't stay here!
Manager Response: none

Summary: My wife and I have stayed several times and as always very comfortable. Covenient and close to resturants, Starbucks and a outdoor mall. We will stay here every time we come. The staff is very professional and personal.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The room was clean.  The bathroom was clean but on the smallish side.  The staff was friendly.  The buffet breakfast was satisfactory.  The hotel was very close to the UCI Medical Center; that was why my spouse and I selected this location.  There is also a shopping area close to the hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Friendly Staff! Clean, kept up hotel! Great Breakfast!
Summary: Everyone was very friendly! My family and I enjoyed our stay! The rooms were clean and kept up! Bed was comfortable. Staff was friendly and helpful! Breakfast they offered was great! It wasn't just donuts and coffee. It was a full breakfast! My boys loved it!
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband and I attended a wedding and reception not far from this hotel.  We were quite pleased with the ease of check-in and check out. The complimentary breakfast was more than adequate, the hotel is clean, the staff is courteous.  There's some ambient noise from the outside, but not enough to bother our sleep.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were overall pleased with our experience during our stay. The check in process was smooth and the staff was friendly. We arrived early and were able to check in early, however for a $30 fee :(  The room was very clean and the beds were extremely comfortable. Our room had a fridge which was convenient. Although breakfast was included, we were disappointed. When all of the eggs were gone, instead of the server bringing out a new pan of eggs, he brought out the eggs in a bowl & dumped them in the old pan....I thought that was nasty and unsanitary. There was hair on the syrup container. The food was out in the open like a buffet...just a germ fest in my opinion.  We ate breakfast at a mom & pop restaurant named Kimmies. I highly recommend it. It's about 10 minutes away from the
Manager Response: none

Summary: Took the family for a SoCal Vacation.  Very friendly and helpful staff, clean room, good breakfast and a convenient shuttle to Disney(although finding the return shuttle was a little confusing but not the hotels fault).  Beds and pillows very comfy.  In fact my wife purchased her pillow.  Would definitely return.

Summary: I stayed here because the reviews were decent and the travel agent suggested it. I must say the decor in the hall was nice, and the staff was friendly.  Here is what I did not like: The breakfast area was a let down to say the least. We stayed for 3-4 nights and for some reason I can't explain they had linen table cloths in the breakfast area. You would think that would be nice, and it was if you were the fist person to eat that day; otherwise the table would have salsa and syrup on it. I watched how they cleaned the tables while we were eating and lady taking care of the area simply picked up any big pieces of food and garbage. My wife often would get breakfast elsewhere. We picked up a few oatmeal packets and as luck would have it the room did not have a microwave. The view
Manager Response: Dear Clark W,  Thank you for the insight you have provided based on your most recent stay. Summary: This is a nice location. It was a Ayers property still is but due to the new one built right next door they changed the name ((I'm guessing)). Good service from staff, clean rooms, the free breakfast is okay nothing special. It is close to a mall that has many dinning options. Also only a few exits down from Disneyland. We have stayed form business trips and with family.

Summary: Rooms are really nice. Service is good. Breakfast leaves something to be desired. Issues with key cards were a thorn in my side. There's a fridge in room that's helpful but no microwave. Beds are hard. Pool looked great. Close to Disney but not really walking distance.
Manager Response: Dear tawnirn,  Thank you so much for the kind compliments regarding our accommodations and exceptional service. Your valuable insight in regards to breakfast and our key cards is greatly appreciated as we work on making improvements wherever necessary. Though our guest rooms are not equipped with microwaves, there are some located on communal grounds that are readily available for guest use 24/7. We are about 3 miles away from the park and do not recommend that our guests walk; however, the Anaheim Resort Transit offers shuttle services from the hotel to the park and back at a nominal fee. Once again thank you for your feedback and we hope you consider staying with us in the future.  Sincerely,  Sandra Zuno General Manager

Summary: Hotel was just ok. Kind of dated room. Served the purpose of getting  a few hours of sleep after leaving Disneyland  at 12:30 am. following a company event. Breakfast was not good, cold and unappealing.
Manager Response: Dear Cathy S,  Thank you kindly for your candid review. Though I am glad to see that you took advantage of our optimal location, it saddens me to read that your overall experience was anything else than exceptional.
