They have a couch, coffee table and desk area.  Our friends had the queen and it was much smaller than our king. I love that they have a mini fridge in the room to store drinks or food. The bed was comfy and we both slept great without any noise. The breakfast was really good with tons of options. If you're prefer Starbucks, there's one 2 doors down. We didn't eat at the restaurant so I'm not sure but it looked very interesting (French Mexican cuisine).
Manager Response: We are delighted to read you had a great stay at our hotel!  Thank you for your kind feedback.  We look forward to having the opportunity to serve you in the near future!

Summary: I had to make a business trip to Orange recently and had originally planned to stay at one of the large chain hotels on Harbor Boulevard.  I did a search on TripAdvisor for Orange hotels and ran across the Ayres Inn, saw the good reviews, and figured why not.  It looked nice and not too big and it’s fairly close to the office I was visiting. I’m pleased I made the choice. The Ayres is a smallish hotel with a nice lobby and pool area.  I was also surprised when I arrived to see they had a restaurant.  The front desk staff were very friendly and efficient.  My room was bigger than expected and quite nice.  It had windows that open (which I really like – I hate feeling like I’m sealed in).  It was very clean as was the bathroom.  The bed was comfortable.  The Inn has free parking
Manager Response: Dear Guest Thank you for the great review!  Wanted to let you and everyone know that Anepalco's restaurant is in the process of aquiring a full liquor license and will be expanding the restaurant to include a full bar.  We are about 3 months away from martini's and cosmo's.  Christine Smith General Manager Ayres Inn Orange

Summary: Absolutely loved our stay here. The continental breakfast was real good. Parking was easy. Hotel is at a great location, 10 minutes from Disneyland, across from outlet shops and easy access to freeway. This hotel was very affordable which made our trip even more enjoyable. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Housekeeping did a great job in cleaning and making sure that they restocked everything for the next day. Would defitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay at the Ayres Inn Orange, for your family trip to Disneyland!  We are very happy to read you loved your stay with us.  Thank you for sharing with our reviewers the great features of our hotel and staff!  We will share your feedback with our team as it is incredibly encouraging for our staff to hear such kind words from our guests who had a wonderful stay at our hotel.  We look forward to seeing you again the next time you visit Disneyland!

Summary: Had a wonderful stay at the Ayres Inn Orange, CA.  It felt like being home.  The room was so comfortable and clean.  The breakfast in the morning was ample and excellent - great coffee! The staff was so helpful and friendly.  Thanks!!!!
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful review of our hotel!  I am pleased to hear that you felt at home at our hotel! We are glad to be your home away from home any time you visit the Orange area. You highlighted areas of our hotel we are very proud of, such as the comfort and cleanliness of our rooms, the hearty breakfast we offer and the friendly service our staff provides!  We look forward to welcoming you back soon!

Summary: I stayed at the Ayres Orange for the Disneyland Marathon based on reviews on Tripadvisor.  The front desk staff (Amy) helped me out and went way over and above to make my stay enjoyable.  She helped me find cool places to hang out at night and where to find some random things I forgot to pack like sunscreen etc.  The hotel is self was really nice and I was very impressed with the room.  I liked it more than the typical hotel setup.  The shuttle to Disney at the front door was extremely convenient as well.  If I go back to Disneyland I will be staying at the Ayres
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. It is always great to read how a member of our staff exceeded our guests' expectations!  We will make sure to celebrate Amy for her outstanding service.   As you mentioned, there is a shuttle that runs every thirty minutes to the Disney Theme Parks.   An all day "ART" shuttle costs $5 per Adult and $2 per child.    Thank you again for your review and we look forward to seeing you on your next visit to Disney!

Summary: I thought this hotel was a great value, with a full breakfast and free parking.  Unlike other 3 star hotels, they don't have central air, so leave it on all day, and you'll be good.  We were on the 6th floor, and it was unseasonably hot, so I'm sure it was just during this heat wave.  The only thing I thought was unacceptable was the soap they give you for the sink and bath.  I've never used Lava soap, but I can imagine that is what it is like.  Very hard and sand-like.  I have rosacea, so I should've known better and brought my own.  I had never stayed at an Ayres before, and I think they have great customer service.  The soap is my only complaint, so I recommend them, but bring your own! :)
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind comments!  The soap we offer next to the sink is an oatmeal soap for face washing and does have the lava like grittiness..  The soap for the tub is a milder smooth soap body soap without the lava like grittiness.  I apologize if you did not receive this soap.  Should you stay with us in the future just call aheas and ask for an alternative, we will ahppily fulfill your request.  Christine Smith General Manager

Summary: We stayed for 4 nights at the Ayres Inn Orange.  From check-in to check-out all of the employees went out of their way to be helpful and accommodating.  The room rate included free wi-fi, parking, and breakfast.  The breakfast buffet had plenty of variety, but I've had much better elsewhere.  The location was perfect for us, close to shopping, dining, and major freeways.  The room was plenty large for our family of 4.  The room included a small refrigerator (no freezer section), coffee maker and plenty of storage.  Overall, we were very happy with our stay at the Ayres Inn Orange.
Manager Response: Dear Guest Thank you review on Trip Advisor, my staff and I appreciate your comments and kindess! Christine Smith Genearl Manager

Summary: Somehow my reservation was made for the wrong date. Shame on me for not carefully reviewing my email confirmation as I should have.  Once I learned of the mistake, I immediately called the hotel and left a message for a manager to return my call.  Sandra Zuno called and was extremely warm and friendly.  After a brief explanation of my mistake, without hesitation, Sandra agreed to change the date and not charge me for our "no show".  Per the terms of the reservation, she could have charged me the full room rate but it is clear to me that she understands that building good customer relationships is sometimes more important. Based on how I was treated, Ayres Inn will always be my first choice when visiting my daughter at Chapman University.  Our room was very clean and the staff
Manager Response: Dear Guest  Thank you for your review and complimenting Sandra, My Assistant General Manager.  We all strive to meet and exceed our guest needs and are happy to know we did so fo ryou.  We look forward to seeing you during the next couple of years when you viist your child at Chapman University.  Christine Smith General Manager

Summary Heading: I've always wanted to stay here - and here's why....
Summary: During our past few times we've stayed "near Disneyland", I've always been awarded the Doubletree in Orange. I've always seen this hotel from the towering Doubletree. The trouble with Priceline bidding, I may get a good deal in paying for the night's stay BUT, the amenities (such as internet access and parking) is not always disclosed (unless you use the Express Deal), or in this case, I used Hotwire. As much as I enjoyed staying at the Doubletree, the parking fee is an additional of $20 (if not more). So this time around, I used Hotwire, and made sure I chose a hotel with free parking, internet, and breakfast...and I got Ayres Inn for around $70 (before tax/fees)....it came to around $82.50/night.  My family was greeted by Amy at the Front Desk, and she was extremely pleasant.
Manager Response: Dear Guest I wanted to let you know that we appreciated your review and comments and especially noting our complimentary breakfast, internet and parking.  I am sorry that breakfast is not open prior to 6:30 am  when you needed to leave the hotel and also understand that other guests sleep in past the closing time of breakfast and also miss out.  The time set meets 99% of our guest's needs but I am instructing the desk that if we have individuals between 6 am - 6:30 am who want to grab a bagel and juice to help them get into the Cafe which is locked until 6:30am. Again thank you!  Christine Smith

Summary: We really enjoyed our stay at the Ayres Inn for our 6 nights. We had connecting rooms on the third floor which was really handy while travelling with 4 "kids" aged 13 - 20. The rooms were a a great value through Priceline ($80) and included a decent buffet for breakfast each morning (scrambled eggs, bacon or sausages (alternating days), fresh cut up fruit, hash browns, bagels, cereal, coffee, orange juice and tea) We had a view of the fireworks over top of the Best Buy sign. Connecting rooms are only available on the third floor.   The staff were friendly and even accommodated my grocery delivery on arrival day as well as my numerous packages that I had shipped to Ayres for my impending arrival :) We are from Canada so shipping to home is very expensive. I bought a few things
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review!  We are very happy to read your family really enjoyed your stay at our hotel.  We appreciate you highlighting the great service we provided you, the cleanliness of our rooms and our close proximity to many shops and restaurants.  We look forward to seeing you again soon!

Summary: We stayed here for 5 nights recently as part of a family Disney trip. Booked this Ayres location based on the good reviews on Tripadvisor, and the good price.  Pros - Convenient for local transit to Disney ($5 per day per adult, $2 for kids under 10 years old), breakfast, parking, internet included. Also, walking distance to the Block At Orange Mall, which is good. The staff were always helpful and friendly, and the rooms were very clean. Starbucks right next door and a Vons 2 minutes away by car. Cons - Rooms are tight, especially if you use the pull out couch. The pool and deck is almost always in the shade. The rooms are clean but not very nicely finished (in my opinion). Internet service was sporadic most of the time. The breakfast was as basic as a buffet could be. Most of
Manager Response: Thank you Guest for taking time to do a review of the hotel.  I appreciate your comments and would like to let you know that we only use styrofoam plates when our in-house guest numbers top 325 - 350 guests which happens occasionally during the busy summer Disneyland season.  The breafast buffet is temporarily set up in a meeting room as we will beginning renovation on the adjacent Cafe and then the meeting space.  Again, thank you for your review.  Christine Smith General Manager

Summary: We just spent five nights at the Ayres Inn Orange for the first time during our Disneyland vacation last week (August 2013).  We stayed on the top floor, facing Disneyland.  We could see the fireworks on the horizon and make out the Tower of Terror, as well.  We had one issue with the room and the moment we reported it to Christine, she listened intently and immediately took care of the problem.  The staff was excellent in its response.  They thanked us for bringing the issue to their attention.  We heard sirens a couple of times (the medical center across the street) but were never woken up by them at night.  We were not located near the construction to the north of the property and never heard noises, even during our mid-day naps in the room.  Our room overlooked a Best Buy
Manager Response: Dear Chocophile73,  Thank you very much for taking the time to leave a thorough and kind review of your experience at our hotel. We are so ecstatic to see that you and your family enjoyed your Disneyland vacation and thought that the ART shuttle was especially convenient. Thank you very much for your compliments about the service, they are truly appreciated. We cannot wait to see you in the near future for your Anniversary trip in November. Thank you again!  Sincerely, Christine Smith General Manager

Summary: We stayed here while a family member had surgery at UCI Medical Center.  It was so convenient to hospital.  We were able to walk back and forth to hospital multiple times a day.  The hotel was almost closer than the parking lot for the hospital.  We saved on parking and with a free FULL breakfast it was a great place!  Could hear the Disney fireworks but could not see them from our room.  The restaurant Anepulco is wonderful.  One of the best hotel restaurants we have ever experienced, (we are restaurant owners as well).  Great value.
Manager Response: Dear Mammasue1,  Thank you very much for taking the time to leave a review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your experience at our hotel. We are so glad we were able to accommodate you during your family member's surgery across the street at UCI. Your compliments about the great value of our complimentary full American breakfast buffet and parking are greatly appreciated. We are also so glad to see that as restaurant owners, you enjoyed our on-site restaurant Anepalco's. Thank you again for the compliments. We hope to see you again in the near future, under better circumstances of course.  Sincerely, Christine Smith General Manager

Summary: Reasonable prices and clean with  friendly staff. The morning breakfast was a nice touch. Front desk friendly and helpful with directions to nearby places. I would stay at this motel anytime I will be in the area.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Will definitely be booking here again!!
Summary: I have heard from friends that most hotels close to disneyland are run down for the most part. But this hotel was super clean and up to date. I along with my family were overly impressed with the kind and helpful staff. The staff were very knowledgeable with the area and would recommend various restaurants along with shopping at the outlets (about 1 mile away).   The room furniture and flat screen tv were also really nice. Our beds were made daily and towels were replaced as well. The complimentary breakfast was awesome and saved us $$$. The breakfast consisted of scrambled eggs, pancakes, sausage, bacon, or choice of cereal. The beds were really comfortable and we could see Disney's fireworks from our window. The location was awesome and close to everything.  Clean swimming
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is an older but very well maintained property. Interiors seem to be recently remodeled. Rooms are large and quiet, with very comfy beds.  Hotel wifi is better than most hotels I have stayed at.  We stayed in a room with 2 queen beds, facing away from the interstate. At night we could see fireworks (presumably disney)  Room was very quiet despite being off the highway, near a hospital and large shopping center.  Breakfast here is above average, lots of hot items and fruit compliment the usual cereal stuff etc. Breakfast area doubles as a restaurant during the afternoon and evening (we did not eat there but menu was good and seemed to be priced reasonably). This dining area was quite busy and seating sometimes was hard to come by, but the staff always made sure items were
Manager Response: Dear Sarge_The_Duck,  Thank you very much for taking the time to leave a review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your experience at our hotel. It is truly a delight to see that you enjoyed your accommodations and found them large, quiet, and comfortable. As for the parking, we sincerely apologize for the lack-there-of but rest assured we have finished building a parking structure that will be able to hold 212 cars! So if you plan on visiting again soon, please do not let the parking situation deter you. We hope to see you soon and thank you again for the compliments.  Sincerely, Christine Smith General Manager

Summary: I stayed at Ayres Inn a second time for one month. Once again it was a very pleasant experience. The staff are true professionals. Always greeting guests with a smile. At certain times its as though they can read minds & they offer assistance. Rooms are elegantly furnished , & bed is very comfortable. I will definitely stay there again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Pretty nice. Good value after discounts.
Summary: We stayed several days. The room was just fine and clean. Breakfast, while better than most, got tiresome. Service was great. Location was convenient to Chapman University. Our 18 year-old daughter stayed with is for an extra $10.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Booked the Ayres for a week in August- dropping my daughter off at Chapman University. When I called the hotel directly they asked about reason for visit and when Chapman was mentioned-we were offered the Chapman rate. We were blown away by the overall experience-especiallly the front desk staff. Always there to help- even when rental care broke down a few miles from the hotel and i called to ask for a taxi service referral-they came to pick us up in the hotel van. Have stayed at many places where a 'breakfast' is included-often a disappointing continental affair.There is NOTHING continental about the Ayers breakfast-its the full meal deal-eggs/sausage/pancakes/fruit/bagel etc Location is also great-didn't realize how close to Angel stadium and Disneyland. Best discovery was the
Manager Response: Dear Antony E,  Thank you very much for taking the time to leave a review to let others know about your experience with us. We truly appreciate the compliments on our complimentary full American breakfast buffet, so glad you enjoyed! We are so delighted to see that you took advantage of the convenience of the ART shuttle! We truly strive to create a pleasant visit for all of our guests and are thrilled to know we succeeded in that goal with your visit. Hopefully we will see you again soon and GO PANTHERS!   Sincerely, Christine Smith General Manager

Summary Heading: Safe and easy acess to  Chapman
Summary: The staff at  Ayers Inn orange made a trip that could have been full of hitches, easy and enjoyable, what was especially helpful were the free shuttle trips to Chapman university, it was my first time in Orange and I did not know my way around.What was great about their location in Orange was that they were walking distance from the Outlets at Orange, for parents who need to shop for their freshmen kids, like I did.The staff were always willing to meet numerous requests, they were courteous and kind.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The free breakfast buffet was just the thing to get my hungry brood off to Disneyland.  I drank endless cups of free tea while working on free wifi next to the pool while my kids played.    The staff went above and beyond to help us and we even had a distant view of the fireworks from our room.  There is cool lemon water in the lobby and a peaceful garden.  The ART shuttle comes right to the front door and there was plenty of free parking.  I would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is my 3 rd stay at an Ayres hotel. This boutique hotel continues to deliver good quality & fabulous customer service.   Would like to see updated Dream Sleepers & waffle makers in all locations, though.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My niece and I stayed at the Ayres Inn for four nights.....when we first checked in....the staff was polite and informative.  Our room had a king-size bed and a couch that was a sleeper.  It was perfect for us!  The room was clean...the television was a flat screen with a terrific picture....and the bed was COMFORTABLE.  We were on the sixth floor...at the end.  Our view was of the pool (east view) and I caught the sunrise every morning from our window...it was gorgeous!  The room had a coffeemaker and refrigerator.  The bathroom was spacious.   The staff was superb! Every time we came in the front door...we were greeted by whomever was behind the desk....and they asked us how our day was.  I really felt like they cared about me!  Whenever I had a questions...the front desk was
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: My stay at the Ayres  Hotel in Orange, CA
Summary: I have stayed at this nice comfortable hotel many times and always a treat!  People that work there are nice and friendly, rooms are clean and comfortable, Close and convenient to many amenities, priced reasonable, Breakfast is nice and I have NO Complaints  ( I travel a LOT with Business and this is one of the Nicer ones that I always frequent when I am in the area )
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good Spot to Land When Dropping off College Student
Summary: I stayed at the Ayres Orange two inights this past week- at the beginning and end of college drop off week. I was greeted both times late at night with friendly smiles. Rooms were consistently clean and pleasant to stay in.  Breakfast was ok- the rooms were very crowded and the line was very long. Could have been better organized and a more pleasant way to start the day.  Other than that, all was good.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Always my first choice. Comfortable stay & highly recommended
Summary: Hotel feels clean and employees are nice when you speak with them. They don't wow you but are friendly. Free full breakfast is a plus especially with a family. Pool & hot tub are adequate but a bit small. Rooms felt clean and no previous dirt found. Accessing hotel is fine but street island make it tough when coming from opposite direction but "illegal" u-turn works until I found an alternate route.  Will always check with this hotel first before others.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I was very happy staying at Ayres Inn Orange.  I'm somewhat of a clean freak when it comes to hotels and this hotel goes above and beyond expectations.  The hotel had great character and reminded me of hotels from Europe. The breakfast was pretty good.  The pool was small with unattractive surroundings (highway and construction next to it), but it looks like Ayres is building a new hotel next door.  If you are looking for great service, cleanliness, and personal touch-I would highly recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Very good value for your money
Summary: The lobby, room, and breakfast area were clean and inviting and the staff was attentive. The pool was too cold, but enjoyed the hot tub. I just wished there was better access without having to go around or take the freeway. Overall it was a good experience. My family enjoyed it.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stay here when I visit my daughter at Chapman University. The hotel is reasonably priced and the rooms are comfortable.  We arrived on Friday night, too tired to go looking for a nice place to eat so we decided to try the hotel restaurant.  What a pleasant surprise.  The staff was friendly and the food was great.  I had the enchiladas and my daughter had the wild shrimp.  The presentation was impressive.  The mexican wine was tasty.  As always, the pillows are very comfortable.  I would love one for home.   My only suggestion would be to have a small shop to purchase aspirin, toothpaste, etc.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed for 5 nights and was very pleased with the accommodations. Staff was very friendly and helpful, the room was great (comfortable bed and clean space) and the location was fantastic. Really close to Angels Stadium and the Outlet Mall across the street. The breakfast buffet was great every morning and they have a Latin fusion restaurant on site. I would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: It is in the center of everything! You got everything on arms reach. Disney. Outlet. Great neighborhood.   One negative is that some employees are not so friendly. It is my first time here in LA and i had a couple of questions and front desk didn't really want to help out.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Excellent Stay for a Disneyland/Las Angeles trip
Summary: Once again I thank Trip Advisor and its members for turning me on to a great hotel.  I had never heard of the Ayres hotels until I was researching a place to stay for a family vacation to Disneyland and the Las Angeles area.  Overall it was a great stay and if we come back to this area, I would happily stay at the hotel. - The property was very clean and attractive. The lobby was small but well decorated. - The staff was very friendly and helpful (a special thanks to James at the front desk for easing my checkout process). - The rooms very very clean and comfortable.  There was plenty of room for two adults and my older teens. - The hotel was amazingly quiet - We heard no pool noise (our room was above the outdoor pool/hot tub area), no hallway noise, and almost no road traffic
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was a nice hotel but I was expecting a little more based on all the raving reviews.  I can't really complain much about anything, but I would only give this hotel a  4/5, not a 5/5 for the following reasons: 1) Yes, the full breakfast is great to have, with bacon, eggs, hashbrowns, pancakes, toast, cereal, fruit.....great!......but the room set up is very poor.  At other hotels, the breakfast offerings were spread around the room which in turn spread the guest around the room, making it not feel crowded.  At the Ayres Inn, all the food is together on two tables pushed together and you wait in a (potentially long) line to get your food.  And oh oh if you forget to get something because now you're at the back of the line.  With that said, there was plenty of seating both
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: I always enjoy my stay at Ayres Inn Orange
Summary: I stay at Ayres Inn whenever I can when visiting my son who is a student at Chapman University, an easy ten minutes away.  The staff is friendly and helpful, the rooms clean and pleasant, the beds very comfortable, the breakfasts tasty, and dinner at the adjoining restaurant is delicious.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: One of the most friendly and responsive staff I have ever encountered
Summary: This is a really great hotel.  Moderately priced for the location which was great.  Buses can take you to Disney, Universal and other places.  We walked to an Angels game and the stadium is only 1.3 miles from the door.  The best part of staying at the hotel was the staff.  From the time I started calling and making my reservation and the time I left the staff was friendly and very accommodating. With the pool, hot tub, clean rooms, and free hot breakfast you just can't beat the place.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for a family trip to Disneyland and it was great.  There was 7 of us total so we had 2 rooms and they were great about getting us next to each other and getting us the type of beds we wanted.  Rooms are nice, beds are very soft and comfy especially after a long day at Disney.  The buffet was standard breakfast food but kept hot and they kept it clean and fresh, it was good each morning.   We did have an issue with our AC not cooling as much as it should they offered to move us but we would be on opposite floors and I didn't want to do that, so they sent someone to fix it and they were able to get it working while we were there.  The only think I did not like was that there is only 2 ice machines and one broke while we where there and a big group came in and kept
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband and I just sayed here this weekend for one night. The pros- our rate, checking in early, and a clean spacious room. Impressed by the furniture and decor. Was the first time having a ceiling fan in a hotel room. I didn't understand why it was near the window in the corner of the room though. The bathroom was clean and had plenty of towels. Not the normal 2 of each for 2 people. We went down to the pool which was good enough for a hotel pool. The next morning before we checked out we went down for the "free" breakfast. This part is going to be the cons- For a large hotel that serves breakfast everyday we were very surprised of the setup. They have banquet tables set up for the food (looked a little tacky). The selection- undercooked wet eggs, cold potatoes, sausage
Manager Response: Dear Guest - Thank you very much for taking your time to write a reveiw of your stay.  I do agree with most of your observations regarding breakfast.  It is indeed a strange setup.  The hotel has been running full house and in order to accomodate the large number (as high as 350 some mornings) of our guests for the complimentary breakfast we have to open our meeting room adjacent to the Cafe to be able to sit all guests.  The hotel will be starting a full renovation of the Cafe (Sept), and expand into what is now the meeting room.  This will give us larger more cohesive dining room in which to serve breakfast.  Toaster not working, we have also had to move the toaster  and bread selection into Cafe, away from the buffet line because guests continue to put cheese or crossaints into the toaster causing the items to burn and subsequentially set off the fire alarms in the meeting room.  The toaster the morning of your visit had just been moved outside as a small child had again tried to put cheese in the unit and started a small fire in the toaster.  It was being cleaned prior to putting back into service.  That was when we decided to move the toaster back into the Cafe permanently as there are only heat dectors and no smoke alrams.  The renovation of the dining area will provide more space for guests, give us a beautifully designed space and allow us to improve our buffet line and continue to provide a free breakast. Tip Jar - Our Guests receive a full complimentary breakfast, my staff works very hard to cook and serve the numbers of guest we have each morning for breakfast.  A tip to a worker is always at the discretion of the guest, whether at a hotel, Starbucks or a beauty parlor.  I am very sorry that you felt the tip jar was in poor taste or made you feel as if a tip was expected.  Christine Smith General Manager

Summary: Took the family to Disneyland and it's nice to stay in a hotel that gives good quality and service for a reasonable price in that area.  Good (free) breakfast.  Nice, clean rooms.  Great staff, and nice shuttle to Disneyland.  We'll be staying there again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were really pleased with our stay here.  We were able to check in early and checking in/out was a complete breeze.  There was plenty of free parking and an additional parking garage for overflow in the back.  The pool area was nice and the rooms were excellent.  Very spacious, flat screen television, nice couch, refrigerator and plenty of storage.  The bathroom was a decent size and, most importantly, everything was very clean.  We needed to speak with the front desk on a couple of occasions for typical tourist things (i.e. we forgot toothpaste, needed directions to Angels Stadium, etc) and they were always highly accommodating.  They definitely made us feel welcome.  All in all, this is a great value hotel.  It's convenient, clean, and very comfortable.  Can't go wrong here.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A Week at Ayres Inn Orange / Disneyland
Summary: Christine Smith, the general manager at the Ayres Inn Orange, certainly sets a fine example: every employee we interacted with was extremely helpful, and happy to assist. Last summer, we  flew in twice for two 10 day stays [for two surgeries at UCI, conveniently located across the street from the Ayres, at the Medical center.    This year, I needed to return for more Doctors appointments, and we chose to stay once again at the Ayres, a great place to stay because everything is within walking distance or a very short 10 minute drive (to movie theaters, department stores, outlets, restaurants, disneyland, and of course the Medical Center). It is dated, the carpet is very worn out, and the layout is congested and inconvenient. The restaurant's inelegance doesn't match the rest of the hotel. Summary Heading: Nice accommodations, but paper thin walls
Summary: We stayed here for two nights & although the rooms were nice & the beds were comfortable, we got hardly any sleep because the walls were so paper thin we could hear our neighbor snoring & it even vibrated through the walls. It was miserable. great location, close to shops & Disneyland & the breakfast was nice, though. would contemplate staying at an Ayres again, but I'm not sure about this location. it looks as though they renovated an older hotel, maybe that's why the walls were thin? Love the decor though!
Manager Response: none

Summary: The price was great. We were really surprised about how good the hot breakfast was. So nice! The cleanliness was great. You could tell the hotel is wearing a bit, but it was still fone.  We did have a really noisy family next door. They had a late night and very early risers. You could hear every word they were saying about Disneyland. Kind of hard to sleep past 6AM when we ourselves got in late from traveling. Not sure if it was because we we're put in a joining room or not, but I would hope the insulation is better in a regular room?
Manager Response: none

Summary: I was a guest of Chapman University, a few minutes away by the free hotel shuttle, which was much appreciated. The 4th floor room had everything I needed: free wifi (fine for emails, too slow for streaming, a desk to work at, leather sofa and coffee table for relaxing, fkat screen TV, fridge, super-comfortable bed , good bathroom.   The air conditioning was a little noisy and woke me up once or twice.   Front desk staff very efficient and friendly too.  Breakfasts (included) were fine. Good scrambled egg and bacon.   The room you eat them in was not pretty: sticky dark brown wood tables, big plastic bowls into which the well-trained guests would stack their used crockery and cutlery - it all felt a bit like an old fashioned school canteen, an impression reinforced but eh
Manager Response: none

Summary: Nice service and old world touch but no on-demand movies, terrible concierge parking experience, old and uncomfortable beds/bedding, furniture and thin walls.  Disappointing one-night stay and would definitely not stay again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed there for a meeting at the Anaheim Convention Center. It was a little out of the way, but only 5 minutes by car. The hot breakfast was much more than the usual cold cereal at most locations. The free parking and free Internet were a definite plus. We are planning another visit to take our Grand kids to Disney land.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed 3 nights from April,17th till 20th. I did 2 requests when I booked the hotel that it was my at the highest level of the hotel and facing disneyland fireworks, but they put me on the ground level, facing the entrance of the pool....lol  I arrived at the hotel at 2pm but they said the hotel as full the night before and my room would just be really ready at 4pm. I went to take a walk at Orange Outlet Mall that is just in front of the hotel and when I came back my room was ready.  I had a car and I never had any problem on parking it. The never heard any noise from the street too.  The room is a little bit dark and they never replaced the amenities, so everytime I needed to go to the lobby and ask for shampoo and soap.  The breakfast is till 9am during week days and till
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your review.  We truly appreciate our guest feedback. I'd first like to apologize for not having your room preference available.  Although we do try to fill all our guests’ requests, at times we are unable to due to our high peak seasons.   I am glad you were able to experience how close we are to so many attractions, shopping malls, restaurants and convenience stores.   We thank you for your stay at our hotel and look forward to serving you in the future.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay if going to Angels game.
Summary: Stayed 3 nights. Visited Disney one day and an Angels game the next. Location is perfect for a ball game (5 min walk to the park - good area!) Hot breakfast in the morning was nice nothing special but good and the staff very helpful!
Manager Response: Thank you very much from leaving us a quick review!  We are very happy you found our hotel to be a great place to stay!  As you stated, we are very close to the Angel Stadium and Disneyland as well as many other attractions. We are also very happy to read our staff was very helpful! You mentioned our hot breakfast in your review.  We would like to let our reviewers know it is a Full-American breakfast buffet.  It includes scrambled eggs, country-style potatoes, pancakes, bacon or sausage, breads, bagels and cereal and a few more items.   We thank you for your recent stay.  We look forward to seeing you for more Angels games.

Summary: We had a wonderful experience at this hotel. It has a very warm atmosphere. The rooms are very comfortable. There were 14 of us including 6 young children. Breakfast was very good including fresh fruit everyday and the most delicious coffee cake. Good coffee,too. The shuttle service was easy and accommodating. Kids with cars used shuttle for Disneyland as easier. This would be our first choice if return to Disney.
Manager Response: We are very happy to read you had a wonderful experience at our hotel!  Thank you for sharing the comfort our rooms, the great breakfast we offer and the convenience of using the Anaheim Resort Transit.  Thank you for choosing the Ayres Inn Orange as your #1 choice when visiting the Disneyland Resort.  We look forward to your next stay!

Summary: All was really nice with a couple of exceptions.  The lack of full room service was an issue for us as we travel with our small old dog and dont ever leave him alone in the room.  I asked prior to booking if there was room service and was told yes but it's limitations were not explained.  A second issue was the overnight desk clerk told me we could not sit on the outside patio with our dog for our complementary breakfast. I had been told at the restraunt the night before we COULD eat outside with the dog. He also stated we could not take our breakfast to our room so we could eat together. I questioned why and was told they didn't want food in the rooms to draw rats!  I questioned this as there was limited room services (food in the room!). he had no real answer. When I spoke to
Manager Response: Dear Guest Thank you very much for taking the time to write a review of our Hotel, the Ayres Inn Orange.  I was very embarrassed when I read you had been given incorrect information regarding allowing your pet in our patio area.  We pride ourselves on being a Pet Friendly hotel and know how important pets are to their owners.  Yes, we do allow pets in the outside patio!!  We will be using this incident as a teaching moment for our next front desk meeting and I will discuss with my staff the correct information that should have been provided to you.  It is correct that we do not allow breakfast food to be taken up to our rooms, but not due to wanting to prevent "rats."  My face is now double "red" with embarrassment.  The reason we do not allow food upstairs is strictly a housekeeping issue.  Due to the high number of families with kids we found too many rooms with syrup in the carpets, eggs accidentlydropped, spilt  beverage trails in the hallways and overflowing piles of dishes.  Breakfast is served and meant to be consumed in our dining room, outside patio or overflow room. Again, thank you for bringing this to my attention and please accept my apology for our miscommunication.  Christine Smith General Manager

Summary: When I booked our Disneyland vacation, I was expecting a not so great hotel.  I was pleasantly surprised.  We were able to check in early and the Front Desk staff were overly accommodating.  Other than the construction noise and dust, the pool, garden area and hot tub were well used by my family.  The breakfast was good, hot and fresh.  I was expecting a microwave in the room based on another Ayres property.  Would have been a nice thing to have since some families are on a budget.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review for our hotel.  We are glad your family enjoyed our Full-American breakfast buffet, pool and spa. We are very happy to read our staff exceeded your expectations! As you stated in the room tip, we do have a microwave available in our 2nd floor vending room.  It is accessible at all times to our guests.  We also have a few additional microwaves that are available for our guests.  We ask that our guests inquire about one prior to their stay to check for availability. We thank you for choosing the Ayres Inn Orange during your visit to Disneyland!

Summary Heading: Amazing Location, Cost, Comfort and more!
Summary: We recently went to Disney for a quick weekend getaway and wanted to stay somewhere reasonably close for a good price.  Using the fantastical name-your-own-price tool from that hilarious Canadian who used to fly the USS Enterprise, we achieved a great two night stay for $75 a night.  A+ for cost.  After leaving the Parks, we quickly jumped onto the 5 South for a quick half mile drive and once we exited, the Hotel is directly on the Right off Chapman.  A+ for accessibility.  We arrived around midnight and the only downfall was that their parking garage is under construction however a quick chat with the front desk agent resulted in them allowing us to park directly in front under the overhang.  A+ for customer service.  After checking in we were pleasantly surprised how spacious
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Excellent service, wish all hotels were this friendly.
Summary: We stayed three nights at this hotel for a trip to Disneyland. Check in was good, the only little snafu was we were given keys to the wrong room by accident. But, it was a busy time and the clerk had a lot going on. We got it fixed and checked it. Rooms were a little small, and it became apparent after about an hour that we would rather have a separate room (adjoining) for our kids to keep everybody's sanity. So we reserved a second room and got two adjoining rooms. Breakfast each day is excellent! Buffet includes eggs, bacon or sausage, pancakes, hash browns, cereal, melon, and other pastries. Very filling and a good start to our days at Disneyland. We caught the ART shuttle each day at the hotel entrance and rode that to the Disneyland and back.  Takes about 10-15 minutes even
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: very clean and reasonably priced, close to D land
Summary: I chose this hotel based on the great reviews for cleanliness and service.  They were great with that. The air conditioning worked wonderfully!   However, their low flow toilets took a good 3 flushings just to get TP down and the bathroom fans were not very good.  We were glad we had a blow up bed because the pull out bed in the couch was very uncomfortable.  I had also picked this place for the free breakfast, but it turns out that it was only served until 9 and there wasn't much food and you had to eat it in the room provided...couldn't take it up to your room, which for us, meant that we only at breakfast there one day because not all of my family was up and ready early enough.  One major compliant is parking.  Their parking garage was under construction...they offered free
Manager Response: none

Summary: We chooe this hotel based on the reviews on this site.  The reviews on the service are spot on;  It is top notch.  That is where the positives end.  The pictures of the lobby are very deceiveing.  The rooms and the rest of the facilities are outdated and small.  The breakfast was not good and the room you dish up and eat in is small and dirty with horrible furniture.  You can eat in the restaurant when it's open for overflow, but the buffet is so overwhelmed with people it's difficult to get in and out.   The coffee is very bad, I went to the Starbuck next door after the first day.  There was a group of teenagers with the car stereo's booming in the Best Buy on Staurday night and you could hear them unitl 4:00 am.  The parking is miserable with the slots on the east side
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was our first stay at the Ayres Inn and we could not have been more delighted.  The hotel is just a few miles from Disneyland which puts you far enough away from the crowds, but just a few minutes away by their shuttle.  We usually stay at the Doubletree across the street but for the price difference and the free breakfast and parking we got a GREAT bargain.  Our room was very large with a king, a sparkling clean bathroom with modern fixtures and a granite counter.  The bed was comfy and warm.  In the morning the hot breakfast was delicious and plentiful.  There were eggs, pancakes, bacon or sausage, fruit, yogurt, cereal, bagels, toast, muffins, coffee, tea,  juice and water.  There were also delicious cookies at the front desk!  Although parking was limited, they always
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have to say...the first 2  nights were a little rough with the flow of traffic through the hallways (a high school band was staying and they had a 10:00 curfew). After that......everything was awesome! Breakfast was wonderful. EVERYONE at the desk was so friendly and very helpful. I have young children and had some unexpected laundry issues. I had packed laundry soap and quarters, but did not plan on issues that would stain clothes. They had saved stain remover and laundry soap from past customers that left them behind and let me use them. Thank goodness! Saved me because I had just paid a rediculous $30.00 for Buzz Lightyear jammies at Disneyland that would have been ruined by the time we got home to wash them. The staff was very informative and truelly a great crew. Thank
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Liked hotel but parking problem persists
Summary: This was a first time stay at this hotel for my husband and I.  The room was very clean and housekeeping did an exceptional job each day.  The free breakfast was very convenient and made for a quick start in the morning.  The staff made sure to replenish the buffet and clear tables promptly.  The wifi worked adequately for us although we had a problem connecting a few times.  The only problem we encountered was with the lack of parking as mentioned in previous reviews.  The first night (3/14/13) we came back to the hotel at around 11:00 pm. There were no empty stalls left and a few other guests were also looking for parking.  There wasn't a valet on duty to assist us.  The person working the front desk told my husband we would have to find our own spot.  My husband asked if that
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing the Ayres Inn Orange for your vacation!  We are thrilled to read our staff's service exceeded your family expectations!    We apologize for the first two nights were a little rough getting through hallways.  I am happy to read that you noticed that our group was given a 10pm curfew.  We do that with all of our groups to ensure all of our guests' experience a great night's rest.   Thank you for sharing with our reviewers that our breakfast is great and that we have laundry facilities.  I'd also like to add that we sell laundry soap boxes and drying sheets at the Front Desk for the convenience of our guests. We look forward to seeing you again; hopefully a lot sooner than in 10 years!

Summary Heading: Everything good except the WiFi connection
Summary: We've stayed here several times now, and like everything about this property. Nice people, clean rooms, good location, nice decor with beautiful artwork. My only complaint is that the WiFi is very weak in the guest rooms (most recently on 5th floor March 11), so weak that in order to check my email on my iPad, I have to go down to the lobby. We will continue to stay here -- we're returning this weekend -- because it is the perfect place to be when we're in town to go to Chapman University baseball games.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind review.  We truly enjoy being of service to our guests.  As our goal is to exceed the expectations of all of our guests!  It was a pleasure having you stay with us.  Thank you for sharing about your experience every time you stay with us.  We apologize for the poor internet connection during your previous stay with us.  I will ensure to look into this matter immediately with our IT support.  We thank you for your loyalty to our hotel and look forward to seeing you soon!

Summary Heading: So so hotel with an amazing staff
Summary: The staff gets a 5, the hotel gets a 3, so average to a four star rating.  Here's the good and the bad...  Great  The staff here are outstanding, it feels like a four or five star hotel from that perspective. The cookies on check-in were also a great treat after a long drive and long days at Disney.  So so  The rooms are clean, but are pretty dated and show a lot of signs of age and wear.  Wallpaper peeling away, stains on the carpet, chips in the paint, etc.  It's hard to complain about a free breakfast, but it's only so so here.  It was identical all five mornings, except the meat switched between sausage and bacon every other day.  Other options were scrambled eggs, potatoes, some kind of rubbery pancakes, a melony fruit bowl, three types of cereal (raisin bran, cheerios, and
Manager Response: We thank you for taking the time to write a review.  We are delighted to read our staff exceeded your expectations.  We are also happy to read you enjoyed our freshly baked cookies.  We apologize for the construction noise and if it caused any inconvenience during your stay with us.   We will also look into how we may improve our breakfast.  Your feedback is greatly appreciated. We take every guest incident, issue or inquiry very seriously. We are happy you enjoyed your stay overall.  Please feel free to contact me directly at szuno@ayreshotels.com or 714-978-9168 x702, so that I may assist you with any further concerns.

Summary: My family stayed during a trip to Disneyland.  Hotel was nice and clean.  Staff was very friendly and helpful.  I forgot I bring band aids to prevent blisters and they gladly gave me some each day we were there.  Breakfast was more than adequate. Eggs, bacon or sausage, pancakes, bagels, cereal and fruit more than we needed.  Shuttle to the park was convenient and on time.  Rooms were large and clean.  Bed was very comfy with plenty of pillows.  There were a few sirens with the hospital across the street but no more than in any large city I've stayed in.  Would definitely stay again.  Great value.  They also held our luggage on check out day since we were going to visit the park and let us leave our car in the parking lot.  Pleasant stay great vacation!
Manager Response: We thank you for taking the time to write a review. We are thrilled to hear you loved your stay at our hotel! Thank you for sharing how spacious and clean our rooms are.  We are very happy you enjoyed our complimentary Full American breakfast buffet.  We are also very happy to read that our staff was very friendly. Thank you for sharing with our reviewers that we are always willing to hold luggage in the case the rooms aren't ready upon arrival, or in the case of a later flight.  We look forward to serving you once again on your future vacation.

Summary Heading: Will stay here again for Disneyland trip...
Summary: We loved the breakfast buffet. Used ART shuttle to get to and from Disneyland and it was really convenient. We didn't know what to expect but didn't want to pay a lot for a place to sleep at night after our days at Disneyland. The price was great, the rooms were clean, the beds were comfy, the bathroom was really small but at least it wasn't scary like the Knottsberry Farm Hotel. We were happy and would stay there again.
Manager Response: We love reading our guests had a wonderful experience at our hotel!  We are happy to read you enjoyed your stay at our hotel.  Thank you for sharing with our reviewers how great our breakfast is, how clean and comfortable our rooms are and how easy it is to get to and from Disneyland.  Thank you for recommending us to others.  We look forward to your next stay at our hotel!

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel and a great breakfast
Summary: The hotel and room were very nice.  The Breakfast every morning was great.  We used the shuttle to travel from the hotel to Disneyland.  It was very easy to use and the drop off was not far from the entrance into Disneyland.  We enjoyed our stay very much and will probably come back again.  Great service and a very nice hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments!  We are so happy to hear your family found the great value our hotel has because of the complimentary breakfast, proximity to the park, convenience of the Anaheim Resort Transit shuttle to the park, the cleanliness and comfort of our rooms.  We thank you for staying with us!  We hope to see you again in the future.

Summary: This hotel offered a nice comfortable place to rest our heads after an exhausting day at the Disneyland parks.  The rooms were clean and beds were super comfortable.  The staff attended to our needs. The only one thing I need was something to soak my feet in after walking all day.  Just kidding.  It was very nice and a great part of our trip.  Thank you!
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent stay with us!  We are thrilled to hear our hotel met all your needs.  Thank you for mentioning about how clean and comfortable our rooms are.  We look forward to making your every stay with us, a perfect one!  Please contact me directly for any future bookings, so that I may assist you with your specific requests.

Summary: We stayed here on a whim for only one night, getting a great rate on priceline. The reason I picked this hotel was for the free breakfast and parking.  Check in was great, although I was a bit surprised about the $125 hold in case we smoked or had a pet in the room.  I understand that they need to do that, but wow!    Heading up to the room, it was gorgeous!  We had a king size bed and a leather couch.  All the furniture was nice and updated and there was lots of storage space along with a mini fridge and coffee maker.  The room was spotless.  The bathroom had granite counters and was very nice.  It took a long time to get hot water and it took 3 times on average to flush the toilet (it was low flow).  We were only there one night, so none of that was a big deal.  I saw a lot of
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review.  We are happy to hear that our hotel exceeded your expectations.  We do apologize if the $125.00 dollars authorization for incidentals was a surprise for you at check in.  We do enforce this amount and have communicated this to all third party companies, so they advise our guests at the time of booking.  We thank you for your kind comments about our accommodations, decor of our rooms and hotel and our breakfast!   We hope to see you again soon!

Summary Heading: Very nice stay.  Would return again.
Summary: Very clean, quiet, nicely furnished hotel with comfy beds and high end sheets and pillows.  Very good breakfast with real dishes.  Polite and helpful staff.  The location is convenient to Chapman college where we were visiting, and it is probably convenient to Disneyland as well, and certainly a better value than hotels that are located right next to Disneyland, but if I were going to Disneyland, I would choose to stay across the street so I could walk. In that case though, you would have to pay more to stay at an equally nice hotel.  The computer/printer was in the lobby, not in an office if that is important to you.
Manager Response: We love hearing from our guests!  Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts with our other reviewers!  We are really happy to hear that our staff was very polite and helpful.  Thank you for mentioning how clean, quiet our rooms are and how great our breakfast is!  We also would like to let our reviewers there are many things to do while staying with us.  Not only are we close to Disney and Chapman University, but we are close we are to the Outlets at Orange, just two blocks away.  We thank you for your recent stay with us.  We look forward to your next visit!

Summary: Very pleased the staff was always pleasant and ready with a smile. They went out of the way to help me find different things to do while staying there. Plenty of places to eat within walking distance.
Manager Response: We are thrilled to know we have exceeded your expectations!  Thank you for taking the time to let reviewers know about your recent stay at our hotel.  We are happy to read our staff was always had a smile and was very pleasant.  We look forward to having the opportunity to serve you on your next visit to the Orange/Anaheim area.

Summary: We had stayed in the Ayre's in Moreno Valley n everything was exceptional there. But here in Orange, the building was old, there was no parking because of the construction. They had 30 AT&T trucks parked in their lot. (Not exaggerating) The pillows were so worn out n flimsy. The blankets were not comfortable at all. You can hear the toilet flushing from the room upstairs. The breakfast was okay but not great. No omelette to order or waffles like in Moreno Valley. The service was good but will not stay there again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review.  We are very sorry that our hotel failed to exceed your expectations.  Thank you for your recent stay at the Moreno Valley Ayres and our hotel.  Please know that even though our Moreno Valley hotel is newer, we continue to update and remodel the interior of our rooms.  We have welcomed many families throughout the years and our hotel has maintained its #1 placement on TripAdvisor because of our service, cleanliness and value.  We apologize for any inconveniences that our parking situation might have caused.  We are currently building a parking structure and it should be finished in a few months.  In the meantime, we have hired a valet service to assist park our guests’ vehicles at no cost to them.  In regards to the breakfast, we have chosen not to serve the waffles, but we do serve pancakes instead.  The waffle maker was a safety concern for our Disney families with small children. Thank you again for your time and please feel free to contact me directly, should you have any further concerns.  My contact information is 714-978-9168 x702 szuno@ayreshotels.com.

Summary: Great hotel for the money.  Very comfortable and clean.  Loved having hot breakfast every morning.  Parking was an issue but not terribly inconvenient.  A 5 minute drive down the 5 and we were at Disneyland.  The only thing that would have assisted in traveling with children would be to have a table in the rooms, as opposed to a desk.  snack time and lunch time in the room was a bit frustrating.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  We appreciate you taking the time to let our reviewers see why our hotel has such a great value.  We are very happy to read you were pleased with your stay.  We are happy to read you found our hotel to be clean, comfortable and our complimentary Full American breakfast buffet to be great.  We thank you for your suggestion about placing a table in the room instead of a desk.  We also thank you for your understanding with our parking.  Our parking structure should be finished in May.  We have hired a valet parking service at no charge to our guests, to assist us until the structure is completed.  We look forward to having the opportunity to serve you once again in the future.

Summary: We had read good things about the "Ayres Inn" however, I think we must have been reading about the Ayres Inn in Anaheim.  This hotel is in Orange, not Anaheim. We were expecting to stay closer to Disneyland but this hotel felt far away.  The rooms are very small.  The hotel elevators were tiny (4 feet by 6 feet) and didn't accomodate many people on them.  The rooms are a little noisy...not well insulated between rooms.  The worst part of our stay, however was the parking issues.  The hotel is building a new hotel behind the existing one and so the parking is pretty much nonexistent.  Plus we were told by one of their night time desk clerks that they were "renting" out their parking lot to AT&T and so one whole parking lot was monopolized by AT&T trucks.  This was extremely
Manager Response: Dear Guest, thank you for taking the time to review our hotel; I appreciate the opportunity to respond to your concerns.  First let me apologize for the front desk giving you incorrect information.  The hotel does not rent out the parking lot to AT&T trucks.  The hotel is currently housing 29 AT&T repairmen from out of state who are working in the Orange County area helping the local AT&T offices.  The trucks all belong to registered and paying guests.  The AT&T office down the street is a difference division and unrelated to the AT&T group staying in the htoel.  Due to the limited parking situation the Hotel is providing complimentary valet service to our guests.  I appreciate your concern that the parking is in the construction site, but it is level, safe and away from the actual construction.  The hotel is anticipating the new 2-story parking sturcture to be open in late April.   I will be using your letter as a training tool to better communication with our guests, ensuring the information they receive is 100% correct.  Again, thank you for your review.  Christine Smith General Manager

Summary Heading: Not as nice as the Anaheim location
Summary: The Ayres Orange is not as nice as the Anaheim location.  It is an older property, nice, but has more wear.  The staff is awesome, very friendly and willing to accommodate. The property and the hotel were clean. There is  construction going on site, they are building a new wing.  The location is right across the street from the hospital, so you will hear sirens if you are a light sleeper.   It also had some weird features, when was the last time you saw a ceiling fan in a hotel? It is  a ways from Disneyland, we never found an easy way to get there from the park. Our stay did come with breakfast, but the Anaheim Ayres was better.  We probably won't stay again, not because our experience was bad, but there are closer hotels of the same quality.  We also enjoyed the Anaheim Ayres
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent stay at our hotel!  We are sorry to read we did not exceed your expectations.  We strive to have our guests leave completely satisfied with their stay.  I'll try and explain on a few comments you noted.  You mentioned that our property wasn't as new or nice as the Anaheim property.  Our building is older than the Anaheim property and the difference we do see, is our guestroom bathrooms since they are a bit smaller.  The decor of the Ayres hotels is nearly the same.  Though it may seem like the Anaheim property is closer to Disney, both properties have the same distance to the theme parks main gate.   We are glad you were very impressed with our staff's service.  We hope to have the opportunity to serve you once again in the future.  Please feel free to contact me directly, so that I can assist you with any further concerns.  My contact information is szuno@ayreshotels.com or 714-978-9168 x702.

Summary: My son goes to a nearby university, and I stay here everytime I visit him. I have always had a good stay - close to everything I need and always a clean room. The breakfast is average, the rooms are a little noisy with hallway noise, but the management is always friendly, helpful and A+. Definitely recommend staying here if you are in the area.
Manager Response: We are very happy to read that our hotel is just perfect for you!  We thank you for your loyalty to our hotel.  Please know it is our pleasure to serve you.  We look forward to your next visit!

Summary: Front desk staff was nice.  The room is large but basic.And the windows dont fully shade.  I did not get a good nights sleep.  I would look elsewhere.  Flat TV, king bed.  Plastic cups for water.  Free wifi.
Manager Response: Dear Guest Thank you for taking the time to write a review of the Ayres Inn Orange.  You mentioned that the "rooms don't fully shade."  I am so sorry, it sounds as if you did not see that there are black out drapes in all our rooms.  The window treatment consists of decorative side drapes and valance, sheers and then the black out drapes tucked against the side walls of the room.  I am also sorry that the connecting room has noisy guests.  Please, should you have problems in any Hotel, so not hesitate to contact the Front Desk or Management so the situation can be quickly rectified.  We would have been happy to help you find the black out drapes and also move you to another quieter room.  And of course we would have asked the neighboring guests to be more considerate in terms of noise.  Should you wish to try our hotel again, please contactr me directly and I will be happy to assist you during your stay.  Christine Smith General Manager

Summary: Everything we needed.  Good breakfast, tickets for parks and shuttle.  Clean rooms with fridge and space to store things off the floor and bed.  Kids loved the pool and hot tub on rest days.  Great staff.  We had a car so I can't comment on proximity to grocery stores/restaurants for walking.
Manager Response: Your review was a pleasure to read.  Thank you for sharing about your wonderful experience at our hotel.  We are thrilled to read we were just what your family needed.  We hope to have the opportunity to serve you on your next visit to the Anaheim/Orange area.

Summary: We stayed here on a recent trip to Disneyland. The hotel is about 2 miles away from Disney. There is a Von's a few blocks down the street, and a Starbuck's and Wendy's right next door. The hotel is under some renovation, although we didn't notice any noise. The free breakfast was nice and included scrambled eggs, bacon/sausage, pancakes, fruit, bagels, etc. The pool was clean, the beds were comfy, the room was very clean as well. My kids enjoyed a cookie in the evening from the front desk after a tired day at the parks. Rooms have a fridge. There is a microwave on the second floor by the vending machines. This property also has a washer/dryer. I would most definitely stay here again! The staff was very nice and accommodating.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience at our hotel.  We are glad you took advantage of all the amenities our hotel offers, such as our complimentary Full-American breakfast buffet, our comfort of our rooms, in-room refrigerators, outdoor heated pool, coin-operated guest laundry.  We also want to let our reviewers know that we have a fitness center on site.  Thank you for your kind comments about our staff and our cookies!  We are very happy to have exceeded your expectations.

Summary: This was our second time staying at the Ayres Orange.  The staff again we courteous and kind.  We were pleasantly surprised at the upgrades in the rooms.  We thought they were nice before, but the new shelving in the rooms are awesome.  They helped us keep our things off the beds and floors.  It was a nice touch.   The beds are heavenly.  My husband has a bad back and often is up all night due to pain.  This was not the case when we stayed here.  He slept better than he has in months.  We are actually looking at purchasing one of these mattresses for our home.  The breakfast was excellent.  My family always goes away full.  Again we enjoyed the free parking, which many hotels near disneyland do not offer.   My only complaint is the loss of the hotel shuttle to Disneyland.  Even
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review.  We are very pleased to read you had another great stay at our hotel!  Thank you for mentioning the new closet space in our guestrooms.  We are glad you found them beneficial.  We are thrilled to read that your husband had a great night sleep in our bed.  Please contact me directly, should you need information on how to purchase one of our Ayres Dream Sleeper.  Thank you for mentioning how much you enjoyed our complimentary breakfast and parking.  We are sorry that we no longer offer a hotel shuttle to Disney, but the Anaheim Resort Transit is most convenient because it runs every thirty minutes throughout the day.  We changed to them because we had a high demand for a shuttle to run all day.  We will share your feedback in regards to their friendliness.  It is unusual of them, as we usually receive great feedback about their service.  We look forward to your upcoming stay.  My contact information is szuno@ayreshotels.com and 714-978-9168 x702.

Summary: The hotel room is clean and sizable, the bed is comfortable, nothing fancy but sufficient; service crew are friendly.  Although it's not next to the Anaheim convention center, but it's just one exit off from 5 fwy. We are happy to save the money and drive a little vs. paying $300 or more a night for a room nearby.  It's a good deal for the price we paid.
Manager Response: We are happy to read you found the great value our hotel has.  You mentioned our proximity to the Anaheim Convention Center, yes we are only a mile and a half away and we are very close to other local attractions.  We also offer complimentary Full American breakfast buffet, complimentary parking and complimentary Wi-Fi.  We hope to have the opportunity to serve you once again on your next visit to the Orange/Anaheim area.

Summary: From the moment of check in to the time I checked out, all staff & managers, very accommodating & helpful. Stayed one month and it felt like HOME.  Any request I made was instantly answered.  Truly kind people with the willingness to help/accommodate.  Very clean & very nicely decorated. Felt like I was in a mansion. Free breakfast - very, very good.  And in house cafe - Anepulcos - great food & service.  I'm an average guy. My stay there and the treatment I received, I felt like a millionaire.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind review.  We truly enjoy being of service to our guests.  As our goal is to exceed the expectations of all of our guests!  It was a pleasure having you stay with us.  Thank you for taking the time to share how your experience with us was for a month.  We hope you visit us again soon again.

Summary: I am so pleased I chose Ayres Inn for my 2 night stay in Orange!!  Delicious affordable dining in the Cafe, full included breakfast filled all my desires, staff at every level was courteous and extremely helpful and friendly!  I highly recommend Ayres Inn and will always return when I'm in Orange.
Manager Response: Thank you for recommending us to other reviewers.  We thank you for your feedback and we are delighted to read we provided you with fabulous service!  Thank you for sharing that our breakfast and food from Anepalco's (restaurant on site) was delicious!  Thank you for giving us the opportunity to serve you.  We look forward to your return visit to our hotel!

Summary: Our stay at The Ayers Inn was perfect from check in to check out! The staff was incredibly helpful, breakfast was delish, our room was spotless, and the beds were AMAZINGLY comfortable! The shuttle was an added convienence. We will definitely stay there again!
Manager Response: Thank you for your sweet and brief review.  We are very happy to read your stay was excellent!  Our goal is to exceed the expectations of all our guests.  Thank you for sharing with our reviewers about our complimentary breakfast, cleanliness and comfort of our rooms and the convenience of the Anaheim Resort Transit.  Our incredibly helpful staff looks forward to serving you on your future stay at our hotel!

Summary: Everyone from the front desk, to the General Manager, were extremely accomodating, much better than avaerage free breakfast, homeade cookies, and a real european feel to the atmosphere, and the  rooms. If I am going to Disney Land again, This is the place to stay, right on the ART, and we got great advice for some great dining options..
Manager Response: We are happy to read you loved our hotel and our staff!  Thank you for giving us the opportunity to show you the great value our hotel has.  We are very close to Disney and many shopping, dining and movie theatres.  We are glad you were able to enjoy our delicious cookies and complimentary Full American breakfast buffet. We hope you visit us again soon!

Summary: This is excellent hotel.  Very nice decor, comfortable beds, very clean.  I was impressed that the hotel left a snack basket in the room -- as a bonus because of their current construction project.  There was no disruption due to the construction that I noticed.  Great breakfast with a variety of food.  Staff is very friendly and welcoming.  Quite a contrast to the cheap cut rate Disney type hotels.  This is a great hotel for a woman who is traveling alone.  The parking lot is well lit. There is only one main door in and out -- unlike some hotels which have multiple unlocked side doors.  My only minor problem was that the exercise room didn't open until 7am and I like to exercise very early in the morning -- like 5 am.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review.  We appreciate you sharing that our hotel was excellent.  We thank you for mentioning our decor, comfort of beds, hotel cleanliness and our great breakfast.  Regarding our fitness center hours, please know we do it to avoid noise complaints to the neighboring rooms of the fitness center.  We thank you for choosing the Ayres Inn Orange as your hotel of choice.  We hope to have the opportunity to serve you again in the future.

Summary: We stayed two days while having out patient surgery at UCI.  Great hotel. Super clean and very attractive lobby and hall ways and rooms.  Great and helpful and efficient and courteous staff.  The next time we travel anywhere I will see if there is an Ayres Inn nearby.  I would have given it five stars but there is some hall noise heard thru the room doors because the doors are not tight fitting - a minor matter but one that could likely be easily corrected.  I had never heard of Ayres Inns before this stay but will definitely think about Ayres when we travel again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your pleasant review.  We are really glad you have chosen the Ayres Inn Orange as your preferred hotel when coming to UCI.  We thank you for letting our other TripAdvisor reviewers of our super clean hotel and wonderful staff.  We look forward to having you stay with us next time you visit the Orange area.

Summary: We will continue going back to this great hotel when we visit Disneyland.  I wrote a much longer review from our trip there in July 2012.  Our experience was just as great this time.  I highly recommend this hotel to everyone.
Manager Response: Thank you for your loyalty to our hotel!  We are thrilled to read that you had a great stay with us in July and in January.  We are really glad we continue to exceed your expectations.  Thank you for choosing the Ayres Inn Orange as your place to stay when visiting the Orange/Anaheim area.

Summary: My husband & I recently stayed at the Ayres Inn & we were very surprised at the wonderful atmosphere in the Inn, the incredible staff, delicious fresh breakfast, & spacious, comfortable room. We had dinner at the restaurant  twice and it was delicious & very fairly priced. I am delighted that we have found a comfortable hotel with all the amenities at a great price. Thankyou to all the staff!
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind review. We are very happy to read we provided a wonderful stay for you and your husband.  We thank you for mentioning our incredible staff, our delicious cookies and our comfortable rooms.  We are also happy to read you really enjoyed Anepalco's restaurant.  I agree, their food is delicious!  It was our pleasure having you as our guest.  We hope to see you again soon!

Summary: Great Stay & Great Staff! Breakfast was Yummy and free parking was a huge plus. Clean hotel and family friendly. We will stay there again.We actually traved 1/2013 but the surveys we have done have only had the 2012 dates. LOL
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  We are very pleased to read you had a great stay and that you agree with us that our staff is great!   We appreciate you enjoying the amenities we offer, such as our free breakfast, free parking and clean rooms.  We look forward to your upcoming stays with us.

Summary: Super friendly staff. Fitness center. shuttle service available to nearby locations.  Great price. Five miles from disneyland. Great place to stay for medical/residency interviews. Right across from uc Irvine and two miles from choc. Shuttle service to and from interview days and room discounts.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind feedback.  We are ecstatic to read you find our hotel to be fantastic!  We appreciate you sharing that our staff was super friendly and that we are very close to the UCI and CHOC medical centers.  We hope to have you stay with us again on your future travels to the Orange/Anaheim area.

Summary Heading: great price for last minute holiday booking
Summary: I have stayed at other Ayres hotels before but this one seems smaller and older than the others (Ontario and Anaheim).  It's not a problem, just an observation.    We booked last minute for NYE and got in at a good price.  There is a resort shuttle that goes between this hotel and Disneyland for a small price.  Nice.    Room was clean, staff was friendly.   Elevators are very small.  If you have a lot of luggage and family,  you probably won't get everyone on the same elevator.   Free breakfast is nice.  Not too much selection,  but it's free!
Manager Response: Thank you for your brief review.  We are happy to read you experienced the great value or hotel has because of the complimentary breakfast.  We are delighted found our rooms to be very clean, our staff to be friendly and the ART shuttle to be just right for your needs.  We hope to have the opportunity to serve you again in the future.

Summary Heading: Disneyland trip  for 14 (10 adults & 4 children, December 15-21, 2012
Summary: We managed to book this six night stay seven months in advance on a buy two nights get one free special. This saved us a lot of money as we had five rooms for our whole family and it allowed us to stay six nights instead of four or five.    The beds were comfortable and the rooms were clean. I liked the fact that the beds had full sized pillows, not the smaller ones I get at other hotels.  One room had a slow drain in the shower and sink.  The low flow toilets that are required in California are frusterating because they take several flushes to finish the job (not much water saving going on there).
