Summary: It was a lovely welcome, staff were really friendly, The room was very spacious and clean, I am prone to biting in hotel beds and I didn't get one bite during our two night stay. There is a shuttle to the disney park which I think was roughly $8 return (or might have been $4- cant remember) but it was worth it and didnt take too long to get there but it saves money on parking at the parks.  The hotel has free parking and wi-fi. They put on a buffet breakfast in the morning with sausages, bacon, pancakes, bread, potatoes, pastries, ham, cheese, juices, water, coffee and tea. They also put out some cookies, coffee and water at reception to help yourself too throughout the day which I thought was a really nice touch.  I have no complaints with the hotel just a tip- don't go to
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: No nickel & diming - Free parking, internet, fitness & breakfast
Summary: Every staff member was courtious, from the front desk, cleaning staff & breakfast room attendants. Rooms are clean & comfortable and they deserve 5/5 rating (not stars,this is a 3 star hotel) for this type of hotel at this price point.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We thought the service, breakfast, and Disney transit was great! The room was a typical 3-4 star hotel room, comfy beds, fridge in room decent flat screen tv. The pool was great and hot tub was hot! No complains. Overall we had a great family trip and will be returning for our next Disney vacation.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: As always, Aryes Inn Orange never dissappoints!
Summary: I take the family (kids 8 & 11) to Disneyland 2 - 3 times a year for a 2 night stay. When available, we book at this property for some key reasons: 1) Price.  The cost of these rooms are very reasonable, regardless of the "level" of the hotel. It never is guessing game as to what the cost is going to be when I book 2) Hotel quality.  The hotel is in superb condition and its decor and feel is fantastic.  It is not a giant property, hence the name "Inn" but otherwise it has super comfortable beds, clean rooms and quality furnishings.  You get the feel that they have spent the time and money to make it feel like a "quality" hotel.  Not sure if you get my theme here.. Quality, not cheap. 3) Room accomodations.  The beds and furniture are big wood peices, not flimsy. They remodeled
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Overrated? Maybe, but Still a Pretty Nice Place...
Summary: After reading so many glowing reviews of this property, perhaps we are guilty of having our expectations set too high, so that being said, while this establishment is very good, we don't feel it qualifies for the five-star ratings that everyone else is seemingly bestowing upon it.   There is a very nice ambiance to this hotel. They claim it is European and whatever you want to call it, it is warm and inviting. But this hotel was originally constructed and operated as a Holiday Inn before Ayres took it over, so while the facade is much improved, there's nothing they could do about the basic construction, which, if you've stayed at a Holiday Inn before, means smaller rooms than you would expect and lack of soundproofing.  Once again, the room itself, upon first glance, is warm and
Manager Response: none

Summary: Ayres made special accomodations for my wedding stay.  They gave us one of the largest rooms and the property was perfect to take the first pictures of me in my dress.  Thanks!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had a great stay.  I loved the free parking, free breakfast, free internet, free HBO, laundry room ($2 to wash, $1.50 to dry and they sell soap at the front desk.).  The room (especially the bathrooms!) were clean.   All of the staff members were very nice and extremely helpful.  This isn't one of your "luxury" hotels, but it's great if you want a clean & comfortable room to stay in.  We stayed here with our two kids (ages 3 and 5), when we went to disneyland.  Instead of using the hotel shuttle to disney, we opted to drive to disney (a little over 3 miles away, less than 10 minutes) and we paid $15 to park at disneyland.  Since you pay for the "entire day" we ended up going to disney in the early morning, returning to the hotel in the afternoon for the kids to take a nap and
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Convenient and economical place to visit southern California.
Summary: We spent a full 8 nights at Ayres Inn Orange after another family and ours spent quite a bit of time searching the internet for a higher rated economically priced place to stay.  The good things about the hotel are the lack of charges for the extras.  The free parking and breakfast were good perks.  With the 7 of us it saved on a lot of $10 breakfasts for the 8 days we were there and the food was always ready when we woke up so there was little wait to get on the road.  They served the basic bacon(alternated with sausage daily) and scrambled eggs with pancakes and diced fruit.  There was also your standard continental type menu options there as well.  Although the layout was quite buffet style the food was generally good but limited selection for over a weeks stay. Our plan was
Manager Response: Dear Guest - Thank you so much for taking time to write such a detailed and informative review about the Ayres Inn Orange.  You really provided alot of valuable tips to our future guests!!   We loved hosting your family and are finding more and more of our Canadian neighbors staying at our hotel.  I loved your comment about the ceiling dry wall effect; we have many guests mention the same thing and I do feel the need to explain.  Our ceilings are actually a plaster finish done in the European style using a trowel to smooth and swirl the plaster to create the "old world look."  I also wondered about the ceilings when I first started working here and had maintenance explain the process. Again, thank you very much!!!  Christine Smith General Manager

Summary: Every positive review I read (hearty continental breakfast, wonderfully comfy beds, quiet, pretty rooms, convenience of free parking, helpful staff) was true to its word. Embarking on a Disney trip with kiddos can be incredibly stressful. Ayres served as our stress-free zone for five lovely days. I haven't a single complaint and will be singing their praises for years.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great place to stay in Anaheim.
Summary: We attended the Volleyball Conference this past weekend to watch our granddaughter play at the Anaheim Stadium and the Conference Center.  The Ayres Inn was conveniently located and a delightful place to stay nearby.  The staff are 'service oriented' and are there to make you feel welcome and appreciated.  The hotel is clean and staff efficient.  The breakfast was delicious.  I would recommend this for families, friend, and couples.  The beds were so comfortable!
Manager Response: none

Summary: My wife and 2 boys chose to stay at the Aries because it was the most convienent hotel for us sine we needed to stay for a month because our house flooded  after a few days we felt like the staff was like family the service and attitudes were exceptional I highly reccomend this hotel especially for a Disneyland vacation
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed at the Ayres Inn to be near a new job.  The location is very convenient...a couple of miles to The Honda Center, Anaheim Stadiulm...close to Disneyland...perpendicular to UCI Medical Center...close to nice eating places...The hotel is very nice, the rooms are nice and clean, furnishings are nice.  Breakfast is good, eggs, sausages, bacon, potatoes, pancakes etc.  The hotel manager Christine is simply outstanding!  She is very helpful and she works really hard!  Superior customer service!  Staff is very nice.  I have to mention the front desk associate Julio who has excellent customer service skills!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great place and affordable on a budget
Summary: We wanted to visit Disneyland but were on a very tight budget. I searched and searched for a quality hotel at a price we could afford and Ayres fit the bill. The bonus is a full breakfast is included. The room was clean and quiet and the staff very helpful. The shuttle to and from Disneyland stops right in front and is very affordable. On the way back from Disneyland, if you ask nice you might get the shuttle driver to drop you off across the street from Ayres instead of having to do the entire loop. Breakfast each morning as hot, fresh and tasty. The only downside to our entire stay was the limited eating establishments near the hotel. When we left Disneyland each night we were usually hungry and the only choice was the Wendy's next door which has some pretty stupid drive up
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A comfortable respite from busy Disney
Summary: The hotel was clean and comfortable and the staff was courteous and efficient. I would stay at the Ayres Inn Orange again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: If you are traveling to Orange, this is definitely the place to stay whether for a couple days or a week! My husband & i stayed for 5 nights to attend a convention across the street & check in was fast, our room was very well cleaned, since we were given a pet friendly room because of our 2 dogs it didn't smell like dog or anything! Our room was a 1 bed & was very very spacious well lit, nice restroom, bed was comfortable, & warm blankets. They even had a small bed & dog bowl to welcome our dogs too! Breakfast was early in the morning but well worth it full buffet, yummy food options, lots of seating available & the staff was really good about keeping the food trays filled. The front desk staff were very attentive even if we were just passing by they always gave a hello. The
Manager Response: none

Summary: very nice hotel! Very comfortable. Friendly staff. Parking is free!!! How nice is that!!! Breakfast in the morning on the patio was wonderful! Wish they could extend the breakfast hours out by 1 hour for those travelers that like to sleep in a little. Over all, no complaints whatsoever.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A visit to Disneyland with kids
Summary: I booked our hotel thru GetAway Today for a trip to Disneyland with our older daughters-age 5 and 7 and my mom.  We were throughly impressed with this hotel and the many great reviews we had read.  We booked getting a third night free which really felt like we got a fantastic deal because our stay couldn't have been better!  We really loved and appreciated (getting to save $) the continental breakfast each morning.  That was a huge perk of this hotel for us.  The shuttle to/from Disneyland stops right at the hotel and is so easy to use with kids.  The staff were all very professional and courteous.  Great pool and hottub and already miss the So Cal sunshine.  This place is great!!
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your great review, we appreciate the feedback.  And yes, using Getaway Today is a wonderful way to save money and get the most out of vacations to Disneyland.  We love our partnership with Getway Today which birngs us wonderful families such as yours!  Christine Smith General Manager Ayres Inn Orange

Summary: The beds are comfortable, the staff is helpful, the pool was nice and the breakfast was perfect. This is a great place for parents of Chapman Students to stay it even includes a discount for us!! This is the hotel we stay in when we visit and also the place that we recommend to others.
Manager Response: Dear Kaz36HoodRiverOregon –  Thank you very much for choosing our hotel for your stay and for taking the time to share your positive experience on TripAdvisor. It is wonderful to know that you consistently find the service and amenities to your liking. Ayres Inn Orange does maintain a special rate for parents of students of the nearby Chapman University, and I am pleased to know you are able to take advantage of this special offer. We greatly appreciate your recommendation and look forward to your next visit.   Safe travels,  Christine Smith General Manager

Summary Heading: Kind, helpful, friendly and efficient staff
Summary: This is our second stay at the ayres in orange and it was even better this time. They remembered us from 3 years ago which I thought was impressive,, the housekeeper we had the first couple days exceeded all expectations simply amazing. Only thing is that they dont have a shuttle.to disney anymore I would have paid to have that instead of the anaheim transit. Amazing breakfast and the best value around - Bonnie mahlum
Manager Response: Dear Bmahlum –  It was such a pleasure welcoming you as our guest again. Thank you so much for taking the time to let fellow travelers know about our hotel. I am pleased that the amenities and accommodations made for a satisfying stay. We appreciate being given the opportunity to provide a comfortable and clean experience for a second time and hope to welcome you a third time very soon.  Warm regards,  Christine Smith General Manager

Summary: Nice clean hotel, breakfast was satisfying.  Only stayed for the weekend, but a wedding party also stayed.  In the middle of the night I had to call the desk twice because they were fighting in the hall.  The hotel took care of the problem and gave me a discount for all three nights.  We will stay there again when we visit Disney.
Manager Response: Dear Guest Thank you very much for taking the time to write a Trip Advisor review.  And expecially thank you for noting we stepped in as soon as notified to quiet the wedding party.  It is indeed unfortunate and frustrating when other guests cause problems that lessen the overall great experience for other guests.  We will continue to work hard to monitor these types of situations to ensure a comfortable experience for all.  Thank you for choosing the Ayres Inn Orange.  Christine Smith General Manager

Summary Heading: Great hotel, but too far from Disneyland!
Summary: We have Disneyland annual passes and have always stayed at the ayres. They have had a free Disneyland shuttle provided by the hotel, which was awesome! A week before my last stay, they discontinued the shuttle. I tried to find a different hotel closer to the park without luck. The ART shuttle comes to the ayres but it's a good 30 mins till you get to Disneyland and about 30 mins from Disney back to the hotel. Far too long with whiny, tired children in tow. This was also the first time we flew instead of drove so I couldn't just drive ourselves to the park.  Another problem is the maid service. I've had this problem the last two stays. If you don't put the 'do not disturb' sign on your door, they will come in at 8am. It's pretty annoying to get woken up. The walls are also very
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Pros and Cons for Disneyland Families
Summary: We stayed here in February for our first trip to Disneyland as a family. I booked it for three reasons: 1) Free Parking 2) Free FULL breakfast and 3) Free shuttle to and from Disneyland. When we got here we were informed that they no longer offered a free shuttle. There is a bus that stops out front that will take you to and from the park, but it will cost ya. The breakfast was OK-still fairly small, but not bad. I do think they could offer more kid type cereals, but the pancakes were appreciated. The staff was friendly, and the rooms were clean.   The ONLY reason I would not return to Ayres is the location and lack of shuttle directly to and from the park. If you stay here, and Disneyland is your goal, keep in mind-if you take the bus, it will take you over 20 minutes to travel
Manager Response: Dear Guest Thank you very much for taking your time to review the Hotel.  Yes, unfortunately the Hotel is no longer able to provide a free shuttle to Disneyland and has joined the other Hotels in the area that use the ART (Anaheim Resort Transportation) bus system.  Our website has noted this change for some time, but we are finding that anyone who books through Hotels.com, Priceline, Expedia, etc.. are still receiving incorrect information.  The Hotel contacted all of the thrid party websites when the change was made but were told that it would take each site 4-6 weeks to correct our shuttle information.  The Hotel apologizes for this and continues to contact these sites daily in an effort to correct our information in a timely manner.  The ART shuttle does run on an hourly basis during slower weeks at Disneyland but will run on the half hour during busier times such as Spring Break, Summer and Holiday periods. Thank you for the kind comments regarding breakfast and the Hotel in general. Christine Smith General Manager

Summary: GREAT deal.  great bfast.  great rates.  nice people.
Manager Response: Dear Andrew –  Thank you very much for your kind review of Ayres Inn Orange. It is always a pleasure to hear that our guests find the rates, service, and accommodations of our hotel satisfactory as a positive guest experience is of the utmost importance. I also appreciate your comment regarding the complimentary breakfast and will be sure to share it with our breakfast team. We hope to welcome you again soon.  Sincerely,  Christine Smith General Manager

Summary: Based on our previous very positive experience at another Ayres hotels property, we booked a four-day weekend at the Ayres Inn Orange / Disneyland. The visit met and exceeded our expectations, and at a very competitive and affordable rate. We had recreational stops all over the map of Orange County, including the Nixon Presidential Library, whale watching at Balboa, seeing the Crystal Cathedral, seeing the Star Wars exhibit at the Science Center, antique shopping in the city of Orange, and dining out at terrific restaurants. And the Ayres Inn Orange was a short drive to every destination, meaning we did the whole trip from our home in northern L.A. County on a single tank of gas! We will be back!
Manager Response: Dear LarryG490 –  It was such an honor to have you as a guest of our hotel. Thank you for your kind review and for your continued patronage of the Ayres Hotels. It is gratifying to know that you found the accommodations, surrounding activities, and general location to your liking as our goal is and always will be providing guests with a comfortable and convenient hotel experience. We are also very appreciative of your recommendation and look forward to hosting your next stay.  Sincerely,  Christine Smith General Manager

Summary: We were next expecting to be in this area as we were on our way to San Diego.  But my husband got sick and ended up  being in two different ER's in two days.  When I called them at 10:30 pm they were able to book us a room and then were very good to extend our stay for 2 days past that!  Room was great!
Manager Response: Dear Leigh –  Thank you so much for taking the time to inform fellow travelers about Ayres Inn Orange. While I am terribly sorry about the incident surrounding your stay, I am pleased that you found the rooms and service comfortable enough during what must have been a very difficult time. Again, thank you for your review. We hope to welcome you again soon under more positive circumstances.  Safe travels,  Christine Smith General Manager

Summary: Free breakfast in the morning, a warm fire in the fireplace to greet you, warm chocolate chip cookies in the evening, and the fitness room and business center for balance!  HD flat screen, HBO, refrigerator, wifi, all in your room.  Excellent accommodations and friendly, accomodating staff!
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel was amazing.  The room was spotless and incredibly comfortable with a luxurious bed and leather couch.  The front desk staff were helpful and friendly.  There is free parking available.  The complimentary breakfast was delicious.  I highly recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I booked a package on Orbitz and was considering one of the higher end hotels nearby, but for the price difference, I couldn't justify it. The Ayres Inn was perfectly adequate for our needs. It looks rather unassuming from the outside but inside the decor is as photographed, and is welcoming and hospitable. The breakfast buffet was surprisingly decent and included eggs, meat, potatoes, and fruit, along with the standard continentals of cereal, pastry, juice and coffee. We had a king size room and it was pleasantly large and well-appointed. The room was clean but showing signs of disrepair. Overall, the hotel feels like an older hotel that was painted over with higher end treatments and furnishings, but it was a steal of a deal and in a great location. There were obviously
Manager Response: none

Summary: Nice surprise to have a charming hotel so close to all the "chain" hotels.  I know Ayres has other hotels but I've only been to this one. Pictures accurately depicted the room which was nice. Check in was a breeze. Elevators were tiny but not an issue, just surprised to see tiny elevators!   Daily free buffet breakfast was a nice treat, made getting out the door in the morning easy and stress free.  We will stay here again if we are in the area.  Only negative this was the bed was too soft. I like medium beds and this one was like a big pillow. Back was sore... :/  Thank you!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Service, convenience and breakfast - All Great!
Summary: This hotel was great. The front desk staff was always friendly and helpful. Breakfast was more than decent, and the location was very convenient to the Anaheim Convention Center, Disneyland, movie theatres and lots of shopping. It was a win-win situation!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have been going to this property for 6 years now during the month of January. In fact we just got back. It has been nice to see some of the same people there each year. They are always willing to accommodate all our needs. The beds are very comfortable and the rooms always clean. We have never had a negative incident at this hotel. There is a large mall close by we can walk to although the hotel has a van that takes us to many places that are nearby. The breakfast is not 5 star but the folks that work there are always willing to serve more hot water or refill items that have run out with a smile.  It is not a five star property and the look is of a large motel but the attitude of the people and the comfort and convenience make it the best choice for us in the area.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel is average.  We waited about 10 minutes for someone to show up during our check in.  Some of the walls in the hotel looked like they had been kicked in, and a very poor repair job was done to fix the hole.  The gym is tiny.  Basically two pieces of equipment in a small room.  no windows.  Felt very enclosed.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We are a family of 4 and we were super impressed with this hotel! Awesome staff who were very attentive as well as helpful. Especially one in particular on their night front desk staff. We took full advantage of their continental breakfast each morning. Not the most amazing breakfast I've ever had but still not bad at all. Our room and the hotel was very clean and we enjoyed The complimentary cookies and water in the lobby. The pool was great and the hot tub as well. The only things I'd change if I could would be that there is little water pressure, the bathroom was small and you can hear people coming and going in the hall at night. Wasn't a problem though since the hotel was relatively quiet but maybe it's because we were off season. Just the same though, I'd give them two
Manager Response: none

Summary: Chosen thru Priceline. After reading some reviews, was expecting "so-so".  Pleasantly surprised!  Courteous staff, clean, quiet, great breakfast, easy accessible.   Recommended.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This one is tough to review. We stayed in the hotel the week before Christmas. We were a group of two families, with two rooms, one member with a disability. Most of the staff was extremely helpful and kind. The hotel was clean. Breakfast was fantastic---and what a HUGE money saver, especially with that many of us!! Really what it comes down to, is the only problems we had were with the shuttle. It seemed to be a daily battle to find a time when they could drive the van, which had room for the scooter that we had to transport to and from Disneyland. Most of the time there was only 1 driver so time slots were very limited. The real reason for my review is to make people aware of what happened the final day. (By the way, ALL of the drivers except for 1 were absolutely AMAZING,
Manager Response: Dear Guest Thank you for writing the review specifying the difficulty who experienced with the transportation of the motorized scooter.  I also appreciated your communication with me during your stay.  As I mentioned when driving your family to Disneyland one day, the Hotel will be changing to an outside bus service to transport our guests to/from the Disneyland Resort.  This will occur in February.  The contracted service will have larger buses and lifts to accomodate our special needs guests who have scooters or wheelchairs.  As the popularity of the Ayres Inn Orange has grown over the last 2 years, especially with our Disneyland guests, we needed to improve our shuttle service to accomodate all day shuttle requests, provide larger buses for the larger number of guest going to the park and especially attend to our special needs guests.  These were all growing complaints we needed to resolve.  The Ayres Inn Orange is one of the last area Hotels to provide complimentary shuttle service; but in providing the new service guests will be charged for daily passes to use the shuttle.  This allows the Hotel to maintain our competitive rates including our breakfast, internet and parking while still providing a shuttle service to those guest who need it.   In terms of the driver you mentioned, that personnel issue has been resolved. Christine Smith General Manager

Summary: The hotel was reasonably priced. Rooms were clean and comfy.  Pool was also nice and clean.  Breakfast was great!  Bring your own shampoo here, though as the one in the room isn't great.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your great review, it is appreciated!   I would like to also let our future guests know that we just changed to Time Warner on January 3rd, increasing the number of TV channels to 60 including 3 Spanish language channels.  This is a big improvement over our prior channel offering!  Christine Smith General Manager

Summary: THE SERVICE IS AMAZING!!! Great reminder of what customer service used to look like! GREAT PLACE TO STAY, especially if you're going to Disneyland! It's far away from the crazy traffic & crowds...The FANTASTIC shuttle service deals with all the driving to and from throughout the day that it makes going and coming to Disneyland EASY and STRESS FREE!!! The Ayres also does not nickle and dime you with extra charges...FREE parking, shuttle, full hot breakfast and refrigerators in the rooms. And the rooms are CLEAN!!! being a bit germ-a-phob... I was EXTREMELY surprised with how clean the hotel is from the moment you walk in the doors and the rooms are just as clean!!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: First time here and it was well worth it. Friendly employees, nice room, great location and a good breakfast. If in the area again we will return.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We really enjoyed this hotel. The breakfast every morning was great. For the most part three service was good. I did have one incident with a shuttle driver. One morning I had my wife and my 8 kids in the shuttle bus ready to go and we were waiting on another family so I remembered that I forgot my camera bag in the room. I asked the driver if I had 2 minutes to run upstairs too get my camera. He said that would be  but when I came  back he had left me. They got me on the next shuttle but had left my  wife to handle all 8 kids with the stroller by herself. Then when they got to the  park he didn't even bother helping unload the stroller. I'll bet he wonders why her doesn't get tips. They need to get rid of that driver. Everyone else was superb. Just one thorn amongst the roses.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Mentioned in passing that we were staying there for our 1st wedding anniversary (just for conversation sake). About a half an hour later, a desk person showed up at our door with a complimentary bottle of champagne and a box of candies. True class!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Worth returning to, over and over and over again!
Summary: This was our second stay at the Ayres Orange. The value for the money was incredible. Their full breakfast buffet is unbeatable! Hot eggs, sausage/bacon, potatoes and pancakes. Always fresh and yummy. Their shuttle service to Disneyland is top notch! Even changes to your schedule are made with a smile! The employees are very helpful, nice and just give an outstanding experience/service. Rooms are clean and well furnished. Refrigerator and flat screen TV complimented our rooms. Beds are comfortable! We have stayed at many locations around Disneyland and will always return to the Ayres from now on.
Manager Response: none

Summary: From the moment we walked into the Ayres we were welcomed by friendly employees! We loved the free shuttle to Disneyland! The complementary breakfast was a great way to start our day. We will stay here again on our next trip to Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights and it was amazing! Every morning we were given a full hot breakfast FREE. The staff was friendly and the room was nice and clean. It was close enough to Disney and they offered a free shuttle  I definately will stay here again!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great place to stay, even with kids.
Summary: We stayed for 3 nights for a Disney trip.  We knew nothing about the hotel but we were pleasantly suprised by how nice it was.  The front desk was very happy and helpful each time we called and spoke to them.  The shuttle worked great for us, and we found all the drivers, except one, very kind and helpful.  The breakfast was so delicious and saved us some money at Disneyland because our bellies were full through lunch.  The staff even extended check-out for 1.5 hrs because our kids were taking a nap.  Then they let us keep using the shuttle until that night even though we had checked out.  The rooms were very pretty and comfortable.  The only strange thing was that there was no eating table in the room, but they had a desk.  Overall, we really enjoyed our stay and would come
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: I Will Stay Here Again and Again
Summary: I love this hotel!  The rooms are spacious, nice and clean.  The staff is friendly.  The breakfast is awesome!  The only negative thing I could find was the Monday through Friday morning shuttle driver was rude and not friendly at all.  All of the other drivers were super helpful and courteous.  This is my new #1 choice for our Disneyland trips!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great hotel for Disneyland--and probably for anything else too
Summary: We booked a five night stay at the Ayres Inn Orange for a Disneyland trip.  Two adults, a teen and a child.  We booked through Hotwire so didn't know what we were getting, but we were very impressed with the quality of the hotel and the service.  We arrived before 10 in the morning, but the front desk immediately let us into the room, even though it wasn't meant to be ready until 3:00 pm.  We unpacked and immediately took the free hotel shuttle to Disneyland for the remainder of the day.  The shuttle service was efficient and timely; the only drawback was that the shuttle shuts down during the afternoon.  The hotel is about a 5-8 minutes ride from Disneyland.  Friendly drivers. The hotel is in excellent condition, clean and tastefully decorated. There was always coffee and lemon
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for DisneyLand
Summary: We took our kids to DisneyLand for their first time and stayed at the Ayres Inn Orange. We booked through getawaytoday.com and chose this hotel because of the good reviews on tripadvisor and crossed our fingers. We were not disappointed!! All the staff was great. The manager was out during breakfast and she would come around and talk to people and even remembered how many days my kids had been there and asked them how they were enjoying DL. The shuttle to DL was always on time. We booked our shuttle times in advance and they let us change our pick up time as long as we called ahead. On the weekdays they can do special trips during the middle of the day but on the weekends it is too busy to send someone in the middle of the day. As long as you book your drop off and pick up
Manager Response: none

Summary: I am a frequent Southern CA traveler and stay at Ayres hotels whenever possible. My experience is always positive- friendly staff/comfortable accommodations/great breakfast! Many thanks :)
Manager Response: none

Summary: Wer stayed 2 nights & had very excellant service from helpful friendly people.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have stayed there 2 times and we will definitely stay again the next time we are down to Disneyland.  It's a nice hotel with a comfortable room.  Most of my family goes so it's a good deal with the breakfast buffet and free shuttle to Disney.  We stay the whole week so the laundry room is also very helpful.  Most of all the staff is very helpful, they understand customer service.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had a very comfortable two night stay at this hotel. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Within walking distance to the Crystal Cathedral and a short drive to downtown old Orange. Be warned; breakfast finishes on the dot, stragglers will go hungry.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I give the staff an A+...very accomodating and friendly.  Very economical rate, however, as the old saying  goes, you get what you pay for. Room was definitely nothing to write home about. Beds were very uncomfortable (cheap, starchy sheets, uncomfortable matress, no real blankets and very thin bedspreads.  Not enough available power outlets in room for recharging phone, computer, using iron, etc. Elevators were extremely small and creaky...a little scary for my child. The most frustrating aspect was the noise level....doors had a wide opening at the bottom, so you could hear everything that goes on out in the hallway...screaming kids running around, maid service, room service etc. Property in a difficult location if you are driving...can't make a left turn onto main road so if
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: We'd Stay There Again In a Minute!
Summary: We loved the spacious, clean, comfortable King room, the delicious hot buffet breakfasts, the free use of the computer and printer (when we needed to get our boarding passes to depart), the cozy setting with the furniture and fireplace (our family gathered together there quite frequently during our stay), and the helpful, kind staff!  All of it made it an excellent place to stay!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stay here only two days. The room ability is awesome. However, my stay was for business. Therefore, I would like to go to Disney Land. Almost all stayers seem to go to there. Here is a nice place to visit to Disney Land in LA.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Everything from the helpfulness of the front desk staff to the clean and elegantly furnished room made our stay delightful! The buffet breakfast is a bonus too as it rivals full service restaurants. Check the hotel web site for specials. We had a romantic special which came with chocolates and a bubbly wine. The cost was LESS than just an ordinary stay at other hotels!
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is the second time I stayed at the Ayres Inn.  It's a beautiful hotel, with a great staff.  It feels like small comfortable inn, but has all the amenities of a larger hotel.  It's in a great location, has a wonderful complimentary breakfast in the cafe and very comfortable rooms.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here in October 2011 by far the nicest hotel we have stayed at around Disneyland.  Room was very clean and bed was comfortable and the mini fridge was nice.  Everything in the room including the bathroom was updated and most importantly clean.  Check in and out was very easy.  They have a nice large free parking lot. We had really no complaints, that said it is a bit difficult to get in and out of the parking lot.  You can only turn one way out of the parking lot and it requires two u-turns to get back to the freeway.  By the way we noticed zero noise from it.  The pool and especially the hot tub are pretty small, but wasn't all that croweded when we were there.  To bad the much larger pool is closed, a victim of insurance I suppose.  The free breakfast was just okay not
Manager Response: none

Summary: I am a local here in OC. My now g/f was visiting CA for the first time recently and I suggested she chose a hotel with free breakfast and parking with good reviews and value. She ended up choosing Ayres Hotel in Orange, a place I pass by many times during the course of a typical month for me. The service from the staff was impeccable from the minute we checked in, and the room we had was an awesome King room with clean everything and a very comfortable bed. The breakfast, while pretty monotonous during our 7 night stay, was pretty good and fresh. The chocolate chip cookie in the lobby during the evening is a nice added touch as was the good Disneyland shuttle, which we used only once during our stay. I will definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in the Orange/
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great stay and cafe at Ayres
Summary: My stay at Ayres was quite nice; the service was nice and helpful, the rooms where comfy and quiet id give them a 4/5, but i absolutely adored the cafe. it most definitely was a 5/5. I made several trips there during my stay. The lunches had big, i mean BIG portions for a very good price, very filling and scrumptious,  the waitress was also very nice and helpful. At the poolside, i had some appetizers and snacks which were absolutely delicious too, and the service was once again delightful.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Pleasant and convenient for Disneyland stay
Summary: Free parking, free breakfast, and free internet.  Comfortable bed and one of the cleanest hotel bathrooms I've seen.  They have a shuttle to Disneyland but we didn't use it.   It's situated right off the highway, so it can be noisy but we ran the fan at night and it was fine. It's an easy drive to Disneyland and other tourise attractions.  We've stayed here twice (most recently over the weekend of 10/21) and didn't have any complaints either time.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Just ompleted a three night stay at the Ayres. Felt comfortable that I had done my homework prior and was not disappointed.  Didn't do much there but sleep, but it was a very comfortable place and a great drop off for Disneyland.  The rooms were very clean and beds comfortable. Not much lighting, but no less than may other hotels weve stayed in. I always travel with a white noise app/machine so I don't ever worry about whether I have noisy neighbors. Though we were close to the elevator and it made a moaning noise on a regular basis.  I'm sure if we were farther away, it wouldn't be noticeable.   Can't rate the pool as we never been saw it, much less got in it...  The elevators are quite small. Thought I was in Europe. And there was a distinct oil/hydraulic fluid smell just
Manager Response: none

Summary: We reserved this hotel through a package deal and got a very good price. On arrival (not early) the check in person had difficulty finding a room that was clean. We were assigned to room 502. Unfortunately, this room faced the I-5 and the hospital. I'm the only light sleeper in the group and was therfore the only one bothered by the traffic and ambulances all night. The room itself and the bathroom were very clean. The bathroom was very small which made it difficult to help my son get ready in the morning.  Breakfast was better than most free breakfasts since it included eggs, sausage, pancakes, cereal and breads. Got a little repetitive after the third day, but hey, it was free. Hotel was a little farther from Disneyland than I expected and the free shuttle doesn't run in the
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here 2 nights. Nice hotel. Front desk staff need some customer service training. Requested non-down pillows as I'm allergic and was told they would bring some but never received. Other than that, really nice stay!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Booked a 4 night stay with GetAway Today package.  The room came out to just over a hundred a night, not a great deal but I felt the free parking, breakfast, and shuttle to Disneyland would even it out. The location was great.  Nice area across the street from The Block at Orange shopping center. Lots of great stores and dining options.  The hotel was clean and secure.  I really wanted to love this place and had high expectations since it ranked #2 on Trip Advisor. There were just a few negatives I encountered during my stay.  1. Breakfast - Met my expectations as far as quality.  Your standard pancakes, eggs, breakfast meat, breads, coffee, etc.  But they stop serving at 9am on weekdays.  Kinda early when you return from Disneyland at midnight. (Open till 10am on weekends)
Manager Response: Dear Guest Thank you very much for your Trip advisor review, I appreciate your detailed comments and would like to respond to them. Lobby Computer - You are correct, Adobe is a basis program and once we received your comment about Adobe not being on our lobby computer, we had it loaded and it is now available for our guests.  Thank you for the suggestion, no one had ever asked and we just didn't think about it. Cashing traveler's checks - I would like to apologize for not having funds available to cash your TA checks, we have put a couple of simple procedures in place at the Front Desk to ensure we always have enough money on hand for future guests. Shuttle - I am sorry that you were unable to book early enough to get your desired time on the shuttle and I understand the difficulty when you have small children.  Unfortunately during busy time periods there will always be time slots that fill more quickly than others whether we have a 25 person bus or a 50 person bus.  As the shuttle bus is complimentary we hope our guests understand the need to be flexible and I ask my desk to be flexible as well.  I have reminded my staff that if managers are available and a second bus needs to be added, to let us know so we can jump in to help satisfy everyone's  desired time frames. Again thank you for your review and should you return to the Hotel, don't hesitate to contact me personally for help in getting shuttle times when you need them.  Christine Smith General Manager

Summary: I booked a 7 day trip to Calif from Salt Lake City, Ut. to visit relatives, go to San Diego and Disneyland.  I checked out hotels for weeks finding any reviews I could locate.  After MUCH searching and worn out looking for the best deal I picked the Ayres.  I booked through GETAWAY TODAY and they had the Ayres Hotel.  So after I booked it I realized the address was a different location-I wanted the one by the Honda Center/Stadium.  So I was upset and wasn't sure how it would be next to UCI (I grew up in Garden Grove and know the area very well!) When I called the hotel to try to switch they said the one I wanted is not on GETAWAY TODAY.  SO-to make a long story short...THIS HOTEL IS FANTASTIC!!!!! EVERYTHING ABOUT IT WAS WONDERFUL!!! THE ROOM, THE MAID SEVICE, THE FREE DELICIOUS
Manager Response: none

Summary: We got into town about 8 in the morning after a 8 hr drive. Although we(me and 4 kids) were dead we decided to drive around til check in time... we were so tired that we decided to try to check into the hotel around 1 pm and the gentleman at the front desk was so kind he let us check in early without charging us another day. The next morning we took the free shuttle to Disneyland and planned to stay til the Park closed at 12 am  but could not last that long so we called the front desk and they had no problem picking us up early. We finally decided to eat the free full breakfast which was delicious and all the staff were absolutely wonderful. The beds were comfy, the rooms were clean , the service was excellent. When we come back in December we are def staying here again. Our
Manager Response: none

Summary: Just spent 4 wonderful nights at the Ayres Inn and was so sad to leave! (Have to add as well that we travelled on to Vegas and I didnt enjoy the suite at the new PH Towers half as much). The beds were exceptionally comfy and had lovely "sink in" pillows which ensured a great nights sleep. Bathroom sparkling clean and I do not understand some of the reviews which complained they were small - how many people do you need in there at one time??? My hubby managed to shower perfectly fine whilst I did my hair and make up. Breakfast was the only tiny niggle..... if we had stayed any longer it would probably have been a little monotonous having the same things each day. However the food was very nice and the stations replenished frequently. Didn't use the free shuttle as we weren't here
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for two nights (1-3 August 2011). We went to Disneyland for one day and shopped the next day at the Block at Orange which was an excellent shopping centre right across the road. There was also a great Mexican restaurant across from the mall. The pool was very refreshing and the spa was nice and hot. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. It was a short drive to Costco which was handy and I really appreciated the free shuttle to Disneyland which saved the hassle of parking. Wi-fi was fast. Breakfast was okay, I mainly ate fruit, toast and cereal as the eggs were not very nice. Excellent value hotel and will definately stay there again. We were so impressed with the Ayres Orange location we also stayed at the Ayres Hawthorne not far from Manhattan Beach which
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Take Me Out To the Ayres
Summary: We spent two nights at the Ayres Inn Orange, not for Disneyland, but for two Angels baseball games.  Excellent location for both, but especially nice for the games as it is quite close.  The rooms are a good size, check in & out is easy and fast.  The employees are very nice.  There were warm chocolate chip cookies available in the late afternoon (very, very good!) and a free breakfast in the mornings (buffet style)-food okay.  The room was very clean, the furnishings were nicer then I usually see in a hotel for this price.  The headboards and desk were lovely to look at, as was the chair in the corner. Nice flat screen TV,  plenty of pillows, sparkling bathroom, although the low flush toilet took a little getting used to.  Bed was comfortable, but a little firmer than I like.
Manager Response: none

Summary: we took a pleasure trip to the Inn and expected a restaurant (3737) to be able to eat at any time.  We were sorely disappointed when they told they were not open on weekends.  The kids at the desk said it was not owned by the hotel and "that was just the policy".  They were not apologetic at all or suggestive of any other places to eat.  They were just kids with no experience-obviously at how to handle customers.  The room was OK, but the bathroom was exceptionally small not allowing but one person at a time in the area.  We will not go back .
Manager Response: Dear Guest Thank you for taking the time to review your stay at the Ayres Inn Orange.  I am very sorry that that your were disappointed in the Cafe not being open for lunch or dinner on the weekends.  It is correct that the Hotel leases out the Cafe to a third party who operates Monday-Friday; lunch, dinner and room service.  It is the operators discretion whether they want to open on the weekends.   In the past there has never been enough demand for an operator to be open on the weekends and have the Cafe be financially viable.  I would like to apologize for my staff seeming to be uncaring or helpful in suggesting other dining options in our neighborhood.  This is a concern I will be addressing with my desk staff immediately and I wholeheartedly agree they should have been more helpful. As to the size of the bathrooms, they are small, the building having been built in the 1960's and unfortunately there is nothing that can be done to expand them.  Christine Smith General Manager

Summary: Spent 4 nights here, very enjoyable.  Room was clean and spacious, beds comfortable.  Hot breakfast was part of package, nothing spectacular, but adequate.  Scrambled eggs, bacon/sausage, pancakes.  Got a little boring by the third day, but it was free.  Free shuttle to Disneyland was nice, but has limited hours.  Just need to plan.  All in all the hotel was nice, the service was good, friendly staff.  If we ever go back to Disney, will probably stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Outstanding Place..Wish I could give 6 stars.
Summary: We stayed here for 6 days. We were completely blown away with the value this hotel brings. Every morning we would get up and eat at the complementary breakfast buffet. We would then be able to skip lunch and eat at Wendy's which is next door.   Pros..  + Price. We didn’t break the bank staying here. I have paid literally 6 times more for 10 times less. We normally do Priceline for hotels but if we come back to LA I will forgo Priceline name your price just  to be sure we stay here again.  + The breakfast buffet. This saved us $15.00 a day. So you figure $15 x 6 = $90.00 The Buffet has eggs,sausage/bacon,pancakes,potatoes and your normal continental stuff. milk,juices,coffee.  + Free Parking  + Free shuttle to and from Disney. You schedule when you want to go and when you want to
Manager Response: none

Summary: I chose this hotel based on the Trip Advisor recommendations.  The descriptions were on target.  This was a birthday trip for my grandson to Disneyland.  We enjoyed the pool and jacuzzi.  The room was spacious and clean; the staff friendly and accommodating, and the breakfast as good as one could reasonably expect for the price.  The hotel provides complementary shuttle service to Disneyland.  This was always on time, and one of the managers even made a special trip just for us, as our return time was earlier than their regularly scheduled service. The only negative, which has nothing to do with the hotel, emanates from the Disneyland "Express" service from the Orange County airport.  The bus circuit covers several hotels, and Ayres is the last stop.  It took 45 minutes from the
Manager Response: none

Summary: Room and breakfast were adequate/average for what you expect at this price level. I gave the hotel a lower rating for a couple of reasons:  (1) The night clerk, Luis, was smug and arrogant.  It seemed that the rest of the staff was just. . .curt.    We left after a couple of nights for friendlier place.   Also, (2) their shuttle to Disney only runs in the morning and evening.  From around noon until I believe 5pm, you are on your own.   I thought that a bit odd.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great place to stay if you're going to Disneyland!
Summary: My family and I Stayed at the Ayers Inn Durring our recent trip to Disneyland.  This hotel is a great value especially for Disney visitors as they serve a full complimentary breakfast each morning (we were so full we just had a small snack at Disneyland and then ate dinner outside of the park).  The rooms are clean while a little small but really you aren't going to be in the room to do much more than sleep and shower if you're in town to visit disneyland.  The shuttle travels to and from Disneyland all morning and each evening until the park closes.  It was prompt and the drivers were nice.  The concierge was very accommodating when we called twice to change our shuttle  departure times.   The only small recommendations I would make to the management would be - invest in a 2nd
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed there for 3 nights for our Disneyland trip and it was the best!!! Service was great the breakfast was awesome and the shuttle was even better... The driver did not let us put our stuff in he gladly folded up our heavy double stroller and put it away for us!!! These people truly know how to put the customer first!!! Even though the hotel was 2 miles away we still had no problem gettin to Disneyland
Manager Response: none

Summary: We used this Hotel as a base for L.A and for the price. The rooms were very clean and tidy, bathroom was clean and had a great shower. The staff were very friendly and helped us out when we bought park tickets on-line and they printed them off so that saved us loads. The breakfast was a bit limited and the same every day but was adequate. There a a few places to eat near by and a good shopping complex (The Block)  within a few blocks which has nice restaurants. Good access to the freeway...and the inpending LA traffic, but the hotel offers a shuttle service to near by Disneyland parks. Overall, very good for the price.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: near Chapman University and UC Irvine Medical Center off I-5
Summary: It's an oasis in a giant desert of chains. The great reviews are well deserved which was a relief as we stayed during Carmaggedon weekend after a long trip which included cancelled flights to L.A.   We ordered the superb prime rib entree in the restaurant -- absolutey delicious -- a bistro worth going even if not a hotel guest.  Along the hallway near the elevator, take a look at the framed photos of old SoCal. Be sure to sample the fresh warm chocolate chip cookies at the front desk. There's a cozy fireplace in the lobby with bookshelves. Amazingly, for a hotel full of kids, it was q-u-i-e-t.  Best front desk service of all the CA hotels we stayed in.  Highly recommended for easy access to all points in L.A. and San Diego
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was a fantastic beginning to our trip!  The beds were comfortable, the breakfast was delicious and plentiful and all of the employees were very gracious and helpful.  We especially loved the Disneyland shuttle and would stay again just for that.  There were many other amenities that we appreciated too, such as the handy laundry room and the clean, comfortable pool and hot tub.  So relaxing after a long day at the parks!  Also nice to have a Starbucks right next door.  Thank you to Christine Smith and her staff for a memorable stay!
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband and I, along with our three kids, just came home from our trip & really enjoyed our stay at the Ayres Inn.  The front desk personnel were very friendly & very helpful, the rooms were clean & the beds were very comfortable!  The breakfast in the mornings were good & we all left nice and full. The manager (I did not get her name) walked around during breakfast & was always very friendly & helpful!  We were a little disappointed at the size of the pool, but after reading about the future construction that will take place, I am all the more excited to come back. I have to point out that  this smaller pool certainly did NOT damper our stay at all. The only real negative comment we have is regarding the shuttle service to Disneyland. The fact that it did not run during the
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hubby and I have frequently visited the Ayres Hotel Orange location for the past 3 years due to the proximity to our home and the fact that we do not have a pool in the hot summer months.  We literally make our 1 or 2 night reservations, pack up wine, cheese, fruits, crackers, little i-pod speakers, magazines/books, and sunscreen and hit the road...for the 3 mile trip.  It's a mini-vacay without having to really go anywhere, and the price and hotel accomodations are fantastic.  We use the pool by day, hit the restaurants and movie theater or Lucky Strike Lanes at The Block at night, and then enjoy a good night's sleep on a nice, comfy bed in a perfectly cold air-conditioned room when we're done.  I have to say that we are TREMENDOUSLY DISAPPOINTED with the closure of the big,
Manager Response: Thank you guests for your review; and I have to say that you are indeed correct when saying that the new pool is not as large as the old pool.  The building of a new pool and closing of the old larger pool is the first step in a series of building projects for the Hotel property.  This summer the Ayres Hotel Group will start construction on a new 2-story parking garage next to Best Buy and to the back of the property.  The area where the old pool and lawn are will become a new road with access to/from State College Blvd.  Not having access to/from State College Blvd has been one of our guests long time complaints.  As the new parking structure is being completed the Ayres Hotel Group will also start construction on a new Hotel building to include meeting rooms and a another pool.  I appreciate your disappointment in the size of the new pool, but I hope you keep an eye on our construction progress and return to try the new Hotel and it's pool. Christine Smith - General Manager

Summary Heading: This is a great hotel for a Disneyland trip
Summary: We have stayed at the Ayres Inn on multiple trips to Disneyland and love it.  While the rooms are not the largest we have had, they are clean and comfortable.  The Hotel is located right off of I-5 so getting back to the hotel after a day at the Parks is quick and easy.  We originally chose this hotel because of its location and the amenities it offers.  The breakfast that is offered is very good.  They offer scrambled eggs, pancakes, potatoes, and either sausage or bacon every morning.  They also offer a selection of breakfast cereals, bagels, and fruit each morning.  It is a great way to start the day.  They recently added a new pool and hot tub, and it is great.  We enjoyed going down and sitting in the hot tub at night, and on a few afternoons.  All in all the hotel is a
Manager Response: none

Summary: Well, we checked in on Sunday the 22 for 4 nights.  I was skeptical of some of the negative reviews I have seen and read on the internet.  I have stayed at the Ayres Anahiem in the past and it was wonderful.  This was to be the first time at the Orange location.  The moment we checked in I was comfortable.  The staff greeted us and made sure our accommodations were adequate.  The complaints I read from dirty rooms to runny eggs were unfounded which lead me to believe the people who wrote these negative comments had some personal issues not related to the hotel.  The shuttle was prompt and runs from the morning til 11 a.m. and from 5 p.m. til one hour after the park closing.  My wife goofed and forgot her park ticket, Christine the Manager made arrangements for her on the next
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great place - even when traveling with picky older relatives
Summary: Stayed at the Ayres Inn and booked five rooms for grandparents and other relatives to attend a college graduation.  It was a miracle - NO ONE had a complaint.  Breakfast was good, nice selection for an included perk.  The room was clean and the bathrooms were spotless.  Would definitely stay here again when in So Cal.  People at the desk were very nice and did their best to accommodate a large group checking in all at once.  This hotel is worth checking out!
Manager Response: none

Summary: The staff was so nice to us.  When we first arrived they had fresh cookies at the front desk, we had, had to book a second hotel on the last day of our trip because they were booked because of college graduation, but the Hotel Manager, Christine, kept an eye out for a cancellation and by Tues was able to get us in on Friday and we did not even have to change rooms.  The breakfast was really good, it had a nice variety, we did not swim because it was not warm enough outside.  The TV was outdated but we did not watch much TV we spent most of our time in Disneyland.  The shuttle was great even if we made last minute changes they were very accommodating.  The whole hotel was very clean.  We would definitely go back here again!.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the kind review.  I do have an update on the HOtel's TV situation, I have been promising new flat screens for the last 5 months.  Well I am pleased to say we just received delivery of all new TV's, along with new desks, dressers, lamps and side chairs.  Installation will start June 6th and be completed by June 12th.  Hooray!!!  Christine Smith General Manager

Summary: The front desk guy's and gals were excellent all week.  The breakfast was a nice start to the day, sure the eggs were runny once in a while but everything else was great and there was a great variety of things to eat. Pool area was great , hottub was a little small but nice and warm and clean. Shuttle took a little planning but was a lot better than taking the car and worrying about parking. Lobby was warm and inviting and super clean. Rooms were nice , simple but worked great. T.V's a bit dated , a little low on shower pressure ( but to conserve water i will take it any day). Bed's were comfy and the wife slept like a baby.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Say NO to Ayres, despite what your friends may say
Summary: I went here last March on another vacation with friends to visit attractions and just relax. We normally stay at the Doubletree, but my friends want to go cheap -_- UGHHH i hate them for it. The walls were super thin and it definitely smelled old. I couldn't get a good night's sleep on any of the four nights. Pillows and beds were uncomfortable. Really loud surroundings.  I just recently tried the other Ayres in Anaheim, since my coworker said it was okay there and it turns out, the hotel has a few of the same problems as well. I give up on Ayres as a whole! Never again!
Manager Response: I was quite surprised to read your review about uncomfortable beds and pillow.  The Ayres Dream Sleeper mattresses are specially made for the Ayres Hotel Collection and the down pillows we provide are also of a very high quality.  We consistently receive comments from guests as to what a "great night's sleep" they got at the Hotel.  The Ayres Inn Anaheim also receives those same comments as do all our Ayres Hotels, to the extent we now sell our mattresses to guests becasue of the huge demand.  A good night's sleep is very important to us all to be able to have a productive day.  I would suggest that when you stay at hotel's and do not get a good night's sleep the first night, to ask to try out other mattresses in other rooms of the hotel and select a room with a matressess that is more to your liking.

Summary Heading: Wonderful hotel with great breakfast and friendly staff
Summary: The beds were very comfortable and the bathroom was clean and modern.  The breakfast buffet was great, much better than the usual fare offered at other chain hotels.  In addition, the restaurant is a very good dinner choice, with many delicious selections on the menu.  The dinner hour is very quiet though; few guests taking advantage of this convenient restaurant.  Service was great.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your kind review!  We especially appreciate hearing that you enjoyed our breakfast; and hope to see you in the future!  Christine Smith General Manager

Summary Heading: Decent low priced choice for Disney
Summary: Stayed for 2 nights to go to the Disney Parks and found the hotel to be slightly above average.  I paid $79 a night which is a great deal when you consider you get parking, free internet and a adequate breakfast.  Location is about 5 minutes from Disney parking (we drove ourselves instead of taking free shuttle) and right off the highway.  You can hear hallway noise from your room and an occasional ambulance outside since hotel is across from a hospital.  Room was nicely furnished for this level hotel and staff were helpful when asked.  All in all you can't beat this place for the money if you are just using it sleep.
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know that you appreciate the value of the Hotel.  With so many Hotels near Disneyland charging much more that the Ayres Inn Orange does, it is nice to hear that we can provide value and good service for a very reasonable price.  Christine Smith General Manager

Summary Heading: Room clean but staff is unfriendly and not helpful!
Summary: We stayed at the Ayres in for our trip to disney land on 4/16 thru 4/20. Upon arrival the gentleman at the front desk was very unfriendly. I asked him about the shuttle to Disney and he gave me a piece of paper and told me to call that number. The next night I sent my husband to the front desk to get some extra pillows because our pillows were extremely flat. The man at the desk gave him 2 pillows with no pillow cases on them. When asked where are the pillow cases he replied thats how we give them to people when they want extra. When my husband came back to the room I was not happy. I stormed to the front desk and demanded his supervisor. I explained to him that this is extremely unsanitary. You can not expect us to sleep on pillows with no case and then give them to someone
Manager Response: Thank you very much for posting your comments regarding your stay.  I would like to apologize for the pillow incident as this is not acceptable for the Ayres Inn Orange nor any Hotel with a good reputation for service and cleanliness.  I have changed the procedure as to how extra pillows are delivered to the desk from Housekeeping and have made sure all personnel know that all pillows are to have pillowcases, period.  I do have one front desk employee who at times appears disheveled, he works the audit shift and is disabled.  Due to his disability it is difficult for him to keep his clothes perfectly straight at all times; all other employees during your stay were in their uniforms and looked professional.   The Front Desk staff have all been here a long time and it is very hard for me to believe that any one of them would ask you "not to tell his supervisor";  but you did state that you "stormed' to the desk which may have intimidated him into thinking his job was in jeopardy.  I will be using your letter at our Front Desk meeting this week as an example of how our normal high standard of guest service completely fell apart; and how their interactions with you could have been handled better.  I was on property 2 1/2 days of your stay and I would have hoped you would ask to speak to me, the General Manager, about the difficulties you were experiencing.   My Hotel staff works very hard, and I know that once in a great while errors are made. Errors can be corrected quickly if brought to the attention of management in a timely manner.  Respectfully,  Christine Smith General Manager

Summary: We booked this hotel for a Saturday night because our timeshare started on Sunday.  We couldn't have been happier with our decision to stay here.  The front desk staff was courteous and EXTREMELY helpful!  We found the room to be clean, comfortable, and quiet (we were on the side facing the Wendy's), and the kids took a quick swim in the heated pool, which was very nice.  We didn't take the free shuttle to/from Disney, so I can't comment on that.  But we did take it to our timeshare the next day.  The driver (I believe his name was Jose) was extremely nice and helpful!  He was able to drop us off at our timeshare, since it was on the way to Disneyland.  We had to make a reservation for the shuttle at the front desk.        Breakfast buffet was great!  Much better than we were
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Red Alert!  If you want to have fun, stay away.
Summary: From a cheesy microwaved breakfast with uncooked eggs, my family got sick during our four days at Disneyland.  We basically missed two days at the park.  Then, they are listed with Get-away-today-vacations as having a shuttle to Disneyland.  That's a lie.  Unlike most of the hotels which has a bus or shuttle running all day in 15 or 30 minute increments, you must take a shuttle from 7-11 am and then not til 6 to 11 at night.  My daughter got sick at Disneyland and we had to pay a 20.00 fee for a taxi back to our hotel a few miles away.  Finally, when there was some error regarding the length of stay, I paid another 129.00 to get our stuff out and spend another night.  The hotel is old and has very bad ventilation which may help get people sick faster.  The only thing I think I
Manager Response: Dear Guest I was extremely surprised to read your comments on Trip Advisor and would like to address each of your concerns.  The room you booked through Getaway Today, a 3rd party vendor, was for 4 nights with the 4th night being "free."  The voucher you presented to the Hotel was for check-in on March 27th and check-out on March 31st.  When you did not check-out on the 31st and we saw that you were at Disneyland per the shuttle schedule, we contacted Getaway Today to make sure there was not an error on the part of the Hotel.  Getaway Today stated that you had booked the 4 night special (4th night free); and paid for the 4 night package.  When you returned to the Hotel this was explained to you and we then had to ask for payment for the 5th night.   The shuttle hours are from 7 am - 11 am and from 5 pm to 1/2 hour after closing of the park; not the hours you stated.  Should you have called the Hotel requesting a mid-day shuttle for a sick child, your request would have been immediately accommodated.  I often drive the shuttle mid-day for such requests.  Taxi fares are normally $12, but if you contact me I would be happy to reimburse you for the $20 you spent to get back to the Hotel. Concerning breakfast, I am sorry you felt you became ill due to the breakfast.  I do have to say that we served between 300 and 400 persons per day during the time period you were at the Hotel and no one else reported any ill effects from the breakfast.   Had you reported your illness to Management we would have immediately checked the kitchen and food; but again, no other guests reported any illness.   Our eggs are fresh whole eggs cooked on a grill, not microwaved eggs. I am very sorry your vacation was not what you had hoped for; I wish you had contacted me during your stay so I could have stepped in and help you immediately resolve your issues.  The Hotel did try to contact you but the phone number we had was disconnected.  We asked Getaway Today to contact you to answer questions you may have regarding your booking with them; but they had the same phone as we did.  Respectfully,  Christine Smith General Manager

Summary: I stayed with my son for 10 nights at Ayres and we loved it!  After a couple of nights it started to feel like home.  I enjoyed it much better than the larger chain hotels we've stayed at before. The room was clean and beds were very comfortable.  The complimentary breakfast was excellent.. eggs, bacon, pancakes, cereal, potatoes, fresh fruit salad and bagels was a great way to begin our day.  The manager Christine was always there at breakfast to make sure everyone had everything they needed.   We used their complimentary Disney shuttle to go to and from disney.  The drivers were very friendly and we never had to wait.   My son loved their pool area that we got to use, and we also noticed a new pool being built while we were their.  It was completed just as we were leaving.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Loved this hotel!  The rooms were beautiful and clean, beds were comfortable, nice leather sofa sleeper for the kids, plenty of room to stretch, clean bathroom, nice furniture, friendly staff.  The shuttle to Disneyland was easy to schedule.The complimentary breakfast was amazing!  Pancakes, eggs, sausage/bacon, potatoes, fresh fruit, cereal & milk, toast, bagels/cream cheese, juice, hot cocoa ... the works! The breakfast room got a little crowded toward the end of breakfast hours.  They extended into the adjoining conference room when it was available.  Did a good job of making sure everyone had a place to sit. Very friendly staff.  Can't say enough good things about this hotel!  Would definitely stay again and again!!! :) We told them extended family would be joining us a
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was our first stay at this hotel, what a great deal we booked it with Getaway travel, we definitely would stay here again.  Great location about 2miles from Disney parks, and a block away from The Block at Orange which is a outdoor shopping mall.  We enjoyed the free breakfast buffett that was also part of the great hotel deal, eggs, bacon, link sausage (alternate daily), toast, fruits, cold cereal, coffee, hot choc, orange juice and more.  The beds were comfortable however I found the pillows to be too soft.  Kudos goes to the friendly staff that was so helpful, Luis gave us directions to the closes In and Out burger (our first time to try it) was great and about 10 mins away.  I recommend this hotel and definitely would stay there again.   Aloha from Hawaii.   The
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Fantastic Hotel! Great Rooms... Nice Staff... Near Shopping and Restaurants!
Summary: We stayed here for 4 nights during our Disney-leg of our SoCal vacation and we were not disappointed! We got a killer deal through Expedia and were lucky to get it, as the huge Natural Products Expo was in town, as over 60,000 extra people were crammed into Anaheim while we were there! We cannot recommend this property enough... Nice, comfy, SPACIOUS rooms. Attentive, friendly staff. No hidden 'extra' charges on arrival. Property is a little ways away from Disneyland, but shuttle is handy. Next time, we'll rent a car direct from airport! Live and learn.... Highly recommended!!!!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: FRIENDLY FAMILY HOTEL CLOSE TO DISNEYLAND (VIA FREE SHUTTLE)
Summary: We have been to Disneyland once before and stayed within walking distance of it's main gate but we actually preferred this hotel because of the convenience of the free shuttle bus (which worked well for us), especially at the end of an exhausting day of continuous walking at the parks.  The free breakfast was more than adequate if all you want is a good start to a huge day.  With a great gym, nice pool, free wi-fi, free use of the printer in the lobby and free parking thrown in for good measure, it was perfect for our family of four.  They even offered free cookies at the reception desk in the evenings.  We were concerned that the close proximity to the highway would be noisy, so we asked for a room on the other side of the hotel and it was not an issue.  Even though our stay
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: I can't say enough nice things about this hotel
Summary: We stayed at this hotel while visiting for the NAMM convention. The room was beautiful! It was large and VERY clean. The bed was comfy too! The free breakfast was AMAZING! We couldn't believe the variety and flavor. Eggs, sausage, bacon, potatoes, pancakes, cereal, oatmeal, juice & more! It was always hot and fresh and the serving station was very well maintained & stocked. We had a wonderful experience at this hotel and will definitely be staying here again when we come back! The manager Christine was so accommodating, such a sweet lady! The whole staff was very friendly & helpful! The only complaint I have is the pool area was a little run down & dirty. I took my 3 yr old daughter to the pool for a swim & we were unable to get in because the pool had black stuff on the bottom
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the great review, we all appreciated your comments.  Yes the pool was dirty, high winds blew dirt and dust from the construction site of our new pool into the current "old pool".  Our new pool will be up and running by mid-March we hope.  In the interium the old pool will be operational and clean, except for high wind days.  In this area we sometimes get Santa Ana winds and have to shut down the filtration system until the winds stop blowing debris into the pool; we clean as soon as possible after the winds stop.  Again thanks for your comments!!  Christine Smith General Manager

Summary Heading: Good hotel to stay at for Disneyland Trip.
Summary: We enjoyed our stay at the Ayres Inn Orange.  The room was a comfortable size for my husband and our three year old.  We had a queen sized bed and a sofa that pulled out for my daughter.  The bed was comfortable and the room was clean.  The customer service was great (though we didn't need much.)  The breakfast was nice to have before heading out to Disneyland.  It was convenient to have a shuttle that operated in the morning and evening to take us to Disneyland.  The location is great.. Wendy's next door, Block at Orange within walking distance etc.  My only complaint is there is a medical center across the street and at night we could hear the ambulance sirens going past our room.  Be sure to get a room on the other side of the building.  Overall, it was a great place to stay
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A great place to stay away from the Disney crowds....
Summary: We stayed here for 10 nights in total.  On the first night the aircon wouldn't work, they offered to move us to another room but after 20 hours of flying we just wanted to sleep so they provided us with a fan, a voucher for the onsite restaurant and promised it would be replaced the next day.  It was replaced the next day and we never had any more problems.  We asked for a microwave one day for left overs and it was in our room when we returned from Disney.  It was lovely to have the free shuttle to come and go to Disney as we pleased and the breakfast was nice too, simple but a nice way to start the day. The staff were all lovely, particularly, Julio, Dwight and Luis, and Christine the manager always asked how we were doing and what we were up to for the day.  We would
Manager Response: none

Summary: Was pleasantly suprised when I arrived at the hotel. I believe this hotel deserves to be at least a 4 star. Maybe with the restaurant being updated it would have. Staff was wonderful and very accommodating. Rooms very clean and quiet. I would definately stay here when ever my business takes me there.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Very enjoyable two night stay; will stay again.
Summary: I have stayed in two Ayers Inns' and each time was excellent.  This stay was made pleaseant by the staff, the accomodations, and the property being centerly located. The breakfast is very good as a small bisto/buffet/small eating area that is clean and the guests in general act like a bed and breakfast crowd.         the  " TravelingTucsonans "    who reviewed with a rant, must be  a walking problem wherever she goes.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The shuttle was convenient. The staff was helpful and flexible with the shuttle scheduling. The hot breakfast served until 9:00 am every morning was delicious. The earlier you arrive to eat, the shorter the line. The room was spacious and had a nice view. We did had an interior room, not on a parking lot side of the building. Next to Starbuck's, Wendy's, and Quiznos. Coin laundry so we could wash clothes.  Best accomodations for this price range in Disneyland area.
Manager Response: none
