Summary: Not a classy hotel but dies the trick. Building and rooms need to be updated as they show age (tv in the room is dated!). Shuttle service is great.
Manager Response: Thank you guest, for the comments you posted about the Ayres Inn Orange.  Yes, Yes, our TV's are very very dated.  I am  pleased to let you know that the Hotel is replacing all our TV's with flatscreen TV's and new dressers for them to be place on.  The conversion should be done by the end of this year 2010.  Christine Smith General manager

Summary: I booked a last minute vacation through American Airlines and the Ayres Inn package price was so much less than the ones for the usual chain hotels we stay in (Marriott and Hilton) that we decided to take a chance on the unknown.  Fortunately, we were not disappointed.    It was in a convenient location to 5 and Disney - and since we were doing more than just going to Disney on this trip, it was perfect.  The hotel staff was pleasant, the rooms were clean and the beds were very comfortable.  I was able to immediately fall asleep (of course walking all day had something to do with that too!) which I don't do in most hotels.  We only heard a few people in the hall but never heard sounds through the walls even the hotel was completely booked part of the time we were there.  The
Manager Response: none

Summary: I agree with all the 5 circle ratings that follow. We paid very little using the 3rd night free found on www.GetAwayToday.com website. It requires a prepaid-in-full payment, but the prices include sales and room tax and 5 in a room is allowed there but not on the Ayres website. The breakfast was the same each morning: scrambled eggs, potatoes, pancakes, sausage or bacon, juice, toast and bagels, cold cereals, coffee, milk, tea. The mattresses were great for sleeping. The shuttle was on time for pickups, even at 12:30 a.m. at Disney. There's plenty of free parking. The desk staff very helpful, especially Luis. Beach towels for either the pool (or the beach far away) are free. We're all smiles here!  :)  :)  :)
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: SECURITY ALERT - Read before taking your family here!
Summary: We checked into the hotel late, around 10:30 pm.  I got our room keys and we went up to the room with luggage and sleeping two year old.  I unlocked the door to find the security lock was on (the lock that can only be set from the inside that lets u open the door about an inch).  I knocked to discover they had assigned us to a room that was ALREADY IN USE!!  Luckily, they had that lock on otherwise we would have walked in on sleeping people the room.  This is an unacceptable security lapse.  Do not stay at this hotel.  If that had not happened here's what I would say about the place:  (I booked the hotel with an $80 bid on priceline. Overall I don't think I got my money's worth.)  Pros: Well maintained public areas and decently maintained rooms despite the hotel's apparent age.
Manager Response: Dear Guest Thank you for your review on Trip Advisor.  I am extremely embarrassed and would like to apologize for the security lapse.  I take this matter very seriously and only wish you would have approached me during your stay so as to more quickly resolve your frustration and look into what happened.  I am currently interviewing clerks that worked during this time period to track down how the error occurred and will make any necessary changes to ensure it does not happen again.  Again, my apologies and please do not hesitate to contact me directly as I would like to comp you a room your next stay when you are again in our area.  Christine Smith Ayres Inn Orange

Summary Heading: Very nice rooms, friendly staff, and a good value, but.....
Summary: Very friendly, helpful staff, clean well appointed rooms but the walls are a little "thin" and you can hear TV's in other rooms and people walking in the room above you .   Restaurant is acceptable for "breakfast with the room".   It is also open for dinner, but it is pretty bleak and uninviting for an evening meal.   Very good accomodations for the price point but skip the restaurant.
Manager Response: Dear Guest Thank you very much for your review, I very much appreciate your comments and the opportunity to respond.  Our restaurant open to the public for lunch and dinner is indeed "tired".  I am very happy to let you know that the restaurant will be undergoing a complete renovation from top to bottom in July.  We have finalized a new design concept, new menus and a new operator will begin at the end of June.  The restaurant will be in the  "California Bistro" style with the new Chef being a graduate of the Culinary Institute of America.  We are very excited about the upcoming changes.  Again thank you for your comments. Christine Smith - General Manager

Summary: I used hotwire to book this hotel and had no idea what to expect. Upon entering the lobby I was very pleased. The hotel is basically brand new (you can tell by the cleanliness of the rooms and lobby) Everything is complimentary at the Aryes Inn Orange, too. Everything! Free WiFi internet, Free Breakfast with real eggs, sausage, toast, bagels, pancakes, etc. Free parking, Free toothbrush at the main desk, Check-out is really nice because its noon unlike some other hotel's 10:30 check outs. They shuttle to Disneyland for free, too and even did after-hours to save us the cab ride fare. Make sure you schedule when you want to leave and be picked up, tho. Everyone was really friendly and the staff was great. The price was the most competitive I've seen for a quality hotel. Our
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: One of the BEST hotels I have stayed in!!
Summary: The Ayres Inn Orange is a great hotel with top notch customer service!! While it isn't "close" to Disneyland, it is a mere 2 miles away which is nothing.  The hotel is in great shape and housekeeping did a FABULOUS job on making sure our rooms were clean and tidy!   Since we were travleing with children, breakfast was very important.  The FREE hot breakfast was awesome and tasted very good! We used the shuttle once and there was no problem at all.  It was also nice to be right across from The Block at Orange where there is shopping and good places to eat.   We had a great time and the staff of the Ayres Inn Orange just made it that much better! I bang for my buck could not have been any better! We are a fan and will stay here again next time!!
Manager Response: Dear Guest Thank you so much for your kind review!  I appreciate the time you took to give us a review and appreciate your patronage, hope to see you again in future! Christine Smith General Manager

Summary: We booked this hotel as a last resort and were very happy with the rooms.  For our family we booked 2 rooms and then split up the kids.  We had young and tween kids.  Upon check in we asked for ground floor and connecting rooms.  (ground floor because the kids jump and run and make noise for downstairs patrons~ugg) Christopher, the desk clerk was very gracious and got us rooms across the hall from each other...this worked great!  Christopher was our "go-to" guy from then on.  My husband is hearing impaired and would go talk to Christopher at any problem, questions or any time he needed a break from the kids.  Christopher was great. As previous reviews mentioned the bathrooms were indeed small.  However, you could put your make up on using the mirror and sitting on the toilet.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great Hotel at a Great Price
Summary: I did a lot of research before choosing to stay at Ayres Inn Orange.  I wanted a  clean hotel, decent amenities, for a good price.  What I got was an exceptional hotel at an exceptional price.  I thought the pictures of the hotel were pretty accurate.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  The pool was clean and nice.  The hot tub wasn't hot enough, but I've found that they seldom are.  We stayed 6 nights while going to Disneyland,  SeaWorld, the beach.  The room was clean and roomy.  The shuttle to and from Disneyland was great, as was the breakfast.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: 4 Star quality in a 2 star price
Summary: I really couldn't have been more pleased with this hotel.  A cab to the hotel from SNA ran about $28+tip.  We got into the room and were blown away.  Beautifully decorated and nice quality.  Good mattresses and plenty of room.  There was a great hot buffet breakfast in the morning and the staff was more than accommodating.  We traveled with children ranging from 19 months to 12 years old.  We all really enjoyed the hotel.  The free shuttle to Disney made it that much better.  We got the hotel through getawaytoday.com and got a great deal at $99/night with the 3rd night free.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Actually in 2004 but that was not in an option
Summary: Wonderful room. Wonderful service. Garden like area in back. Absolutely gorgeous. Felt like I was visiting royalty.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Travelers considering the Ayres in Orange need to be aware that their free Disneyland shuttle does not operate from 11 am - 5pm.  This is not advertised on their website, nor do they offer the information when you call.  If you ask them if they have a Disneyland shuttle, they simply reply "yes", without offering its hours, or the fact that it is run on a reserved basis only.  There's no going downstairs and waiting for the shuttle that runs on a continuous basis....you have to reserve a time with the front desk every time you want to go to or from Disneyland.  This makes for a major incoveneience when traveling with small children.  Also, our aiport shuttle was scheduled to pick us up at the hotel at 3:20 pm on our last day, so I had to find alternate transportation from
Manager Response: The guest made their reservations through a vacation package website.  When we were notified that the website did not have our correct shuttle hours, we had the site correct our Hotel's information immediately.  The hotel takes this guest's comments seriously and have also reminded our staff to clearly communicate our shuttle hours to all callers inquiring about our shuttle to Disneyland. General Manager

Summary: Rooms were quite big, staff was friendly. Free wi-fi and free breakfast plus free parking is hard to beat for the price. Even though I was a business traveller rather than part of a family going to Disney, the hotel was quite comfortable with a small workout room (1 each of elliptical, bike, treadmill) and computer with printer and internet in the lobby that was usually available.   The free breakfast was perfectly adequate. There's also a Starbucks within walking distance and a mall with movie theater and Borders bookstore if you walk across the street.   Caution: if you are in a room with adjoining doors to the next, you can hear pretty much everything going on in the next room.
Manager Response: none

Summary: It was over 100 degrees in Orange,Ca when we went. We were placed on the Sixth Floor (the top most floor) (IT WAS HOT AS HELL) . The first thing that we noticed was that the lobby and hall ways were not air conditioned . Our room looked like something out of the early 80's . The carpet was way past well worn and was bunching up. The furniture and appliances looked as though they were added as an after thought and it was very hard to find an electrical outlet. Overall, the room had a crowded, stuffy, and cheap feel to it. DEFINITELY NOT WORTH THE MONEY I PAID TO STAY THERE.  We were offered an alternate room on a lower floor but after taking a look at it, I could see that it wasn't any better.  To add insult to a terrible experience, we were charged $4.00 for a bottle of drinking
Manager Response: Dear Guest You are indeed correct, it was well over 100 degrees In Orange during your stay, an uncommon heat wave for our area.   While our lobby and hallway air conditioners were on, they could not keep up with the heat.  Many of our room air conditioners also were over taxed and we have been replacing old HVAC units with new on a monthly basis for the last 6 months.To clarifly you remodel comment; the Hotel did do a room renovation in 2007, and were in the process of doing a complete gutting of bathrooms and remodeling as well.  All bathrooms were completed in October 2009.  The Hotel has also replaced many of our room carpets, and continue to do so.  Thank you for your comments and our apologies that we were unable to keep the Hotel cool during your stay. Christine Smith - General Manager

Summary: I travel all over the country on work staying primarily at Hilton chains. I found this hotel to be good value for a 2 night stay in LA and Disneyland with the family - friendly checkin - friendly and prompt shuttle service (not always the norm..) - good breakfast (not great like the Embassy suites, but I am not paying anywhere that price) - good decor - spacious rooms  Highly recommend it for Disneyland travel.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Another Good Review for the Ayers Inn Orange!
Summary: My family stayed here for 10 days the last week of July while on vacation.  We booked the hotel with our flight and rental car on Expedia.  Check-in was a breeze.  The room was adequate size and was kept very clean during our entire stay.  The bathroooms have been renovated in each room and were very modern.  The front desk staff provided excellent customer service.  As others have mentioned, the breakfast is a great way to start the day, and the shuttle to Disney is very convenient.  We liked the location as it made it easy to get to everything we had planned to do while in Orange (Disneyland, Knott's Berry Farm, Hollywood, Beverly Hills, Santa Monica, Newport and Huntington Beaches, Dana Point Whale Watching, and much more.  We ate at Cafe Lucca which is in old downtown orange
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed at the Ayres Inn July 5--9. Choose this place because the Disneyland Hotels were a bit more expensive. Paid 76.00 per night thru Hotels.com. Requested a groud floor when making reservations, being smokers didn't want to travel far to smoke. Granted. Room was med sized, suggest not asking for the King & sofa bed, get the 2 queens. Sofa bed thin and hard. Choose this hotel because of the free breakfast 6-9, not just a the usual Cont. Brk, but the whole works. Scrambled eggs, meat, cereal, fruit, toast, bagels, pancaks, ect...... That helped with getting feed before Disneyland. Another reason was the free shuttle too and from the Disney parks. Didn't want to pay for parking, the theme park tickets were bad enough. Family of 4, 2 kids 8 & 10. Bought the citypass 3 day Hooper.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at the Ayers Inn Orange for 3 nights and 4 days.  We had room 316 during our stay.  The check-in was fast and very professional.  Check out was the same.  Each time we passed by the reception area we were always greeted with a smile and a warm good morning or good evening.  The free breakfast was always fresh and very good.  Our room was always clean when we returned from Disneyland each day.  It wasn't a problem going down to the 3rd floor for ice.  Our room was very quiet, no neighbor noise.  The only time we heard road noise was when we opened the window slighty. We used the free shuttle to and from Disneyland on 2 of our days there.  Both drivers were very nice. Due to the cool weather and time we didn't use the pool.  We did look at the pool area and it looked
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: SUPER friendly and helpful service... GOOD location... OVERALL impressed!
Summary: My boyfriend and I checked out of the hotel yesterday after a three-night stay. I found a great deal at getawaytoday.com so we got a very reasonable rate.  Initially, I was planning on booking our stay at the Ayres Hotel on Katella (across from the Honda Center) due to the glowing reviews on TripAdivsor, but getawaytoday.com only books with this Ayres site on Chapman near the Block at Orange and the UCI Medical Center. I forgot to verify the addresses when we arrived at John Wayne airport, so when I told the cab driver at the airport that we were going to the Ayres, he took us to the one on Katella. Once there, I realized we were at the Chapman location and felt completely stupid for the mix-up, but the staff at the Katella site was extremely friendly and promptly arranged for
Manager Response: none

Summary: The place is great. They have shuttle service to Disneyland. It's a 10min ride. And if u wanna go back to the hotel earlier than the time agreed, just give them a call. And it's a walking distance to The Block at Orange!! Love that place. Breakfast was gd. Not much variety but gd enough. This is not a 5 star hotel but their service is! And with wifi available in the rooms and lobby, i couldnt ask for more. I need internet!! If only they could lower their rates slightly, it'll be great.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Some room amenities poorly planned and designed
Summary: Ayres Inn is conveniently located to UCI Medical Center, however some room features miss the mark.  The toilet is the lowest we have ever encountered, and appears to be designed for people under 5'2".  With a seat just 14" from the floor, it makes it very difficult to use for those of us over age 65.  There is a small refrigerator, but no microwave.  The blankets and bedspreads are very thin; it was necessary for us to ask for additional blankets.    If you stay at the Ayres Inn, be sure to have the Country Breakfast at Hof's Hut, just down the street on W. Chapman.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good spot for the family for Disneyland
Summary: First time guest here. Worked well for our family with two teenage boys but we did bring out own foldout cot so they could each have their own sleeping space (sofabed + cot).  Shuttle to DL is convenient that it doesn't stop by any other properties, but doesn't run 11 am - 5 pm and does run 7:30 to half hour after the park closes. The 7:30 start means you can't get there for a magic morning early opening when that is 7 am.  The bathrooms don't have fans but they will be added in the next remodel.  There were not enough electrical outlets, good thing we brought out own power strip.  The refrigerator was good to have and used the laundry almost every night. They do sell laundry soap box for a $1 at the front desk.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I booked this hotel after much research for a family trip to Disneyland with my 3 daughters.  Prior to booking, spoke with the hotel manage for at least 15 minutes and he answered all my questions.  I booked through getawaytoday.com because I love their package deals.  I wanted a clean, comfy, family friendly hotel that offered a free hot breakfast, free parking and free shuttle to Disneyland.  Why?  Because all those extra things can add up to high dollars quickly!   Ayres Inn Orange was wonderful!  The food was yummy every morning (nothing like starting off a day before Disneyland with a nice hot breakfast and a good cup of Java) and  it was offered in the attached restaurant so there was always plenty of room to sit.  The food was REAL, not powdered eggs and previously frozen
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Not better the second time around
Summary: Last October we stayed at the Ayres in Orange and had the best time.  However, it was really windy and the pool was closed the whole week we were there.  This October we were there again and the first  three days the pool was closed.  Wednesday it was open, my girls were in the pool 30 minutes and told they need to leave, they were putting chemicals in the pool.  Tuesday we get a call front the front desk that we need to change rooms on a different floor, well that was a little disrupting but made the change.  It seemed everyday after the maid made our room we had to call for something she forgot to leave.  Bathroom paper, soap, clean cups,  and coffee. Some of the guests seem to forget that there were children present, somewhat loud drinking and inapproprate language. I have to
Manager Response: Dear Guest I apologize for overlooking your review.  I am really sorry that the Hotel had to close our pool due to the Santa Ana winds during your stay.  It is definitely something we only do when absolutely necessary and per the local Health code.  When we get these especially high winds, we are unable to keep the debris from getting into the pool and in turn clogging the filter system.  In October of 2007, our entire area dealt with the fallout of the Santiago Fire and high winds and in October 2008 we again experienced the high winds.  I also apologize that your daughters had to leave the pool when we had to treat it for a "kiddie accident".  I would also like to apologize for the maid service, your experience was not our normal exception service we are so proud of. Christine Smith - General Manager

Summary: I have stayed in many Disney area hotels & motels, and this was the best. The room and beds were very comfortable. The staff was professional and polite. There was a free buffet breakfast (yes, the selection is a bit limited, but MORE than adequate and FREE!) and NEVER in 6 DAYS did I have trouble finding a table in the dining room.  There was also afternoon wine and snack. The shuttle was prompt and courteous. Several days we went out at 7-8AM and came back at noon, and ALWAYS our room was already made up!  High on my list is how quiet a property is: the Ayers was very quiet and you couldn't even tell if the adjacent rooms were occupied. Nothing turns me off at a hotel like hearing the TV next door or noisy neighbors...this DID NOT HAPPEN here, as it has in every other Disney
Manager Response: none

Summary: The Ayres Inn Orange was a good price for what we were looking for (hotel, not motel, with nice amenities under $100 a night).    I booked 6 rooms.  Everyone enjoyed their stay except for a few things.  1.  shuttle service.   2.  comforter and blankets  3.  room 600 4.  3 Palms Cafe 5.  pool closes at 10pm.   there are other things (sirens, loud traffic, parking, enter/exit the hotel from main road) that is more likely a probablem from poor city planning versus the hotel chain's own doing.    i'd stay here again.    here are the positives:  close to starbucks!!!   buffet meal  decor friendly front desk staff free internet.  (life save cause i had to work on my laptop at 2am after coming in from amusement parks, so this was nice. microwave and laundry on 2nd and 4th floor
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have used this Inn several years now for our annual family Disney trips. Although the price and location are a plus it does NOT have a Family friendly environment any more.  On our last two stays 2007 and 2008 the majority of guests seemed to be loud, inconsiderate, and rowdy young men or couples more interested in partying, drinking, hanging out in the parking lot, yelling in the hallways and rooms till 3AM than family activities or going to Disney.  The breakfast experience also was very unpleasant, with this same loud and rowdy crowd and non-hygienic conduct at the buffet line; taking food and putting it back etc. not a place I want my family to eat at.  Overall not a place we want to spend a family vacation at anymore.  The place attracts the wrong crowd.  Next trip we
Manager Response: none

Summary: Having stayed three times previously in the three different Anaheim hotels, the Ayers was a real little gem.  The staff are the friendliest (if I’m allowed to use Disney speak), the rooms are very clean, of a high standard, even the sheets on the bed are thick and snowy white.  The breakfast buffet is excellent.  I have nothing but praise for this hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very poor ventilatioon in the bathroom.  It's an old property, there was no fan in the bathroom for the room we stayed!   After someone used the bathroom, the smell stayed forever, because they had nowhere to go.  Can't really open windows in the room.  If you leave the bathroom door open, the whole room would smell!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed for 7 nights with my family of four (two rooms). I originally booked two 2-queen rooms, but I requested a change to one king and one 2-queen when I arrived, and my request was granted with no problems whatsoever. The rooms were nice, the staff was very friendly and helpful, and the overall feel of the place was that it was a little dated, but still a great place, especially when compared to the cost of many of the nearby hotels.  I made use of the free high-speed internet. I was on the 5th floor, and I was just out of reach of the wireless service they provide, so I had to plug in to the wired service. My kids on the 3rd floor had no problem with wireless service.  I used the heated outdoor pool once, but it was a fairly cool evening, and all I needed was a quick dip.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel...TINY bathroom that doesn't work for families....
Summary: Nice property and "cozy" hotel feeling but if you are traveling with a family be warned:  the bathroom only has room for ONE person and that person has to be standing to close the door.  Cruise ships have bigger bathrooms than this facility....  Which creates a problem when everybody is getting ready to head out the door for a day at Disneyland.  Otherwise the hotel is very nice. The breakfast is a hot buffet and provides choices that suit a wide range of tastes.  The beds are comfortable, TVs large, internet is free [both wireless and wired], staff pleasant, housekeeping staff responsive, and in general a nice 3 star hotel.  It is located across the street from UCI Medical Center so there is background noise of ambulances and nearby freeway.  The pool is neat and clean and has
Manager Response: none

Summary: We arrived on a Thursday for a trip to Disneyland, Universal Studios and Six Flags. Hotel was in a great location, just off the freeway. Lots of nearby shopping and dining. The hallways were under renovation while we were there, but we never saw anyone working on them. The staff was friendly during the trip. We ate the breakfast buffet each morning. It was the same thing each day, slimy eggs, potatoes and sausage, cold cereals, bagels, toast, oj, coffee. There is limited seating at times, so the earlier you can get down there, the better! Overall, a great value and we would stay there again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Not the best Ayres Propert, but decent
Summary: I stay with the Ayres quite often as I have come to trust the brand and know what I am getting for the money. This hotel isnt as nice as the rest of their properties but is still a good value for the money and a nice clean safe hotel.  The decor is typical Ayres, rather baroque and gaudy but functional and newer. The bed is comfortable and the location is pretty good, close to the Block in Orange as well as across the street from UCI medical.   I would definately stay here again as it is one of the nicer hotels in the area and is far enough away from Disney to avoid the congestion yet there are many dining options in the area.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Definitely a clean, well maintained property.  Best thing is the staff  which is friendly and helpful.  Room rates are reasonable and location is good.  Only slight negative is the bathroom is relatively small.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I had previously stayed at the Ayres in Seal Beach and had a great experience there.  So, when my husband and I were looking for a romantic weekend getaway near our home, we though we'd give the Ayres Orange a try.  Unfortunately, this  property is an older hotel that the Ayres chain purchased and renovated, and it really isn't that nice.  It seemed to be the go-to spot for families with very young children visiting area tourist attractions, like Disneyland, for the weekend.  So, if that's your bag, this hotel might be for you.  They were renovating the hallways when we were there, so things were sort of in transition.  Overall, really mediocre.  I wouldn't stay there again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Servicable, friendly, decor a little tacky
Summary: Stayed here during New Years Eve while visiting Disneyland, and had a lovely time sleeping.  There is a hospital across the street so I heard a helicopter once or twice in the night.  The wireless was down when I arrived but was up by the time I returned from Disneyland the next day.  Room was clean.  Breakfast was hot, but not my cup of tea most days.  Ended up grabbing a bagel and cream cheese twice, and had pancakes once.  The shuttle is serviceable, but must be scheduled in advance.    Most of the front desk staff is helpful.  There was a tour group -- maybe two of them -- here during my stay that seemed to overwhelm the staff.  The decor in the hallways seems to feature local landmarks.  The floor I was on had pictures donated by the folks at the Crystal Cathedral,
Manager Response: none

Summary: After reading several reviews, on multiple sites, I decided to trust the majority of reviews on Tripadvisor (I always discount the highest and lowest reviews and rely on the the majority of the rest) and booked the Ayres Inn Orange as part of a package through Priceline.  We were not at all dissappointed.  We got exactly what we expected.  A smaller hotel, clean, comfortable, and in good repair.   There is no question that this facility has seen better days, but clean and comfort are paramount to us.  The daily breakfast added value (basic, but better than continental).  The staff were all very friendly and we had no issues with service at all.  Our room was very comfortable for my wife, 9 y.o. son, and I.   The maid service was excellent.    We were here over New Years and had
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Don't waste your time or money
Summary: My husband and I stayed at Ayres Inn Orange for four nights over the Christmas holiday.  We chose the hotel due to its close location and shuttle to and from Disneyland and the fact that it billed itself as a boutique hotel.  Well, it is not what I consider a boutique, perhaps a second hand store is a better description.    Staff: Rude and unattentive.  Tony (front desk staff) hung the phone up on me when I coughed slighlty.  We were never asked how are stay was, or given any customer service. Shuttle:Does not run between the hours of 11am and 5 pm-this is NOT advertised.  Also when setting a reservation, they are not accomodating and rude.  The shuttle drivers are nice and helpful but forget about it if you need help from the hotel staff. Staff: Cleaning staff entered room when
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our stay at Ayres Inn, Orange, was fantastic.  We were able to get away from the busyness of Disneyland, yet it only took about 10 minutes to get to the park.  Our continental breakfast was always hot,  there was wine and chips in the evening, Starbucks and Wendy's were next door.  We had the pool to ourselves most evenings. One of the best selling points for our family was the NO SMOKING policy.  It was so nice to not even smell smoke.  The staff was very helpful and polite.  We will definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Very friendly and helpful but just a little too much traffic noise
Summary: The nice thing about the Ayers is that it isn't one of the 'cookie cutter 'hotels. There are some nice touches (such as the happy hour of free, seemingly unlimited, serve yourself, wine and nibbles)!  The lounge was a bit smaller and more cramped than the photos suggested but was fine for our purposes.  The staff were very friendly and when we asked for directions to a local restaurant, the front desk clerk disappeared into the back office and came back a few minutes later with a map AND detailed Mapquest directions, which were really useful.  We were on business but on the spur of the moment decided to go to the theme park. The hotel has a free return shuttle service and they offer twilight tickets at a reduced price. However, as the park closed at 8pm that evening it wasn’t
Manager Response: none

Summary: My family & I totaling of 8 stayed over 1 week at Ayres Inn, Orange county. We jus loved it. The rooms are clean & quiet. The service is excellent & the staff is quite friendly. They offer free breakfast in the morning, mostly the same food veryday, but it didn't bother me too much. We also enjoyed the pool a great deal, not too many people & well maintenance. You would receive more than what you paid for as compared to other  hotels. I would recommend for everyone.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I recently stayed here with my teenaged niece and nephew, and we were all delighted with the hotel and its staff.  Our room was lovely and clean, the breakfast buffet was great, the grounds were pristine, and the free shuttle to Disneyland was a huge perk.  Having stayed at all of the Disney resorts, I have to say that the Ayres Orange is comparable in quality and far superior in value (definitely a huge savings over anything Disney offers).  Also, while we were there, it was very quiet and calm---no rowdy adults or kids running amok.  The quick check-in was also a nice change of pace from the bigger hotels I’ve visited in Anaheim/Orange.  Other nice touches include a laundry room (neat and clean), a workout room, barbecue grills in the courtyard, and a computer terminal in the
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Is there an RA in the house?  Dorm City...LOL!
Summary: Well...I searched all hotels in the LA/Anaheim area for a trip we planned in July...This one seemed to have the most bang for your buck...I can say that the Hotel is decent...no real complaints, but it is not as nice as the pictures and brochures reflect...I kind of felt like I was staying at a dorm facility...the rooms are small and the ceilings are fairly low...the furnishings are nice but way too many of them in that little room...the bathroom was very small and no vent, so it steams up easily...the bed was fairly comfortable for a hotel bed....having a fridg in the room was a nice feature....having laundry facilities on the 4th floor was nice as well (decent prices to use the washer/dryer for a hotel)...the elevator is teeny tiny...the lobby is pleasant, but much smaller
Manager Response: none

Summary: My wife and I stayed at Ayres Orange for two nights when we were in town for a friend's wedding. The hotel was very clean. The water pressure in the shower was excellent, and the bed (especially the pillows) was comfortable. The pool was also very clean. Check in and check out were nice and easy. The staff was friendly, and there were fresh baked cookies (chocolate chip) in the lobby in the afternoon. I overheard a guest ask for peanut butter cookies and the lady at the front desk called the attached restaurant to have them make a batch. When driving, it is a little cumbersome getting out of the hotel, since it requires a U-turn to get onto the main road, but it is very close (within walking distance) to an outdoor mall, with several restaurants. In all I was satisfied with the
Manager Response: none

Summary: We just returned from our summer vacation in California. We absoulty loved our stay. Our room was Clean, they have great beds and absoulty loved the pillows; both were nice and comfortable. They had a hot breakfast buffet everyday which is really nice and huge timesaver.  And they provide free shuttle service to Disneyland daily which saves you $ on parking. I never had the opportunity to use the pool or enjoy the cocktail hour, but I am sure I would not have been disappointed. I really enjoyed our stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hello, My Husband,daughter and I stayed here and the stay was NICE. The staff was VERY FRIENDLY, HONEST AND HELPFUL. We were near a lot of restaurants, etc. Disneyland only 2miles. HOT breakfast every day. I suggest that you bring your own comfortable pillows, the bathroom in our room didn't have a vent fan and the room is smaller than what it looks online but clean everyday. The incidentals charges were  high.. $125 to be exact for a non smoking room and We weren't told this before booking and our room was prepaid almost $850 for the week for a King suite. I also suggest that you come down for breakfast before 7:30am as the dining area gets over crowded after that and seating is limited. Summary: We spent five nights at the Ayres Inn Orange and were very pleased.  The rooms and the bathrooms were not large but were adequate, clean and well equipped.  The pool area was lovely and well maintained.  It was a  bonus to have a breakfast buffet each day and happy hour on the weekdays, and being able to walk to "The Block" shopping and entertainment district was a plus.  The only negative comment we have is that the shuttle bus didn't run in the afternoons and that was when we would have liked to return from Disneyland for a break.  The staff that we dealt with were polite and hospitable and the shuttle bus drivers were particularly good.   We would not hesitate to stay there again.

The worst thing they did was tell the shuttle driver to wait for another family who had planned to go a half an hour later than us. The family decided not to go after we waited (we had a 7:00 reservation to leave, there's was at 7:30) We ended up missing our early entry at Disney and got NO apology. Summary Heading: A decent room and management that knows how to solve problems
Summary: We stayed at the Ayres in Orange for one night over Parent's Day at my son's college in Orange. The hotel room was of average size, the bed was very comfortable, and the bathroom was clean. Generally, that's all we ask for (along with a decent price from somewhere like Priceline or Travelocity). This time, however, at 6 AM or 7 AM in the morning, they started jackhammering the pavement outside our room. We had checked in late the night  before, and this was just a nightmare. I expected a "who cares" attitude at the desk based on reviews that I had read here, but when we checked out, the terrific manager heard about our problem and totally refunded our stay through Travelocity. I couldn't believe it. This is a quality operation, and I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Summary Heading: Good Value!!! No resort fees !!!Big breakfast!!!!!Friendly!!!
Summary: We got the wrong room when we arrived, but the mistake was quickly fixed. My guy's are big eaters and found the free breakfast good and plentiful. The pool is not exciting, but for the price it is nice.Also you pay less tax in Orange than in Anaheim and no resort fees. We found that with the close parking  we had a lot less walking to do than most hotels.The room service was just so so... we opted for fast food(convieniently located next door.) My husband enjoyed sitting in the lobby and enjoying their complimentary wine and cheese. My son enjoyed the free fresh baked cookies nightly. We will stay there again in 2006 and save over $2000.00 from when we stayed at the Disney properties, sorry Mickey.

They've even retrofitted the rooms with fans over the area, to try to help the situation.  The rooms are old and rundown (we were travelling in a large party, so I saw a number of rooms.) The pool area is right next to the freeway--very noisy and irritating.  The worst part is the service--or lack thereof.
